After lunch, we roamed around Chinatown. Even in the midday, there was no shortage of live music and other performances on street. My friend offered local delicacies including beverages and pair of cake in yellow and pink colour representing reunion of two families while tying the knot in Chinese culture. We would have spent not more than an hour and half in Chinatown having lunch and roaming around in the midst of Saturday afternoon but I will cherish the experience and company of my Chinese friend for many years to come. That is the beauty of having a local friend who is generous enough to take you around selflessly.

Fun Markets.title: Fun Markets
Fun Markets.body: Fun markets to visit if you like the market scene shopping . You get what you pay for in these type of markets . While they haggle with you the vendors are not rude if you walk away. Shouldn’t pay more than 10 ringit for the trip out there if it is not busy . It does cost more in the peak traffic period

PETALING STREET / CHINA TOWN.title: PETALING STREET / CHINA TOWN
PETALING STREET / CHINA TOWN.body: This was bank next to our Hotel Ancasa and as soon as we reached and had refreshed we were excited to explore it. This was my first China Town experience and not bad at  all. There are duplicate purses and handbags and everything else in shopping items. Some of the variety is ahead of Mumbai and so if looking for gifting can get a good bargain and that too the latest variety. It is a four way street like a plus sign. There are hawkers foodstuffs that are generally non veg and the local people like them. I had never seen such food items before. The clothes were not really cheap as the Ringgit currency to India when calculated. But you can bargain at some stalls and some stalls will say no bargaining at all.

Typical asian market.title: Typical asian market
Typical asian market.body: A few street side food joints seem OK but hygiene is in doubt so end up eating at KFC nearby. Its no more China market. Cheap Chinese products were sold by Bangladeshi and Pakistani ppl. Good place for unreliable, non durable and economical items. Location I'd walking from pasar seni metro station and same can cover 2-3 more tourist spots nearby Chinatown.

More like \"Foreign workersTown\".title: More like "Foreign workersTown"
More like \"Foreign workersTown\".body: There are a lot of foreign workers there compare to Chinese and they are all selling faker so DO NOT buy anything there (besides food / beverages). For those who wants to feel the culture / take photographs, I suggest you visit during day time or it will be too crowded at night.

Chinatown-fake goods.title: Chinatown-fake goods
Chinatown-fake goods.body: Full of stalls selling fake products. Nice place for bargain, if fake products is what you need to buy. Pretty good restaurants nearby.

fake products market.title: fake products market
fake products market.body: Full of stalls selling fake products. Nice place for bargain, if fake products is what you need to buy. Pretty good restaurants nearby.

Fun and crowded.title: Fun and crowded
Fun and crowded.body: A fun place to visit, especially in the evening. We didn't do any shopping, but if you're looking for cheap knock offs, this is the place.

a good place to buy different things.title: a good place to buy different things
a good place to buy different things.body: really interesting place . there are many shops full of different staffs which you can buy. luggage prices and qualities are good. you can find any thing to buy and there are two beautiful temples at next street.

Just be alert on this area.title: Just be alert on this area
Just be alert on this area.body: went there with family, shopping and sightseeing.. quality are at low but that's consider what you paid is what you get.

'Genuine Fakes'.title: 'Genuine Fakes'
'Genuine Fakes'.body: If you're looking for a bargain, this is the place to go!! High quality, replicas of designer goods!! Don't be afraid to haggle!!

rip off central.title: rip off central
rip off central.body: a great atmosphere and nothing else - Stalls full of tat and fake goods touts every 3 yards and a pickpockets paradise

evening visit - hideous place.title: evening visit - hideous place
evening visit - hideous place.body: Streets full of touts selling the same fake goods, street cafes selling way overpriced fried rice to hipsters and wannabe travellers who think they are being "authentic" rip off taxis.  Go daytime and eat first

Solo Visit in daytime.title: Solo Visit in daytime
Solo Visit in daytime.body: I made a revisit since my last 2 years ago. Perhaps not all the stalls are opened just a few days after the Chinese New Year The dealers are mostly Non Malaysians and the haggling is more like heckling. The stalls all sells similar items. It has definitely lost the sparkle and fun as in the past. Go t the Central Market nearby then visit the malls. It’s a waste of my time

Great experience.title: Great experience
Great experience.body: A must visit when in KL. Can get food deals when you bargain. Best to go in the morning. Has good food stalls. Properly check goods when taking. An experience on its own.

Heritage not to missed.title: Heritage not to missed
Heritage not to missed.body: I visited on the Chinese New Year week so it was packed and super happy bue year is for shopping. All the fakes you dream of are there.Take your time, if you’re going to do fake at least fake it amazingly:-)

Thought this was part of Chinatown.title: Thought this was part of Chinatown
Thought this was part of Chinatown.body: No Chinese to be seen just lots of Indians selling the same stuff over and over again,watches ,tee shirts ,handbags baseball hats     And any crap you can think of.My advice go across the road into central market,air con ,clean and tidy and some very nice craft and local wear at reasonable prices and no stupid haggling.

Probably better if youre with company.title: Probably better if youre with company
Probably better if youre with company.body: Got here by myself and didn't like it. It was really busy and if you stand still to have a look they immediately come over which is normal off course. Wouldn't recommend going here by yourself

CHINA TOWN KUALA LAMPUR.title: CHINA TOWN KUALA LAMPUR
CHINA TOWN KUALA LAMPUR.body: We had gone to Kuala Lampur in our far east group tour and the Hotel Ancasa where we stayed was just next to CHINA TOWN. We were really excited about this and as soon as we had finished dinner we went for a stroll to explore the street. They explained us that it is a 4 way street and where all the four ends would come out at. Our tour guides also gave us the written address of our Hotel so that if we need to take a taxi from another end then also we would come back to Hotel safely. The street sells all different items from purses to clothes goggles watches and lots of stuff. But for us the Ringitt currency when calculated it was not as cheap as we had imagined Chin Town to be. Many shops were not ready to bargain at all. there was roadside food stalls. also note that this place was not so clean. due to food stalls there was lot of trash in the corners of the street and ditches and puddles.

China town Cheap prices.title: China town Cheap prices
China town Cheap prices.body: I you want to make shopping and you have a limited budget go for China town where you can find many products with good quality and cheap price, but you have to take care every time the seller will put high price and you should negotiate to the max. China town surrounded by many touristic places like central market and etc.. There are a free map in central Market in Reception which will help you to see the area there.

Nothing much!.title: Nothing much!
Nothing much!.body: Maybe it was not my choice. I don't know why it is super famous there. Decoration was pretty good and some performances which we could not see. It's just a local Chinese market where you can bargain and buy things which are everywhere in the world. No unique or traditional stuff. I found only bags and cloths everywhere.

Don\u2019t bother.title: Don’t bother
Don\u2019t bother.body: See reviews for China Town for more info. Either way, don’t bother. If you’re looking for shopping go to Central Market instead — it is air conditioned and has better products.

Boring and hot . Cheap imitations !.title: Boring and hot . Cheap imitations !
Boring and hot . Cheap imitations !.body: Didn't find the stalls exciting;  all were selling similar low quality imitation bags, shoes, clothes etc. Went in the day so it was very hot. Not a long street and most shops in the shophouses on both sides were not opened yet. Went to patronise a popular Chinese restaurant famous for their Hokkien noodle located at 49 Jalan petaling. Had difficulty with getting a ride back from there using Grab as the Driver could not locate us ( despite us waiting at a prominent spot) and the driver cancelled the call after making us wait for almost 20 minutes. Easier to use the taxi service opting for meter read charges. Found Chinatown in many other countries to be more impressive and interesting.

Real Chinatown behind market.title: Real Chinatown behind market
Real Chinatown behind market.body: Around the counterfeit market florishing on Petaling street remains another, authetic neighbourhood to explore. Many shops sell all kinds of Chinese items like bamboo shoots in pots, red and gold interior decoration, beautifully painted New Year cards. Hidden away by the stalls is still one real old time pharmacy, where I buy my yearly supply of Yin Chiao tablets, a wonder remedy for common winter colds. The hardest working man in Chinatown bakes pancakes 7 days a week all year around and has been doing this for decades. I asked if all his children were doctors and lawyers, but he only admitted one engineer. Semi precious jewellery is sold in an insence filled room, where men sit huddled over their merchandise. I was lucky to find the last remains of the vintage Indian bone jewellery I already bought last year. After the covered part of Petaling street are many wholesale/retail costume jewellery shops selling also beads.

Great Market for shopholics.title: Great Market for shopholics
Great Market for shopholics.body: Be prepared to bargain to end.. But respectfully. One can get very good first copy of branded stuff..

Great hawker food.title: Great hawker food
Great hawker food.body: Wanted to try monorail. Walked about 10mins away after getting down at maharajalela station. Similar to night market and penang road back at my place. Didnt buy much. Bought perfume after alot of bargaining. But enjoyed the lok lok ( just opposite the season hotel). Really good.

Steaming hot loud and crowded- just how.title: Steaming hot loud and crowded- just how we like it!
Steaming hot loud and crowded- just how.body: I always look forward to visiting Chinatown, people, sights, smells. Always something to see and new things to try. The restaurants range from super cheap to high end, shopping is good - markets galore. There are temples and museums to visit.Plenty for a good weekend!

Market place.title: Market place
Market place.body: Many goods you can find here but the price is a little bit expensive. I compare with another place, I buy postcard here 1 for 2MYR but I buy postcard in Pasar Seni one for 0.80 MYR. But it is a good place to see goods and enjoy time

Always nice to be back in China town.title: Always nice to be back in China town
Always nice to be back in China town.body: If it is your first time in KL do spend sometime in the China Town. It does add the color to the day in the city. Yes and a Happy Chinese New Year!

Interesting place to explore.title: Interesting place to explore
Interesting place to explore.body: If you are not a local it’s a must go place especially in the early evenings. There is a mix of everything for you to browse, shop, eat or just stroll and watch the happenings. There are plenty of stalls selling an amazing array of stuff. Just be careful of your personal belongings and have fun. Even as a local I do try to go once a while just to enjoy the streets and its surroundings. At central market you can get amazing local arts n crafts too.

cheap stuff.title: cheap stuff
cheap stuff.body: its a tiny cozy place to shop around with lots of variety. For a tourist this place is perfect to buy souvenir. Try to do bargaining, sometime it works. It can be a bit crowded sometimes but it was a great experience

Go Early, and enjoy the less crowd momen.title: Go Early, and enjoy the less crowd moment.
Go Early, and enjoy the less crowd momen.body: Go Early, and enjoy the less crowd moment.This place serves best breakfast early in the morning with less crowd. Able to enjoy each of the corner and slowly back to old days of Kuala Lumpur.

Great shopping.title: Great shopping
Great shopping.body: This is a must visit for cheap shopping in KL. The traders can be a little pushy at times but not as bad as other places. Good food and plenty of different things to see

Typical Chinatown area.title: Typical Chinatown area
Typical Chinatown area.body: Plenty of "inspired" and "replica" of big brands (Fancy a RM 50 Tiffany & Co. necklace?). Well, it's to be expected since it's a place where you can bargain for something that you might wanna use in a more practical manner instead of spending thousands on the original. It works out fine and quite some eateries around the area too. There's shelter too along the pathway but just be careful of your belongings.

Plenty of cheap stuff to buy.title: Plenty of cheap stuff to buy
Plenty of cheap stuff to buy.body: A typical street to get those cheap clothings and branded "replica" or "inspired" items. There's bound to be something that you will like there too. It's sheltered so rain or shine won't affect your mood. Walking distance from Pasar Seni MRT station.

Just ok.title: Just ok
Just ok.body: Crowded and maybe u will become smelly because of food and sweat :)We just visit here buy some foods and not buying merchandise. The stall sell same merchandise

Many foods and stuff to bargain.title: Many foods and stuff to bargain
Many foods and stuff to bargain.body: Too crowded when come to chinatown at night. We stay at lantern hotel that place at central road of chinatown. Porridge Rice and Wonton noodles serves in this place. Merchandise of kualalumpur too. :)

Crowded yet quirky.title: Crowded yet quirky
Crowded yet quirky.body: Extremely crowded just like all the other chinatown markets in the region. You can get some dirt cheap souvenirs and clothes and food and what not. Worth a visit - but not much to see. A 20 minute walk would give you a fair idea of all that you can buy. Was too crowded for my comfort.

Commercialized tourist attraction.title: Commercialized tourist attraction
Commercialized tourist attraction.body: I would not recommend going here, however it's worth a 5-10 minute walk if there is nothing left on your itinerary. The place offers branded item knock-offs and some local food. The food is worth a try, though you'll be able to get it at less crowded and touristy places, perhaps at a better price.

Hidden hipster spots.title: Hidden hipster spots
Hidden hipster spots.body: Sure. Everyone knows about Petaling Street. It’s full of run of the mill tourists traps. But this place also has a few hipster cafes hidden among the alley way. Worth while discovering these hipster spots if that’s your thing.

A complete mess.title: A complete mess
A complete mess.body: I did not enjoy my walk here. Nothing interesting to be found, just a lot of low quality souvenirs. Some historical buildings are interesting, but generally i found this area to be way too run down

Nice market, but beware of pickpockets a.title: Nice market, but beware of pickpockets and fake product
Nice market, but beware of pickpockets a.body: This is a nice area for find local food and buy some souvenirs, but for the branded stuff it's 99% not original or fake product. Beware of many pickpockets here with a group that use hit and run style. Also please asking the price 1st before order the food or they will shoot you with 5star Resto price.

Worst shopping in Malaysia !.title: Worst shopping in Malaysia !
Worst shopping in Malaysia !.body: Comparing to all the nice bazaars in Georgetown or Kota Bharu, this place is packed and busy, dirty, they sell cheap stuff made in China, a lot of plastic shoes and handbags. vendors are stopping you and bothering you to buy...run away fast ! No quality, no local products, really not worth a visit  !

Best place to Shop in KL.title: Best place to Shop in KL
Best place to Shop in KL.body: bargain hard, you will surely find the best deals. More shops will open in the late afternoon. This is a market full of ladies clothes, shoes for both men and women, perfumes and bags.

Place to go if you want copies of design.title: Place to go if you want copies of designer labels
Place to go if you want copies of design.body: Great place if you are after copies of designer labels. Don't go there if it is raining. They have installed sails overhead to protect you from the sun, but in the rain everything is covered with plastic and difficult to see what you want easily. Can get very crowded at night. If you stay to the end of the night, taxi's are much more expensive to get home.

Shopping destination.title: Shopping destination
Shopping destination.body: Great shopping destination You must learn how to pargen the pricesA lot of good quality fake branded items cloth and bens watches and bags

Tat for sale.title: Tat for sale
Tat for sale.body: Stall after stall of cheap; in terms of quality and  possibly cheap in price if you negotiate, designer knock off copies. Pretty much wasted an hour.  Hot and humid. There are better 5hings to do in KL

Lost its chinatown feels.title: Lost its chinatown feels
Lost its chinatown feels.body: We have went a nearby coffee shop that served nice "lala" soup beehoon. It is just directly opposite the main entrance of the petailing street.The beehoon has give great touch of nice seafood taste plus adding on the chinese shaoxing wine into the soup.. it gives a heavenly taste to the food. Superb !!!Chinatown kl does not give us a very strong impression of its attractiveness. We will not consider to go again when we visit kl again.Chinese new year around the corner but we can even feel the rise to the occasion. The place is not vibrant and well kept.To us is a not go again for the place.Sorry...NicSingapore

A place for some local taste and souveni.title: A place for some local taste and souvenir
A place for some local taste and souveni.body: This used to be the centre of the Kuala Lumpur with all the Malaysian Chinese sellers selling traditional foods and items.But over the years, this had change and become the tourist spot with stalls selling all sort of items ranging from traditional delicacies to Bags and shoes and also all sort of souvenirs.

travelholic.title: travelholic
travelholic.body: its a great place where we can find all type of stuff over here at a reasonable price and the prices can be negotiated

Chinatown has a certain charm.title: Chinatown has a certain charm
Chinatown has a certain charm.body: The area has a certain charm at night, packed with stalls selling goods supposed to acctract tourists. However, if you want to buy you must understand it's mostly fake 'branded' goods - also be prepared to argue the price, in particular if you look like a tourist!

Good ambience of china town in Kuala Lum.title: Good ambience of china town in Kuala Lumpur
Good ambience of china town in Kuala Lum.body: The place is great for copy stuff hunting. You will find many chinese food around and night martket in the evening. Near to pasar seni MRT and LRT station

Lively China town.title: Lively China town
Lively China town.body: A great atmosphere ,lively hustle and bustle of this china town is a great attraction, the sights and aromas of the food and flowers and the smell of inscence emitting from the local temple is so atmospheric , well worth a visit .

Avoid!!.title: Avoid!!
Avoid!!.body: Try to avoid coming here totally. This place is grossly overpriced. Too many tourist going around. 99% of the shop assistants were foreigners. Like seriously?

Bargain hard,just be firm on prices !!.title: Bargain hard,just be firm on prices !!
Bargain hard,just be firm on prices !!.body: This place has variety of souvenirs to buy for your loved ones. Forget the stalls you can also get fair price in the shops which offer good behaviour also. We bought petronas keychains and magnets and also purses from a shop inside the market which gave a fair deal instead of stalls. Stall owners are adamant nowadays. Overall its a nice place and also food and drink stalls offer nice evening quick bites.

Interesting if you are have a skill to b.title: Interesting if you are have a skill to bargain
Interesting if you are have a skill to b.body: If you are looking for a pure Chinese product it’s the place A lot of all type of fake items which you need or might see in Chinese market. Funny thing is you don’t see any Chinese there all full of Indian guys who are selling their staff.

not impressed.title: not impressed
not impressed.body: We arrived here by metro. It was easy to walk around because of the layout but there were not many pavements and if there were, they were wet and littered. The back streets were very smelly. It was quite seedy looking and there were some single people 'loitering'. Not an area I would choose to stay in nor revisit.

Selling a lot of Replica items.title: Selling a lot of Replica items
Selling a lot of Replica items.body: A lot of vendors selling the same items mostly replica items, never asked the price cause I’m not interested in them. The food is pretty good in Chinatown a lot of choices to choose from.

Chinatown was fun and cheap hotels nearb.title: Chinatown was fun and cheap hotels nearby and tip is not all are on internet. My hotel was near hotel 99
Chinatown was fun and cheap hotels nearb.body: Go Chinatown from bus. Ask locals where hotels are 120 rubies gets you best room in hotel. The gym above bus terminal is 12 rubies but be careful they try charge you twice. Get a nice meal in Indian restaurant is 8 pesos and drinks similar price. Lots to see in chinatown. Iceblocks are only one ruby with real ice cream.

most amazing street in kl!.title: most amazing street in kl!
most amazing street in kl!.body: I was living there few months: heart of KL, a bit noisy but wonderful! food, market, shops - everything near!

Very typical market place.title: Very typical market place
Very typical market place.body: If you don’t mind crowded spaces, tons of “souvenir “ shops with fake goods and aggressive service, where you can bargain your price, full lots of local smells, colorful and bit dodgy this is a must-to-visit attraction

Best place to buy some souvenir..title: Best place to buy some souvenir.
Best place to buy some souvenir..body: A best place to buy some cheap souvenir.  Best for Suitcases and other artificial leather products.  A good bargaining skill is always handy.

Good for Budget Shopping.title: Good for Budget Shopping
Good for Budget Shopping.body: It was a totally different shopping experience to us.A different kind of a street market where you need to have lot of patience to keep on bargaining with the sellers on each and every item you need to buy. They have some uncommon handbags / Watches /  shoes but no branded stuff at all. Almost all the labels are fake ones. You must start offering 50% - 60% lesser price what they actually ask for. For an example if they ask for RM130 for a handbag you must request  it for RM 40 and gradually increase and then you can buy it for about RM 60. But would like to rate it as a must visit place at lease to get that experience if you are not really in to bargain shopping.

CHINATOWN WHERE HISTORY BEGAN FOR KUALA.title: CHINATOWN WHERE HISTORY BEGAN FOR KUALA LUMPUR
CHINATOWN WHERE HISTORY BEGAN FOR KUALA.body: Times have changed for Chinatown as with a lot of ethnic places.  However, there are still glimpses of a past glory in Chinatown from old buildings dated back to her ground roots (1857) where development first began for "Kuala Lumpur" ("The Muddy Confluence" of 2 rivers, namely the Gombak & Klang rivers) ..Tourists enjoy Chinatown because of her historical presence gathered from traditional cuisines to Chinese temples and an Indian temple to handicrafts markets and art galleries - everything within walking distances to surprising discoveries.

Night Market.title: Night Market
Night Market.body: Again my recommendation plz avoid going alone in night market which are specially a little far from your staying place or city centre Its a night market tourist place watches, cheap things , Chinese food market also , Beer shops. Must visit  But be careful for fake products rather giving them full price 😉

Cool little place.title: Cool little place
Cool little place.body: It is a great place to visit but there is lots fake copies of all sorts of products.There are however the odd little gem that is selling what looks like local products. There are some really great places to eat as well. Well worth a walk around.

Cheap stuff.title: Cheap stuff
Cheap stuff.body: Petaling St is the address.Small streets full of cheap  fakes & food.Fun place to visit.Must see  for shoppers.

Bargain finds and savory eats.title: Bargain finds and savory eats
Bargain finds and savory eats.body: This place is buzzing with tourist.  You can get cheap and nice souvenir items. A must see place for your shopping needs.

Intesting.title: Intesting
Intesting.body: I am sure every city I have been to around the world has a Chinatown! This one has a great market as well as really good restaurants and traditional buildings to see.

Street Hustlers.title: Street Hustlers
Street Hustlers.body: Beware of street hustlers especially if you are tourist. They definitely would like to ask you to buy something or services that they offer.

Good place to go to.title: Good place to go to
Good place to go to.body: We took in the nearby Tang City food court which was basically seats/tables surrounded by small kitchens serving the freshest of cooked curries etc..The market was ok and nothing spectacular.

Overrated Market.title: Overrated Market
Overrated Market.body: You can go for a small visit to the area. From the name, people expect market to have Chinese seller. Instead most of the sellers are from other countries. You can get better deals in Sungai Wang Plaza.

Messy, funny and crowded.title: Messy, funny and crowded
Messy, funny and crowded.body: This isn't a fancy place at all. But you will find souvenirs at an excellent price. The sorrounding area it is not nice but I think this is expected in any large city around the globe.

Not a very good experience..title: Not a very good experience.
Not a very good experience..body: Its true you get cheap and fake stuff but be very careful when you negotiate with them, start from 20% of what they offer, or else you gonna ripped off. Some of the shop owners can come off as racist and aggressive. Avoid arguments.

If you like fake watch in a crouded envi.title: If you like fake watch in a crouded environement
If you like fake watch in a crouded envi.body: A lot of small shops selling copy of watch or bags or selling any type of gadgets. If you want to fell like a basic tourist you can go ;)

Def visit here.title: Def visit here
Def visit here.body: Yeah you definitely need to go here this is where all the shopping is .Pretty amazing just get a taxi there cost u F.A.Definitely if you want fake nikes or just want some cheap fruit this is where it’s at.

Every kind of cheap knock-off you can im.title: Every kind of cheap knock-off you can imagine
Every kind of cheap knock-off you can im.body: This is my third visit to this market in a decade, and it seems there are less fake briefcases and purses, and there is more luggage, watches and cuff links. Big variety of everything, mostly knock offs. Good for a look but you can walk it in 20 minutes ( unless you start buying)!

Worth the trip.title: Worth the trip
Worth the trip.body: Probably there are better flea markets to buy cheap knockoffs but this place is still pretty good for the experience. As others have noted, you must haggle but also be prepared to hear rude remarks from the shopkeepers. We only bought souvenirs from a stall that had ‘fixed’ prices. I really don’t enjoy haggling :-)

Do Visit.title: Do Visit
Do Visit.body: 3 Thumb Rules1. Start buying after first 4 to 5 shops2. Ask 1/rd of wht ever they quote and settle slightly above it.3. Could not find Cheapest and Good colections of Bags watches etc..Same in Singapore costlier

A shopping place with a bargain.title: A shopping place with a bargain
A shopping place with a bargain.body: We walked around the chinatown. I would say quality of products are diverse and always endeavour for discounts.

Great food and a footmassage.title: Great food and a footmassage
Great food and a footmassage.body: Despite a jetlag of flying I went to chinatown. What a wonderful atmosphere with all those stalls with bargains, clothes, electronics and lots of food. I have not bought anything but eaten delicious in a small restauran with local food and then went to one of the many massage parlor for a delicious massage (for little). So Chinatown is really worth a visit in the evening!

typical street market.title: typical street market
typical street market.body: nice place to walk around if you have some time to spare has decent stalls but nothing that special on offer.

standard china town experience.title: standard china town experience
standard china town experience.body: wouldn't say that you should go out of your way to visit this place as its got the pretty generic china town feel an I think you could use your time more wisely, however if you are in the area and have some time to spare then there is no harm in popping in and having a look at the stalls, stores and food venders here.

Very very crowded.title: Very very crowded
Very very crowded.body: It is like a crowded street . Have very rode sellers .you can see  peopel from every country and it is nice and lovely .smell was very bad.

All the usual stuff.title: All the usual stuff
All the usual stuff.body: All the usual stuff you would expect in an Asian street market. A good place to kill an hour or two. Not as good as HK

Ideal Place for Knock-offs & Fake Stuff.title: Ideal Place for Knock-offs & Fake Stuff
Ideal Place for Knock-offs & Fake Stuff.body: In the midst of Chinatown, this is the place for shopping for Gucci bags, Rolex watches & other expensive brands...if you don't have or want to spend that fabulous kind of money. A covered street about 3-400 meters in length, crowded with stalls & people. One has to be good at bargaining. An interesting place.

Noisy market.title: Noisy market
Noisy market.body: This is great if you like crowded markets A lot of haggling going Just too busy for me Lots of locals here so you get things at a cheap price not too sure abt quality

Bustling market.title: Bustling market
Bustling market.body: This is a busy market place with winding alleys Beware of pickpocketsHaggling is expected and prices usually drop to half the start price Bags ,clothes ,jewellery mostly with a few souvenir shops Cafes restaurants with local street food available Some spa massage parlours but too dim lit for me to try

Great place for china shopping.title: Great place for china shopping
Great place for china shopping.body: We had to take a walk here and found the place a litte bit crowded. But so many things you can buy (if you need them) We can compare with china twon in Singapore but both offer the same products.

dont bother.title: dont bother
dont bother.body: horrible place, all men at you constantly, worse than any other china town ive been to. We were allocated 30mins as part of a cultural night lol lasted 2 mins walked up one side and out

A Must Visit To Round Out Your Experienc.title: A Must Visit To Round Out Your Experience of KUL
A Must Visit To Round Out Your Experienc.body: KUL's Chinatown has undergone tremendous change over the decades. It is now more of a bargain shopping open-air bazaar with lots of vendors in small stands selling brand knock-offs of handbags, suitcases, purses, shoes, jeans and all sorts of gadgets. You can and are expected to bargain with the merchants for everything. Sort of like eBay on steroids! The stands are mainly manned by Bangladeshis and Myanmaris (people from Myanmar). Decades ago, KUL's Chinatown used to be filled with Chinese stores and merchants. Many of these stores are now gone, replaced or their owners have hired Bangladeshis and Myanmaris to work in lieu of being there themselves. Hence the base flavor of KUL's Chinatown has changed tremendously and along with it the authentic Chinese atmosphere.KUL's Chinatown is located in one of the oldest parts of KUL. What you will still get to experience are some of the last of the old colonial buildings. These are the last vestiges of the old architecture from the turn of the 19th century/early 20th century. There is very little preservation done to these old buildings. Eventually, they will be gone. So, you should experience and photograph them before they are torn down.If you do experience KUL's Chinatown during the day and walk the back alleys, you will experience the big wet market that sells live chickens, fish, fresh veggies and a few day restaurants (they are not open for the night crowd). The night open-air bazaar takes over most of Chinatown by dusk.

Must visit!.title: Must visit!
Must visit!.body: Great experience but be prepared to haggle! Lots of stalls selling the same so if the price isn’t right move on.  We visited in the afternoon on a really hot day so we didn’t stay long.  Would have liked to have gone in the evening had we had the time. If you are in KL this is a must!

Have Fun here, Bargaining for THta Barg.title: Have Fun here, Bargaining for  THta Bargain, and even eating here.
Have Fun here, Bargaining for THta Barg.body: Great "Shopping Therapy, or more so "Browsing Therapy", and practice your "Bargaining Skills.The Shop Owners expect yo to do this, but always remember to do this "Respectively.More shops/stall are open in the afternoon and into the night.WYW or  Watch your Wallet as Pickpockets do operate.

Soya Bean Milk Highlight.title: Soya Bean Milk Highlight
Soya Bean Milk Highlight.body: A lot of knock offs available for those who are keen. The highlight walking down this street for me is the vendor that sells soya bean milk and curd. Love the authenticity of it.

Great night market.title: Great night market
Great night market.body: Best to go later in the evening. Can get quite busy though. Dont forget to barter. Lots of things to buy.

Not much a Chinatown.title: Not much a Chinatown
Not much a Chinatown.body: I am a bit disappointed because it is not a real Chinatown. The Chinese food street vendors give the authentic Chinatown’s atmosphere.

Huge and full of bargains.title: Huge and full of bargains
Huge and full of bargains.body: Get your eyes opened here and be prepared to haggle. The stalls are plenty and they want to make money so give it o them but only at your price. Loads of bargains to be had.

Authentic Hainanese chicken!.title: Authentic Hainanese chicken!
Authentic Hainanese chicken!.body: If you're looking for an authentic Hainanese chicken and sumptuous, fast, affordable food, this is the place to go in KL!

A place for low cost budget stuff.title: A place for low cost budget stuff
A place for low cost budget stuff.body: this the right place for visitor who wants to get any god stuff with lower price. cloth, souvenir and many more available here. do not forget to bargain, its fair here. get the stuff you want to have.

The Last China Man Standing.title: The Last China Man Standing
The Last China Man Standing.body: This Chinatown is unique compared to other Chinatowns found in London, San Francisco or Bombay. First, it is not a red light district where it is safe to bring your spouse and family to this market for shopping imitation goods and experience various local Chinese hawker food. One should be prepared to see many foreign workers such as Bangladeshi, Indonesian and Burmese are being employed to serve you. Many of the owners with origin of local Chinese background had left the scene except those selling various food. Many of the Chinese food sellers are old and had been there for more than 30 years. It is sad that the young generation are not keen to do the job. This is the reason why I say one still could enjoy local Chinese food prepared by the old Chinese hands where they are the last Chinese man standing there. Next generation Chinese meals would be replaced by other ethnic races. Some of the Chinese good are very tasty and delicious where price is still considered reasonable by local standard while some are over price due to tourist dollars. Therefore, please check the price before placing your orders. Things to try out for foreign tourists are 1) Yong Tau Foo 2) Hakka noodles 3) Claypot chicken rice 4) Chicken rice 5) wanton noodles 6) Beef noodles 7) Spicy BBQ stingray (only serves at night), 8) Char Siew (roast pork) noodles, 9) Pork Jerky and many more upcoming cafes. If you are into imitation goods, here is the place to satisfy your budget needs. Many of the foreign workers speak broken English but do not speak mandarin, hokkien or Cantonese. They are pretty fluent with Malay language though. Who should come here;1) Tourists who want to experience an atmosphere of South Asian cultural diversity where tourists from China, Middle East, Pakistan, India, Sri Lanka and local multicultural ethnic groups flock to this market. It is like a baby silk road market where it is also a cross road to other cultural experience.2) As Chinatown is near to the central market, Masjid Jamek and Merdeka Square. It would be great to begin your walking journey from Chinatown for breakfast or end your trip here for lunch or dinner. Transportation wise is very convenient as you could come here via Central Market LRT station. Plenty of taxis and uber/grab to service you too. 3) Street photographers would have many activities here but please do not be aggressive. People here don't ask for tips as you take photos of them doing their business but do know your limits and keep a distance help. 4) This is not a place for you if you intend to come here to learn about Chinese culture in Malaysia. For this, you have to go to Melaka and Penang Island where history is richer. Public safety at the Chinatown is of not a concerned but one must not be careless and attract unnecessary attention. Do keep your belongings close to you all the time as this is a baby silk road market.

Petaling Street for cheap knock offs.title: Petaling Street for cheap knock offs
Petaling Street for cheap knock offs.body: Came here twice in our trip, the first time to kill time and the second time to buy luggage. A lot of cheap knock offs here like from Louis Vuitton, Gucci, Goyard, Supreme, and North Face. Everything from clothes, backpacks, luggage, wallets and bags. There is a pharmacy in the middle of Chinatown where the doctor speaks English very well. We had to go there twice because of some food poisoning and flu like symptoms. He helped us a lot and the meds he prescribed did the trick. If you want to shop, make sure to bring cash and haggle. However, the two currency exchanges there don’t have the best deals. Try and exchange your money elsewhere.

Week end.title: Week end
Week end.body: Nice place to walk and admire the different era of  the buildings around and still breath the old chinatown atmosphere. Food and drinks very affordable and good variety, you can enjoy from the smelly durian fruit, to the very tasty fried fish skin, to end up with the fabulous pancake filled with peanut butter. Is a real good mix where the old and new meets.

Must visit place.title: Must visit place
Must visit place.body: Decent place to buy some gifts or items for yourself. Good selection of bags belts watches and shirts. Beware of pushy salesman and over priced goodsCan buy items for more than half price they give you

Good shopping.title: Good shopping
Good shopping.body: Good place to buy some gifts or items for yourself. Decent belts, watches , bags and shirts. But beware of pushy salesmen and over priced items always go for atleast half the price they give

Walked through on our way to find a dece.title: Walked through on our way to find a decent place to eat dinner ...
Walked through on our way to find a dece.body: The night market was in full swing on a Saturday night when we walked through. It looked like many a night market that we have seen in other Asian countries ... only the food looked better. And certainly I liked it much more than Jalan Alor, which was just way too trashy. This area was a buzz with crowds the night we went, and it was fun if only for people watching. If you're in the area, check it out. But not worth a special trip.

Rip off city.title: Rip off city
Rip off city.body: A bit overwhelmed by all the rip off stalls. We eventually left and went to explore the old city around it. Visited the old houses, Hindu and Chinese temples and walked through Chinatown again in the evening but went to Japan Alor to eat instead.

For the tourist in you!.title: For the tourist in you!
For the tourist in you!.body: You cannot come to KL and not go down (or up) Petaling Street, if nothing else to watch other visitors haggling over purchases. There are (literally) hundreds of stalls selling all sorts of stuff from souvenirs to fake branded goods, from fresh fruit and veg to  a full meal. Take an hour or so to walk down one side and back up the other side.

Great place for cheap holiday shopping..title: Great place for cheap holiday shopping.
Great place for cheap holiday shopping..body: Visited Chinatown for some cheap bargain shopping for friends at home, great place to bargain with the vendors. Always bargain 3 times. Lots of local restaurants and we ate some of the best food we tried in KL.

No vist to KL complete without going her.title: No vist to KL complete without going here
No vist to KL complete without going her.body: Similar to many "Chinatowns" in this part of the world - full of many colourful streets offering shophouses, market stalls, food stalls, hawkers and a fully functioning wet market. The wet market in particular is worth finding and visiting. The entrance to the wet market is across the road and down towards Chinatown from the Sri Maha Mariammam Temple. Take time to stroll through he many market stalls and haggle for anything you want to buy.

Its a nice time killer.title: Its a nice time killer
Its a nice time killer.body: Well people call it Chinatown but it's really more like a market but anyway, it's a fun place to kill a few hours on a lazy weekendIf you're a tourist to KL, it's one of those stops you could make if you've got no plans but I wouldn't call it a must see.To get there, there's a few ways but the easiest one is by public transport and the one I normally do to get there is by Monorail.Get off at Maharajalela and walk toward the Chinese temple, there will be two. Once you walk pass the SECOND temple turn right and straight ahead. There's a great big sign in front of you, can't miss it.What to do there? Shop, eat and take photos.For Vegetarians, there isn't a food stall in the market area it self but there are a few that's about five minutes walk just outside the market. Use an app to guide you.Once you're done with the market, and exploring the surrounding area, head to nearby Pudu Sentral. Hop on a LRT back into town.

You need to haggle.title: You need to haggle
You need to haggle.body: Great place if you want fake cheap bags. Good food down side streets. Recommend the bbq pork buns and the satay. You need to haggle a lot!!! Not as much food availability as I expected you have to walk away a bit to get a proper meal

bargaining is a must.title: bargaining is a must
bargaining is a must.body: It wasn't as glamorous as other china towns elsewhere. Most of the sellers are south Asians and neither Malay nor Chinese.Some of the stuff over there was good but you must bargain with like everyone.I got many warnings before I go, about being cheated, pocket theft, black magic !!!But all was fine really ... nothing seemed unusual!

ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIED.title: ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIED
ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIED.body: I had visited KL for the first time in Jan 2018 , and China town was recommended by a few people for GREAT shopping.. I love shopping especially at markets and was really looking forward to China town.. friends had told me I will find all FAKE brands at great prices.. I was disappointed!!! China town should be renamed to India town.. each stall sold the same things .. quality CHEAP And prices ridiculous.. an item will be sold for like 300 ringgit and when walking out the guy will say take it at 100!!! If you want to jus go for a laugh and pass some time than visit "China town" ..

No more cheap selling market.title: No more cheap selling market
No more cheap selling market.body: This market in Petaling street was famous for cheap bargain selling but very disappointed to see this time everything is overpriced even small wallet being asked for fixed RM 50 . Totally wasted 03 hours inside the market for bargain hunting but ended up buying limited stuffI would rather suggest the Sungei Wang Plaza the best place for cheaper shopping of quality items

A Good Way To Spend a Few Hours.title: A Good Way To Spend a Few Hours
A Good Way To Spend a Few Hours.body: Chinatown is pretty much an outside market in what feels like an older part of the city.  It has a lot of Asian style red lanterns hanging but we felt that this plus a few Chinese food places is where the Chinese influence ended.  For us, a little disappointing, but still a fun way to spend a few hours. What you can expect is lots of stalls dedicated to handbags, watches and purses.  So many stalls like this and these vendors were more pushy.  There was also some souvenir type items and of course clothing, lots of knock off clothing especially t-shirts.  The prices really varied stall to stall for similar items.  We found the marked prices or starting prices if unmarked were rather high, this is a place you will want to negotiate.  The English is quite good so that helps with back and forth to settle on a price.  We felt quite safe in and around Chinatown taking normal precautions as a tourist. The area was a good area, didn’t feel rough or scary, we moved about without too much thought. We enjoyed sitting at an outdoor restaurant drinking a beer and people watching/watching the activity in the market.Chinatown is also very close in proximity to the Central Market. We would visit Chinatown again on another trip back to Kuala Lumpur.

Yummy breakfast found!.title: Yummy breakfast found!
Yummy breakfast found!.body: It has been a while since I was here the last time. Hon Kee porridge is still as yummy as it was. And customer service rocks too! You will get free tour guiding from stall owner if you wish, just ask!

Market Local style.title: Market Local style
Market Local style.body: It a walking street in the town and you can shopping copy peoduct if you want and traditional tea and chinese food

A China-town within KL.title: A China-town within KL
A China-town within KL.body: Known for numerous stalls selling everything from clothes to garments to accessorries, purses, goggles, miniature plane models and what not. Chinese souvenir shops are also scattered along the street known as 'Petaling Street'. There are also quite a few nice hotels on both sides and near the street. A nice location where you can stay and shop in KL.

Very colourful with a lot of activity.title: Very colourful with a lot of activity
Very colourful with a lot of activity.body: Good place to visit. The shopping is ok if you are into that sort of thing. We did not eat here but did see a lot of restaurants around. Good place to buy souvenirs.

Not as exciting.title: Not as exciting
Not as exciting.body: If u like to barter for handbags and watchers it be a good place for you to be .Most things they sold was bags and watches and clothes if you want good arts and crafts I think central market would be better more to choose from but at fixed price

Bargains on the street.title: Bargains on the street
Bargains on the street.body: Like many other street markets this has cheap, and imitation products at cheap prices. You can haggle with most vendors.  Prices for the same produt change a lot as you walk further down the street so avoid buying things at the fist stall you see then at.  Walk down and come back if needed.

Always good to see what's new..title: Always good to see what's new.
Always good to see what's new..body: Great place to spend an hour, you'll always end up buying something you didn't know you needed. Look out for really cheap "copies" you'll get home and then straight away regret buying it.

Overwhelming.title: Overwhelming
Overwhelming.body: Good market shopping. Go in the evening for best pricing, be prepared to haggle. We got most things for 1/3 of asking price (be prepared to walk away) Look around because all the shops have the same thing, and be sure to double check your purchase (especially the wallets/purses) for loose stitches, scuffs or nicks etc before purchasing/leaving.

City of contrasts!,.title: City of contrasts!,
City of contrasts!,.body: Loved it, fantastic modern City. Wonderful air conditioned walkways leading to fantastic shopping malls. Beautiful buildings and architecture. However a visit to the night markets shows where the majority of ordinary people live which was pretty grim to say the least!!

Ex China Town.title: Ex China Town
Ex China Town.body: Every year I visit this place. Over the last 10 years, I would call it China Town. Now I have a different name for this place - Bangladesh Town

Good bargains.title: Good bargains
Good bargains.body: Night market with hundreds of stalls packed with mainly clothing shoes and bags . You have to bargain  at these stalls . Found prices a bit more expensive than Hong Kong and range not as good . However nice place if looking for Odd gift

Worthless place, waste of time!.title: Worthless place, waste of time!
Worthless place, waste of time!.body: Heard from local people and some cab drivers that china town in Kuala Lumpur is worth visiting however I didnt found anything interesting here. The things what I saw here is a market with an orientation of chinese culture with china background, chinese manufactured products and other relative stuff. However this so called china market not worth buying things because the things available in this market as usual are duplicates or not worth buying since the value added to these products are based on original price of original product and if you ask these seller's price for any product and you don't buy from them, they will see you like a culprit if you have done a big mistake by asking them a price, forget bargain, you will face this issue only on asking the price. Hence while roaming on this street I didnt found myself enjoying and left this street in next  minutes rather than wasting my valuable timings in balance for other deserving place.

A lot of good local restaurant.title: A lot of good local restaurant
A lot of good local restaurant.body: Petaling Street is the best place to walk. A lot of things you can buy here and also many good local restaurants with good food.

Full of traditional food.title: Full of traditional food
Full of traditional food.body: I love to stay close to chinatown. Many interesting thing you can find. And I always comeback to this place with my family.

Good finds on souvenir.title: Good finds on souvenir
Good finds on souvenir.body: Yes it's a great to place to shop for souvenir items and you must really bargain to get a much cheaper price. It's a great alternative to Central Market.

Good food in Little Chinatown.title: Good food in Little Chinatown
Good food in Little Chinatown.body: Apart from the cleanliness being an issue it's a pretty nice place to spend the evening. The variety of marketable goods and the fruit shops and the restaurants are reminiscent of any China Town throughout the world. Had a delectable dinner comprising of pork belly and chips.

A \"must do\".title: A "must do"
A \"must do\".body: If you're in KL, this is well worth a visit. You can shop, eat or just look roundThere's something for everyone in Chinatown

Bargain hard!.title: Bargain hard!
Bargain hard!.body: Very nice place if you like shopping. Plenty of things to choose from handbags to football jerseys. Some of the items are really well copied and you should really bargain hard so you can get a good discount.

Visit to Chinatown.title: Visit to Chinatown
Visit to Chinatown.body: The place is a good bargain for goods. You have to bargain the prices there and most of the stalls are manned by foreigners.

Disappointing..title: Disappointing.
Disappointing..body: I have taken quite a few visitors here, only because they have asked to go, and we have always been disappointed with the stalls and how rude many of the stall holders are. There is too much of the same thing with very little variety between stalls and I would agree with other reviewers and say that I feel that some of the stall vendors come across as hostile and way too aggressive. Nothing makes me walk away faster. I think it is sad that Chinatown has turned into this. Unless you want to buy some bad fakes, give it a miss. There is so much more to KL than this.

Not worth a visit.title: Not worth a visit
Not worth a visit.body: Visit if you want to be treated badly and harassed by rude sellers. Visit if you want to support imitation goods. Otherwise just skip it.Our experience:A seller tried to sell a bag to my child and upon bargaining he agreed to sell it at the price we offered. When he noticed we were putting together notes and coins to make up the exact amount required, he got very angry and grabbed the bag from us and shooed us off, saying coins are not accepted here. How terrible.

Locals come for street food.title: Locals come for street food
Locals come for street food.body: I'm a local ,on and off I will frequent this street for local malaysia food like hokkien mee , wan tan mee , claypot noodle , beef noodle ,tau foo fah dessert which is my ex prime minister Tun Dr Mahatir favorite dessert  , yea the place doesn't look hygienic but the street food here is famous and tasty 😋Just ignore the ambience and enjoy the food .I got to know a tourist from China and I asked him how did he know about the famous hokkien noodle here and he replied from a travel app in china which was in mandarin language .

Just a Market.title: Just a Market
Just a Market.body: We were expecting some restaurants with Peking Ducks and Char Sui hanging up and fabulous food. Instead we arrive at a market selling repro designer goods, cheap tat and souvenirs and other stuff that you can find at any other market. The only food sellers were in a dark, dingy, litter strewn side street, which was  nothing more than an alleyway off the main Petaling Street. Was hoping for a nice authentic lunch in a Chinese restaurant! We ate at the Swiss Inn which was good, but not what we had in mind for a visit to ‘Chinatown’.

Hectic yet atmospheric shoppers and phot.title: Hectic yet atmospheric shoppers and photographers paradise
Hectic yet atmospheric shoppers and phot.body: This is an amazing hectic yet atmospheric shoppers paradise for haggling bargain hunters. It is a road closed off to traffic lined by restaurants and shops with many market stalls offering every kind of imitation goods and foods. À fantastic place for photographers. Be prepared to bargain and haggle hard!

A mass of similar goods.title: A mass of similar goods
A mass of similar goods.body: I am sure you'd find something that you need here. However most of the stalls offer the same goods and we found there wasn't a variety. We also struggled to find plain coloured t-shirts for men. They all had logos or were printed. Be prepared to bargain as they start off on rather inflated prices. With the exchange rate and coming from South Africa, we didn't really find it cheap as you'd expect markets to be.

A hectic shoppers paradise - be prepared.title: A hectic shoppers paradise - be prepared to haggle !
A hectic shoppers paradise - be prepared.body: This is a shoppers paradise for bargain imitation goods and food of all kind. A hectic atmospheric street closed to traffic lined with shops and restaurants with many many various market stalls. Bring some cash and be prepared to haggle hard for that bargain!

Just ok.title: Just ok
Just ok.body: We went here from early until all shops closed. Not many things to do but shop fake products such as: T shirts, shoes, hand and shoulder bags...and everything was expensive, street food is a highlight.

China town in Kuala Lumpur.title: China town in Kuala Lumpur
China town in Kuala Lumpur.body: I was fascinated by this place! Try out ur bargain skills and get lots of stuffs at cheap prices... a place to be visited indeed!

Not very Chinatown like.title: Not very Chinatown like
Not very Chinatown like.body: We visited this place when we try to find Pasar Seni LRT Station after visiting Pasar Seni (Central Market).There are many souvenir stall here (fridge magnet, keychain, t-shirt, etc).But I don't feel very "chinatown" in this area. Try "air mata kucing" (longan ice drink) when visit this place.

Great discount shopping area with great.title: Great discount shopping area with great food stalls...
Great discount shopping area with great.body: Whatever brand you are looking for in clothes, apparels, watches, bags,etc... this is the place to go and strike a bargain...  non-muslims... check out the hokkien mee stall at the crossroads area... the cool mata kuching drink stall is a big hit...

cute place with intrusive sellers.title: cute place with intrusive sellers
cute place with intrusive sellers.body: the place is very cute and busy, they sell tasty food everywhere! the sellers of the fake clothes and accessoires are a bit too aggressive, I didn't ecpect that in asia. but overall it was a nice place

It's just ok.title: It's just ok
It's just ok.body: The place is ok,but once the vendors  see you are a foreigner,the prices of stuff  triple. Some of the vendors can be very rude as well,I had one being so rude to me and my sister,it was unpardonable,at least try and be nice to your customers,but some are nice.Try and use the washroom before you go there too,  they have a public one but you have to pay to use it and the sad part is that its not clean. Lots of rats too behind the vendors and they are not scared of humans,saw quiet a lot of them running around.

Good market and food.title: Good market and food
Good market and food.body: Very congested by evening.The eating streets not so congested.It is a popular market covered so if raining good to go along with Central Market

Get the cheap goods here..title: Get the cheap goods here.
Get the cheap goods here..body: Petaling street, or Jalan Petaling, is well known for it's cheap goods and knock off's. You can make good purchase here too, but most of the items sold are not that durable and will probably wear out before long. Coming here to just have a look at all the people shopping is just as fun as to shop yourself. When you are here, enjoy a meal of one of the local restaurants as well, it's cheap and good food.

Total waste of time.title: Total waste of time
Total waste of time.body: Some of the vendors are rude and arrogant. They depend on tourist income but get angry and show no respect. They force you into their store and when you don’t buy they get angry. The place is dirty and has no toilets. Pathways are so cramped. Total waste

\"Shopping anytime\".title: "Shopping anytime"
\"Shopping anytime\".body: A colorful shopping area, lots of clothes,shoes,bags, gadgets, souvenirs etc. a big place to shop and eat or taste their local fruits that are sweet but a little pricey.There are flower shops also and many interesting things to buy and see.  Just be more careful and choose the best.

Love it! Best part of KL.title: Love it! Best part of KL
Love it! Best part of KL.body: I love the streets, shops and food! Had an amazing dinner at a barbeque place on the street and very friendly people. For me this is the best part of KL!

Same as Alibaba site but in real life...title: Same as Alibaba site but in real life..
Same as Alibaba site but in real life...body: You will find all sorts of cheap toys, clothes and food in this place.We went there reading reviews about good local food restaurNts and gave it a try. Basically you pick fish and famouse pirk on sticks and amd the restaurant prepares it for you. Food was quiet good, but atmosphere is strange, you basically sit on the road on a plastic chair. Just for one time experience is good, no more.

An interesting place to visit..title: An interesting place to visit.
An interesting place to visit..body: A must vist destination while in Kuala Lumpur. I would recommend visiting in late afternoon early evening. Be ready to barter if you wish to purchase anything, Be aware of the real value as they will start high. Offer 40% of the price then walk away and see what happens. There are some good eating places there as well, we went to the reggae bar which was great,

Not the same as its glory days!.title: Not the same as its glory days!
Not the same as its glory days!.body: The fact that it is called Chinatown (or Petaling Street) is due to the Chinese traders in this area. I used to come here when I was small to buy stuffs or simply look around... and enjoyed how the business was conducted there. Over the years, the local Chinese has become so lazy - I can only see foreigners manning the stalls (of course there are still few stalls with chinese) and they are plain rude. I can't say that it's Chinatown experience anymore.. more like United NAtion experience.. and I'm a Chinese myself

Loved It.title: Loved It
Loved It.body: This is a great place to visit.  Lots of vendors and you can find just about anything.  It gets crowded at times but that's ok.

chaotic.title: chaotic
chaotic.body: crazy part of town, but very much a place for a laugh and a place to buy utter crap. we are staying in the heart of if all. would recommend a half day here. small cafes and traditional restaurants. alive at night!

Fun shopping place.title: Fun shopping place
Fun shopping place.body: I'm a huge fan of Chinatown in any city it's always a must see for me. This place was as expected lots of vendors and as such you have to have a price in mind or walk away if it's not what you want to pay. It's fun and I tried some of the local food which was quite good. There are ATMs easy to find. I enjoyed the time I had there and there's a beautiful temple nearby well worth viewing.

Cheap stuff can be found here.title: Cheap stuff can be found here
Cheap stuff can be found here.body: If you are looking for cheap stuff, this is the place you should go when you’re in Kuala Lumpur! There are many stores selling souvenirs, counterfeit goods and food. You must know how to bargain with the sellers and not let them rip you off. There are street food stalls along Chinatown and you can enjoy local delicacies while shopping.Be careful of pickpockets when you are shopping in the area! Always put your bag in front and NOT at the back for security reasons.

It was alright.title: It was alright
It was alright.body: NIght market with a wide variety of choices. Shoes, bags, gifts, souvenir. A decent place to walk at night for some cheap goods

Good for souvenir shopping.title: Good for souvenir shopping
Good for souvenir shopping.body: its a place where you can buy small gifts n souvenir for friends n family. one needs to bargain though. if one has time, it can surely be visited.

Never go there.title: Never go there
Never go there.body: Never go this place, Chances of pick pocket is very high and chances to get duplicate materials here is very high.

Better to avoid.title: Better to avoid
Better to avoid.body: Better to avoid this place, nothing to see and high risk of pick pockets, maximum materials are worst in quality.

Chinese Chinese and everything Chinese !.title: Chinese Chinese and everything Chinese !! Awesome sights, sounds, flavors and people!!
Chinese Chinese and everything Chinese !.body: Chinese Chinese and everything Chinese !! Awesome sights, sounds, flavors and people!!Good walking shoes is a must..   gastronomically exploding..... always go for the hot steaming ‘on the spot’ cooking .... always recommended. From dumplings to noodles preparations, to ‘chang’  to soups.... ‘pau’.... to lean meat cooked on the grill. Gastronomically exploding for the famished.....and the curious !!! Enjoy

Bargains heaven !.title: Bargains heaven !
Bargains heaven !.body: This place offers anything you are looking for at extremely cheap prices ! The most important rule is to NEVER buy anything from the first price you get, we were able to buy stuff at 80% less than the initial price. Average price of anything here is 25 MYR (shirts, bags, wallets, etc).If you pay more than 40 MYR on any item here, then you have been ripped off badly.Most shops sell the same items so if you don't like the prices at any shop, keep looking and you will definitely find better deals.Many restaurants are available here but we didn't try any.

Nice cheap things but be ready to bargai.title: Nice cheap things but be ready to bargain
Nice cheap things but be ready to bargai.body: This is a nice little night market in China towm, that sells all fake and replica things of big brands. There are multiple stalls that sell a variety of things such as makeup, bags, sunglasses, watches, food stalls and technology stuff. Best not to buy any phones etc or watches from here as they stop working after a certain amount of time due to the fake quality. You have to really bargain here as well. Stall owners will try and sell items for very high prices. Always put down a best offer and if they don't accept just start walking away and they will literally run after you and sell the item for the price you want or closer.

bargain.title: bargain
bargain.body: Kindly, bargain otherwise they will fool you.though you can get  items for cheap , you should show up your bargaining skills.

Dissapointing.title: Dissapointing
Dissapointing.body: Went to Chinatown market area..its filthy and dissapointing. Bought a purse there for double the price than what i saw somewhere else. Rip off. The streets are smellu and dirty and not a good place to take kids too for shopping.

Easy to navigate.title: Easy to navigate
Easy to navigate.body: We enjoyed coming here lots of vendors selling the same thing but do some bargaining and its a lot of fun, we ate out here and the food was ok, stayed there and people watched for a while that is always entertaining. It busy and can get a little tight between the lane ways but that is what this place is all about the experience

Waste of time but there's ONE gem.title: Waste of time but there's ONE gem
Waste of time but there's ONE gem.body: For the most part, it's the same crap every 10 feet.  Fake watches, etc. some stuff is ok but the prices are stuuuupidly high - even for Asia market bargaining.  There was one gem of a place that I found.  When you first enter from the main arch entrance on Petaling, there's is a store on the left.  Just a few doors up they gave a section with fabrics.  Closer to the street it's clothing-type fabrics and toward the back it is more durable fabrics.  I wanted some for bedspreads and pillow covers.  The fabrics are gorgeous.  My problem was I didn't know my measurements that I needed.  I mentioned that I live in Bangkok and the store owner said he didn't want me to buy the wrong amount and waste my money, and that I could find the fabrics in Bangkok as well.  I was so grateful that I bought 5 brocade purses from him.  I'll use those as gifts and then find the fabric in Thailand!  Yay!

Knock it off.title: Knock it off
Knock it off.body: Great energy and lots of crappy expensive knockoffs that you can barter for.Great for getting those cheap souvenirs for family and friends.Buyers beware of the jewelry. My partner was gypped by a young oriental man who assured him that the silver necklace he was looking at was real and turned out to be fake.

Same stuff.title: Same stuff
Same stuff.body: Crowded, Not for travelling with young children. There are good bargains but need to spend time looking for it.

For those who have never gone to a night.title: For those who have never gone to a night market, it would be ok.
For those who have never gone to a night.body: I found there were lots of similar items, not that cheap, stallholders were NOT interested in bargaining and generally ignored you.  Found the Central Market in KL much better and friendlier.

Nothing Special.title: Nothing Special
Nothing Special.body: Nothing distinctive here:  just regular tourist fare of t-shirts, watches, and purses.  The vendors are friendly and not overly aggressive.

Chinese Community in KL.title: Chinese Community in KL
Chinese Community in KL.body: Very distinct lanterns over the streets of China Town. This place has lot of non-original goods to sell. We found fresh fruits here. all malaysian grown tasty Rambutan and Rose Apples

Malaysia Chinatown.title: Malaysia Chinatown
Malaysia Chinatown.body: Wanna shop for reasonable stuff and good food. You can find anything from watches, clothes, shoes etc. Check out the "Logan drink" here to chill out!

Great place to buy souvenirs.title: Great place to buy souvenirs
Great place to buy souvenirs.body: Short walk from Pasar Seni station. Good place to shop for cheap souvenirs and don’t forget to bargain. Similar to lady street in HK. Don’t expect any genuine brands here.

Lots of hustle and bussle, so so food, l.title: Lots of hustle and bussle, so so food, lots of steet vendors.
Lots of hustle and bussle, so so food, l.body: Visited for a couple of hours one evening after meetings.  Ate at "food court" of street vendors, which was ok for the price.  Lots of street vendors, but not a lot of merchandise variety.  Multiple vendors selling the same "knock off" products and not a lot of local flavor.  Not bad if you have some time to kill, but not a must see in my opinion

Good place to buy watches and other stuf.title: Good place to buy watches and other stuff if you have bargaining skills
Good place to buy watches and other stuf.body: This place offers you good Chinese stuff and first copy watches and good cheap eating options. You need to bargain hard to get a good deal, the vendors would quote exorbitant prices. The place is Crowded.

Busy.title: Busy
Busy.body: Plenty shopping, the usual fakes and souvenirs if that's what you are after.  There is a enclosed hawkers food area, do yourself a favour and give it a miss, my husband and I tired 3 different stalls and all of the dishes were awful.

Good bargains!.title: Good bargains!
Good bargains!.body: This is the place for you if your into cheap knock off branded items! Be prepared for stall vendors to be trying to convince you to purchase items and come into their stall! This is where you will also find out how good you are at negotiating as you can get yourself a good bargain for a lot of items if you know what you are doing! There is handbags, watches, shirts all branded knock offs. But make sure you do look over the item very carefully to ensure you are not purchasing items that are damaged. I would recommend not eating street food or purchasing perfume or makeup. Just enjoy the market and I hope you get as good bargains as I did!

Top shopathon!.title: Top shopathon!
Top shopathon!.body: If you're after a massive, crowded, sweaty market selling everything from copy watches, Lego and trainers to roast chestnuts and paper pineapple lanterns, and so much more, then this is the one for you in KL. I loved it. Be prepared to haggle for good deals, and try not to buy from the first stall you visit: you will definitely see the same item later on your journey through the market - and get it for a better price. Definitely worth a visit!

Not worth the time..title: Not worth the time.
Not worth the time..body: They call it Chinatown.. except for cheap knock offs theres not much China about it... waste of time if you ask me, you can buy a China made Louis Vuitton purse but you won’t see anything else of China.

not the chinatown we expected.title: not the chinatown we expected
not the chinatown we expected.body: I'm not sure why people love this place so much, it's not really chinatown. it's only stalls of counterfeit items. even the seller not even chinese.the only good thing we found is a few stalls of food, specially the dimsum one.

China town markets.title: China town markets
China town markets.body: Great place to buy  electronics, clothing and footwear at a good price but like any asian market be sure to negotiate  . They have branded copies but don't mention That to them out loud otherwise they get irrate. Theirs  also yummy cheap food restaurants in the lanes where the locals eat if your hungry. Lots of other shops on the road outside the main markets area .

Nice cheap.title: Nice cheap
Nice cheap.body: Nice place for cheap shopping. First copy items from local or Chinese market. Good bargain. Make sure u bargain well.

Very reasonably priced good products for.title: Very reasonably priced good products for the price
Very reasonably priced good products for.body: If you are looking for genuine leather goods you will obviously not find it here. Like the name promises, Petaling Street is china market where you get cheap goods at reasonable prices. But one thing that you have to know well if you want to shop till you drop - Bargain at 30% of the asking price.

Busy, bargain filled bartering.title: Busy, bargain filled bartering
Busy, bargain filled bartering.body: If you want souvenirs, clothing or just about anything you can think of, at a bartered down price, here's the place to find it. It's vibrant, colourful and noisy. I loved it. You can buy marvellous wooden masks, pottery from many cultures, wooden bowls and dishes, festival ornaments eg Chinese New Year or Christmas depending on the season, or traditional dress, Chinese, Indian, Malaysian etc. Bargains, bargains, bargains...but you will need to go through the barter process to achieve the price you think is fair. Be fair, don't push it too far. Changing rooms are simple eg I've changed behind a curtain in a corner, but it was worth it. You will quickly be served by helpful staff and it can be overwhelming if you don't really want to buy, so my advice is, 'if you don't want to buy it, don't even try it,' They work hard to make each sale. As usual in crowded places, especially markets, keep a close eye on personal belongings, don't flash wads of cash or expensive jewellery. I felt perfectly safe with my two pretty twenty something daughters, but drew a lot of attention. Wear respectable clothing for the culture. Three ladies and no males tends to create a lot of interest in Malaysia, but we've never had a problem, be confident and stick together. Food is available on street stalls and a food hall is available. Take water, in fact in Malaysia invest in a good reusable bottle. It will save you money (and the planet).

Food! Food! and more Food!.title: Food! Food! and more Food!
Food! Food! and more Food!.body: Lots of fantastic variety of food to choose from!Very authentic and delicious too.It also has the typical markets where you can buy your knockoff brands. Beware- Make sure you use your hotel bathroom before you leave. All the toilets even when i walked all the way to KFC & Macca’s, they were all so filthy and disgusting!!! Decided to hold it for when we got back to our room😳😳😳😳

Great for Bargains.title: Great for Bargains
Great for Bargains.body: If you are into your master copies then this is the place to go for copies at a cheap price, must see and visit even better at night

Average.title: Average
Average.body: Like all china towns all over the world. Chinese toys. Souvenirs. We ate seafood there was ok. Was quite safe to walk,many people. Nothing to be impressed about.

Bargain Town.title: Bargain Town
Bargain Town.body: Enter the street only if you know to bargain well. The sellers will tell the rates which is nowhere in the world; but tackle them with good bargaining skills. Don't expect the products which you buy from there should last for ever. Be careful with pick pocketing too as it is a very crowded and narrow street. You can get small gift items and give away gifts for cheap price there.

Should be renamed Bangla-town.title: Should be renamed Bangla-town
Should be renamed Bangla-town.body: One should know that this is no longer an authentic Chinatown. Perhaps a remnant of Chinese culture may linger around, most od the time, you'll see foreign workers selling counterfeit goods. Even the shops are rather rundown. If you would like an authentic Chinatown, go to other areas like Kuala Terengganu's Chinatown.

Seen it all befire.title: Seen it all befire
Seen it all befire.body: Nothing new or exciting about the night market in Chinatown. The same old copy clothing, shoes, watches etc, replicated one stall after another. We couldn’t wait to get out of there.The best thing by far about Chinatown is heading to the surrounding streets and trying their food stalls, some amazing fresh seafood, chicken and pork satay, and chicken rice clay pot. Worth the visit for the food alone.

Not Chinatown snymore.title: Not Chinatown snymore
Not Chinatown snymore.body: Only the food served but for other street vendors you get all races selling fake, junk and mediocre products.  If you have time to kill and ran out of places to go, then ok to visit. Otherwise I would not spend time here ... dirty and smelly.

A Great Experience.title: A Great Experience
A Great Experience.body: There were a lot of stalls selling fake designer gear. You must be good at bartering or haggling. My 17 year old daughter got very good at it once she witnessed how it works. We got quite a few stuff at bargain price.If you want something, give them a price. If they don't accept, walk away and they usually call you back with the price that you wanted. Another trick is to say that another store is willing to sell it at the lower price. Definitely recommend.

Haggling, cheap good food and drink..title: Haggling, cheap good food and drink.
Haggling, cheap good food and drink..body: Great way to spend an afternoon. Great atmosphere here. Plenty of street traders. Lots of shops with repetive items. Great place to haggle. Shop around prices for same item can be 100 % in the difference. Good bargains especially in bags and suitcases. Midway there is a crossroads within market. Along here Good restaurants with good cheap food and good priced drinks. Had some delicious food here. Really enjoyable afternoon here. Very safe and friendly. Recommended.

Lanes filled with hidden treasures.title: Lanes filled with hidden treasures
