Lanes filled with hidden treasures.body: Be it fruit, different kinds of Mee hoon, traditional Chinese outfits, trendy bags, jewellery or Knick knacks to take back, this lane buzzing with activity sells everything! We enjoyed walking and walking, trying out local cuisine, buying unusual gifts for family back home, and treating ourselves to fake designer labels (that look so real and come so cheap) and traditional clothes. But you have to bargain for a good deal. A shopper's paradise for something who can't afford the big brands of Pavillion Mall.

Fake Goods Galore.title: Fake Goods Galore
Fake Goods Galore.body: If you want cheap fake imitated items then this is the place for you.. from watches to hand bags to headphones to t-shirts its all there... busy... keep your belongings close as this area is renowned for pickpockets... the place is buzzing and is an ok place to walk around in the evening

Walking trying to find gifts.title: Walking trying to find gifts
Walking trying to find gifts.body: I have come to this street of sellers many times: they want to sell and, sometimes, prices are negotiable to one third! Sometimes, you cannot distinguish whether what you buy, is original one or not. At least, you can talk to sellers; they put time for you. You have to be careful about your purse or money, since as it is crowded, bad guys may spot you. Meanwhile, it is a covered street, and when it rains, you can continue to walk. Do not lose Petaling Street if you are coming to Malaysia for the first time, I am sure you find a gift to buy. My photo is not good, and just gives you a hint of what kind of small shops you will pass through. There are certain other things to visit in vicinity: temples, central market and a nearby mall.

Good for testing your haggling skills.title: Good for testing your haggling skills
Good for testing your haggling skills.body: Originally the old Chinese quarter but now the centre for copy goods.Some good food stalls and a good vibe about the area.We went four times as we liked the atmosphere and the local monorail station at  Maharajajelala was convenient for us.And of course we bought stuff every visit!!...all good fun.Also the cheapest booze shop is off the Main Street, any taxi driver could direct you.

Den for shopping freaks.title: Den for shopping freaks
Den for shopping freaks.body: Petaling street – in other words china market, is THE PLACE for the Brands Class A & B from Gadgets to clothing, accessories, souvenirs and what not. One of the main attractions in KL ☺ You can spend a good ½ a day around this market, but please remember BARGAIN is the key to strike a good deal. There are lots of street foods available, must try the roasted chestnut, yummy. You can find some shops that sell precious stones, silver jewelry and tiny brass idols.

Market visit and dinner.title: Market visit and dinner
Market visit and dinner.body: It had to be done, if your looking for cheap souvenirs, fake everything 😔 then it’s probably the place to head to but you have to bargain although some places did have signs up stating “fixed price”.  That may have been true but should not stop you from asking for a discount, if you don’t like the price walk away (I am personally not a big fan of fake goods given the behind the scene stories on their origins).  We had dinner in one (not many or at least we could not find them) the food halls (on street seating) and quite honestly it was mediocre to say the least - does not live up to Malaysian foodie heaven, is not like the Jalan Alor experiences. I would not be eating here on our next trip.If it is your first trip then it is worth a visit - similar to the markets in Bangkok.

Not worth to Visit.title: Not worth to Visit
Not worth to Visit.body: Have been visit this place many times and only for food and not for shopping. This is tourist place and they always tried to over charge the price.This street was dirty compare in the past, can see many rat on the street.

Crazy, noisy, dirty but fabulous!.title: Crazy, noisy, dirty but fabulous!
Crazy, noisy, dirty but fabulous!.body: If you are in KL you need to visit here....the place is brilliant for fake lux products - but be prepared to shop around as some are better copies that others.....really great experience and loved the hustle and bustle but stall owners can be a little aggressive

Fake goods.title: Fake goods
Fake goods.body: Lots of stalls selling wallets, watches clothes etc. There are little side streets that run off the main shopping stalls, filled with street food stalls

Good to taste local food.title: Good to taste local food
Good to taste local food.body: Petaling Street is also known as China Town in Kuala Lumpur. But today, you may find there are multi-cultural mixture of Indian, Malay and other nationalities selling merchandisers on the street stalls other than Chinese. The merchandises are so and so which you may find in other places. However, I considered there are some traditional Chinese food selling thete are very good to try. People who like architecture or culture may able to understand more about Malaysian Chinese history.

Some great restaurants but overall, its.title: Some great restaurants but overall, its about knock-offs
Some great restaurants but overall, its.body: We went to some quirky restaurants in this area with traditional and modern Chinese food but the buzz is really about the stall holders harassing you to buy anything from rubbish souvenirs to knock off t-shirts, shoes, toys, watches etc. That's great if thats what you want but nothing you can't get in any Asian city.Look for the restaurant reviews for places in Pentaling St then head for those if you want great food, inventive menus and good pricing.There's a gourmet heaven just past the main market area.

Junk and fakes.title: Junk and fakes
Junk and fakes.body: Don't bother coming here: nothing but junk and fake/knock-off counterfeit bandbags, Birkenstock sandals, and tennis shoes and clothing. Waste of time.

Know where you're going!.title: Know where you're going!
Know where you're going!.body: As interesting and vibrant as this area of the city is, know where you're trying to get too as it can be a little disorientating especially in the evening when it is really packed.

Typical.title: Typical
Typical.body: Typical Chinese market with lots of fake stuff,street food and bargaining. I love it because it is part of different culture. Food is tasty although place looks ugly. Recommending it anyway.

Shopping Street.title: Shopping Street
Shopping Street.body: This is a place for shoppers ... cheap stuff but some of them overpriced .. I think they target the tourists .. street food also available .. not much fan of the place ..

Knock offs and cheap souvenirs.title: Knock offs and cheap souvenirs
Knock offs and cheap souvenirs.body: Its like running the gauntlet with mainly Indian traders persistently and repeatedly offering knock-off watches, shirts, novelties and the usual trash you would expect in this type of market place. Not my cup of tea but if this sort of thing is new to you you will either be delighted by the haggling or confronted by the sales tactics.

Family with young kids.title: Family with young kids
Family with young kids.body: Another shopping paradise like bugis st.Able to bargain with good price.Lots of things to buy  lime clothes, bags, shoes, watches etc..managed to buy toys for the kids..not that crowded so easy to handle the kids...

Descent!.title: Descent!
Descent!.body: The place sells all sort of duplicate copies of high brands, but you have to  be very careful otherwise if you cannot bargain you can be fooled of its expensive price and also pick pocketing!Didn't like it although!

Deals deals deals!.title: Deals deals deals!
Deals deals deals!.body: Amazing, long market with so many nice dresses and bags. Everything is a knock off but go early or late and they are offering everything at very low prices.

Good food, nice stroll.title: Good food, nice stroll
Good food, nice stroll.body: A nice place to visit and enjoy some good food, take a stroll and do some shopping and be surprised about all the different people walking here.

well I think it was fab.title: well I think it was fab
well I think it was fab.body: please don't make the mistake I did and think this is food street (Jalan Alor) this is the hawkers mileenjoy bargainingbut don't moan about knock offs, if that's not your thing than don't come here

The Hell in KL.title: The Hell in KL
The Hell in KL.body: If you want to see the failure of immigration policy in Malaysia, you should come to that place. You will not find any chinese culture here, only Bangladesh immigrants, who are extremely rude and racist towards coloured people up to the physical extend towards child tourists. That was the worst experience in Malaysia.

Think before you bargain.title: Think before you bargain
Think before you bargain.body: This area is selling the so-called  cheap stuffs such as clothing, shoes, etc. A word of caution - don't bargain if you don't intend to buy. Once they accepted your price, you better buy it otherwise they will curse you in front of everyone. Beware of pickpockets.

Nice lanterns.title: Nice lanterns
Nice lanterns.body: If you like tourist traps, this is the place for you!  Overpriced items, ineffective bargaining since 4 stores often have one owner, food that I didn't care to try because of - well, I'd let you be the judge for your own health risks.  On the plus side, I did like the overhead lanterns.

Highlight was the Christmas store!.title: Highlight was the Christmas store!
Highlight was the Christmas store!.body: Chinatown KL was unimpressive and generally overpriced.  I would not return, except my partner ALWAYS wants to visit Chinatown.  Had a chuckle at the Christmas tree and decoration store.  I guess traditional is not the word I'd use for Chinatown KL.

THE PLACE TO SHOP.title: THE PLACE TO SHOP
THE PLACE TO SHOP.body: If you are looking for cheap gifts for friends this is the place to shop. You can get just about anything in China Town. Obviously the biggest seller is the polo and T shirts. No they are not original but they look the same. Plus they have all the trinkets you can buy from the actual tourist attractions for a lot less. Very popular.

Cheap place for shopping.title: Cheap place for shopping
Cheap place for shopping.body: When compared with another places it’s the cheapest so,it Good for shopping. We go to them with my husband in night, I feel a fear. I don’t have a reasons but it’s feeling .I prefer going to it in morning.Finally, I prefer used ober 👍🏻

Bargain.title: Bargain
Bargain.body: This market has a range of goods . Bargain as their goods are really over priced e.g I bought a Prada bag for 35 Ringits when the lady initially asked for 90 Ringits. Mainly bags and clothing available.Good experience.

Food, food, food!.title: Food, food, food!
Food, food, food!.body: You can find all kind of best food here. Foods in Chinatown not only favorable for the tourist but also the local too. We loved to take our friends from oversea to visit here for food and shop for souvenir. It is a walking distance to Dataran Merdeka and Central market. Perfect place for shop,  eat and drink.  Night life here is as crowded as day time.  Best place to enjoy!

Going downhill.title: Going downhill
Going downhill.body: Pressure selling, endlessly repetitive stalls with little imagination. Could be spectacular, seems to be losing popularity which is making the hawkers sell harder which in turn makes it less welcoming. It's a vicious circle the locals don't seem to understand at all. If they let people browse they would sell a lot more. You don't even want to make eye contact let alone look at anything. Came here 10 years ago and it was so much fun. Not this time. A shame. A victim of its own success.

A let down.title: A let down
A let down.body: Every city seems to have a town called Chinatown! This one was less interesting than others we have visited.  The food was nothing special and the stuff for sale was nothing original...try Chinatown in BKK.We would not return here and cannot recommend spending time visiting here.

Casual, Nightlife and Eatery.title: Casual, Nightlife and Eatery
Casual, Nightlife and Eatery.body: A place called Chinatown of KL. This little street even though called chinatown but the trading stalls & business mainly it is run by foreigners selling souveniers, good food and basically everything. Good for strolling, walking in the night. When buying something be sure to negotiate prices and stay sharp. It is an enjoying as well as fun.

Average Experience.title: Average Experience
Average Experience.body: Lots of stalls selling the same items.  The stall holders warn each other that you are coming and what you were looking for at their stall.  We went there once but didn't feel we needed to go back to look again.

Night visit.title: Night visit
Night visit.body: Busy night market - lots of t'shirts / handbags etc available.Street stalls - to eat with the locals :D Great place to visit (I was glad we didn't take the kids!!!!)

Crowded shopping street.title: Crowded shopping street
Crowded shopping street.body: Street stalls selling knock off. Need to really bargain. All foreign workers minding the stores. Don’t feel like it’s Chinatown. Visit if you have never been before.

Tourist trap..title: Tourist trap.
Tourist trap..body: Knock off Stuff, mainly. Rude and violent vendors. Be careful. Some things are OK but mostly over priced. Nice place for a walk. Loads of food options nearby. Some religious centres near by as well

More fun if you get in from Jalan Sultan.title: More fun if you get in from Jalan Sultan : fleshmarket !
More fun if you get in from Jalan Sultan.body: I was surprised a lot! When walking in from Jalan Sultan I took the footpath on the left. Surprise, surprise. No watches, no sunglasses, no shoes.First stop: hotel The Amigo, and a lady in the doorway selling massage. Second stop: The Excell Inn, same situation. Third stop, 55 meters further on, Alamanda Hotel, same, but lady in swimsuit and rather agressive. I checked the other day at noon: same, same, same. I did not walk any further but tried the other footpath on the right: only shoes, watches, and sunglasses. Boring, huhu.

A must visit place.title: A must visit place
A must visit place.body: Lots of weird and wonderful fruits, meat and seafood to try. Very noisy and bustling but everyone seemed friendly. A must -do thing as such an experience. Be prepared to try things. We went back a few times

chinatown - big market place.title: chinatown - big market place
chinatown - big market place.body: I went to petaling street to check out chinatown and see if I can find  little souvenirs for my friends. I guess it was an "ok" place to see, but I was not overwhelmed : lots of merchants trying to sell things that are not especially from malaysia (most didn't had anything to do with malaysia at all). It was a little smelly when I went and I was not compelled to buy anything or eat anything there. I was far more enchanted by little India, but that's my experience:) you will have to make your own and decide !

China town but Have no chinese.title: China town but Have no chinese
China town but Have no chinese.body: I like Chinese that’s why I came here ! But  have no one from China ! The mos of ppl from Malay and black ones ! Shopping is okay but Many times get ripped !

No longer Chinatown as it used to be.title: No longer Chinatown as it used to be
No longer Chinatown as it used to be.body: For me, the Petaling Street is no longer Chinatown as it used to be. Now it's infest by South Asian traders and sellers. I can say it's better to known as Dhakatown or Little Bangladesh. Even the locals avoid Petaling Street and go somewhere else.

Bargain price.title: Bargain price
Bargain price.body: Best street to do shopping. Here got lot of shops selling Clothes, watches,wallets, bags etc at Cheap price. Really you should know to bargain price. Beware of pick pocketers too.

Great street food.title: Great street food
Great street food.body: Try this place to taste the local cuisine. Very tasty food with good options. Must one time visit in KL.

Not very good palce.title: Not very good palce
Not very good palce.body: To be honest, I was not very impressed by the Chinatown in KL. It is similar to what I saw at Singapore and I experienced a lot of selling when walking around.

Lively at night.title: Lively at night
Lively at night.body: Get a lot of "Cheap" products but you must bargain. Prices are doubled for  tourists hence you must be "smart".  Lots of street food, bags, clothes, souvenirs etc. But beware of the quality...

Horrible place.title: Horrible place
Horrible place.body: Just an overpriced tourist trap of a market street run by foreigners selling fake rubbish. People on holiday with a lot of time on their hands just go here for something to do because they've heard about it and end up being ripped off, pick-pocketed or worse. The market is not even Chinese.

Nostalgic in someways but very new in ma.title: Nostalgic in someways but very new in many
Nostalgic in someways but very new in ma.body: It’s the first time I’ve been back to Chinatown in 25 years (I’ve lived there for a couple of years in my childhood).  The streets have generally not changed - ie. The layout, the older buildings on the side and some of the food places. But the atmosphere - that on the other hand has changed a lot. Going there as a tourist in my adulthood, I could understand how they’ve “improved and improvised” to cater for the many tourists - street packed with selling imitation goods, souvenirs and clothing but in doing so, they’ve lost the essence of what makes it chinatown! As per other reviewers, majority of the stalls are man by foreigners (not local Malaysians- especially not Chinese). The chinatown I remembered as a child was busy and bustling with lots of Chinese hawkers selling their goods (be it fruits, veges, food, souvenirs etc). You could hear the constant chatting and bargaining from the stall owners and shoppers, and it’s sad to see that’s all gone now. It’s still a place worth visiting to snap a few photos and tick the “I’ve been to chinatown” box, but I’m unsure if I’ll ever return for seconds.

Not a MUST SEE but a good location.title: Not a MUST SEE but a good location
Not a MUST SEE but a good location.body: I wouldn't say this is the ideal place to relax but if you like some Asian feel as well as a shopping experience, then it is what you are looking for. Despite selling fake products with big brands such as Giorgio Armani and Calvin Klein Underwear (Yes, they fake underwear!) for high prices, some of those stalls are more honest. One stall sold a fake Football jersey for 30 ringets but 80 was the cost in another. The food is amazing and the people there are quite kind and helpful...

Full of Fakes.title: Full of Fakes
Full of Fakes.body: we enjoyed the street food stalls and general bustle. The shopping arcade is a pick pocket's paradise and full of tat, but still fun.

Not Impressed.title: Not Impressed
Not Impressed.body: Compared to the Central Market just one minute away, Chinatown was very high pressure for salesmen hawking knockoffs of name brand items. I didn’t buy anything there. The covered walkway was fairly pretty with the lanterns, but that was the only part I liked. I was also hoping for more food, and was disappointed. There are two layers of vendors: the street vendors and actual storefront behind them.  The stores were slightly nicer and lower pressure, but also more expensive. TLDR: stop by if you’re interested and already in the area. Don’t bother to make a trip otherwise.

Many Foreigners.title: Many Foreigners
Many Foreigners.body: Almost all stores are manage by foreigner. You need to go few stores to compare the price. They will cut down price when you are about leaving show no interested. Grab this opportunity to buy the discount price. But make sure you survey the price first..

Chinatown walkabout..title: Chinatown walkabout.
Chinatown walkabout..body: So convenient now with MRT to bring you from Bukit Bintang @RM1.40 and stop at Pasir Seni (Central Market) Station. Exit by Petaling Street gate.

BUY BUSY BUY.title: BUY BUSY BUY
BUY BUSY BUY.body: There is so much stuff to buy here, if you want to shop.  its fun just to look too, but if you don't want a crowd then don't go here.

BUSY BUSY, stuff to buy, get some food.title: BUSY BUSY, stuff to buy, get some food
BUSY BUSY, stuff to buy, get some food.body: We had some good food here and bought some cheap knock off tee shirts, its similar to many chinatowns, but this one has some really good food!

Be Careful.title: Be Careful
Be Careful.body: I enjoyed looking at the shops, and all the fake designer gear, I didn't like the area however and didn't feel at ease here. We happened to stay in the area for one night, accidentally and when we got up we just happened to be a stone's through away from here and just wondered in. I was so on edge. If come here I would literally do the market,which is one street and get out. Wondering around that area isn't nice. The bar man in our accommodation and our Uber driver,both locals also agreed.

Petaling street.title: Petaling street
Petaling street.body: Its a street full of duplicate Chinese products like watches, rexin products , sunglasses, ask for 50% price you will get it

not as cheap.title: not as cheap
not as cheap.body: good place to go to for some shopping but watch the prices as they start very high one thing I bought started about 125rg andcame down to 75 rg some times it is cheaper at the major stores

Imitation goods shopping heaven.title: Imitation goods shopping heaven
Imitation goods shopping heaven.body: Filled with imitation goods, from any brand you can think of! I’m not a big fan on such goods but it was worth a short visit! Note that the stalls sells the same products but at different prices (depending on the seller’s mood?) So wall around and check out other stalls to get the best prices! Tip: There is a good massage palour at the center intersection for tired shoppers or tired of waiting boyfriends or dads 👍🏼

Don't go too early.title: Don't go too early
Don't go too early.body: We went too early and almost no shops were opened, which was quite disappointing.It was becoming more alive around 11 am.

Busy Street in Chinatown.title: Busy Street in Chinatown
Busy Street in Chinatown.body: This street is one of the busiest in KL. You can find all sorts of replica items of famous brands here - bags, watches , wallets, clothes and even some electronics. Its a T shaped street and it gets very crowded during the weekends and holidays. You need to really bargain to buy something at a cheaper rate and do not think much whether the items are if good quality or not. This place is good to visit while you are in KL. Other places like Central Market , Chinease temple and Kasturi walk is just adjacent to it

Great place for cheap tourist stuff.title: Great place for cheap tourist stuff
Great place for cheap tourist stuff.body: Don't come expecting real Armani products or super great quality stuff. It is what it is a touristy market in China town. there is some great street art in the general area and if you are willing to bargain great presents for home.

Tourist market.title: Tourist market
Tourist market.body: A small market full of souvenirs, handbags, tshirts and a lot of take/copy products, not worth the visit really.

Avoid this place.title: Avoid this place
Avoid this place.body: A terrible place to go shopping. Sellers are rude and intrusive. Quality of goods low. Prices may seem low, but as it is mostly cheap know-off's it's of no value. I would recommend going to the Central Market instead where you can find some proper goods, hand made in small workshops inside the market.

market.title: market
market.body: If you like markets like I like you must go there.It's in the centre of the city and you can find cheap restaurant for eating and such a good food.Super recomendable!

Good street food.title: Good street food
Good street food.body: In chaina town Kaulalumper , Malaysia near my hotel for me live in KL, so good street for food more choice for you ,Thai food , Chainese food and everything ..for enjoy to eatting,when you visit Kaulalumper i hope you come to

Not worth the time.title: Not worth the time
Not worth the time.body: Visited the shopping area on a Saturday afternoon.  Plenty of counterfeit junk on offer - often all the same junk in stall after stall.  Crowded, dirty, and unappealing.

An Identity Lost!.title: An Identity Lost!
An Identity Lost!.body: What used to be an entirely Chinese shopping area selling products unique to local culture, has now become a knock-off paradise manned by Bangladeshis, who can be rude and vulgar.Dare to bargain, starting with a quarter of the opening price. They may scold you, but so what? In the end it's your money anyway.

Something to do.title: Something to do
Something to do.body: Like little India, Chinatown is bustling but somewhat a tourist trap. The surrounding temples are nice to visit. Come here if you want cheap souvenirs

Terrible place to go shopping.title: Terrible place to go shopping
Terrible place to go shopping.body: I had planned to go to Petaling Street for a lazy afternoon of shopping for exotic Christmas gifts. I walked down the street and was ambushed by pushy sellers that were pulling at my clothes, trying to drag me into their stalls. When I respectfully declined they were rude. So I ended up walking down the street, turning away and never look back. Instead I would recommend the Central Market a few blocks away. Here the sellers are much friendlier and the quality of the goods so much better.

Shopping, eating and walking around..title: Shopping, eating and walking around.
Shopping, eating and walking around..body: In chinatown there are alot of shopping to do, specialy on Petaling street. There is also places to eat, the better ones are outside of the busy streets, around the corners from it. IT's a nice and very interesting part of the city to walk around in and the buildings are very nice to look at.

Not as Expected.title: Not as Expected
Not as Expected.body: I am a photographer, and I had in my mind that this place would be nice to wander alone, spend time, and while taking pictures. But, the area is very small, and only needs about thirty minutes to explore. And absolutely nothing interest me a lot.

Pooh.title: Pooh
Pooh.body: It was like walking through an open sewer! The smell and drains were disgusting. The street food looked and smelt good but daren't eat it. Flies everywhere. The worst Chinatown I have seen anywhere

If ur in kuala and wanna shop come here.title: If ur in kuala and wanna shop come here
If ur in kuala and wanna shop come here.body: I was in kl for jus 7 days and i had toVisit alotOf places but this one of the place which i went alot cause this was one of the places wer i coukd buy alot of things for frds and family its nice its cheap and u can bargain the price if ur not happy u can go to the next shop because most of the places they have the same things they have fake louis vuitton bag u name it and its there ... i believe every one should go there atleast once ... its easier if u go by uber or taxi if not u can go by train too ... close to the china town there is central market so u should and have a look too ..

Non Chinatown.title: Non Chinatown
Non Chinatown.body: It's no longer the 'Chinatown' as it used to be.  Place is now being managed by foreigners, instead of Malaysians.  The usual Chinese businesses and small stalls are now being manned by Bangladeshis, employed by the Chinese owners.  It has lost its "Chinatown" origin as one can now feel  being overwhelmed by the foreign workers, shouting their wares. It is very sad that it no longer has its "Chinatown" charm.  But still an experience to walk through the 2 roads of stalls.  This is one place to show off your bargaining skills!However, be ready to guard your belongings and keep your handbags close to you.

A great place to visit if you have never.title: A great place to visit if you have never been before
A great place to visit if you have never.body: China Town in KL is a great place to visit and to take visitors to, many "fake" things to buy, just remember to bargain heavily!! If you don't get the price you want, walk away as there will be plenty more stalls selling the same item further on. Lot's of great food stalls & restaurants around as well, not 5 start with White Linen table clothes though...

All life is here.title: All life is here
All life is here.body: Chinatown is a refreshing change from the glitzy malls elsewhere in the city. Easily accessible on foot, there is a newly opened transport station nearby. Some of the old buildings have protected status so hopefully will be preserved. There is a lively market, aimed at tourists but fun. Some of the small hotels in the area are still standing, cheap but not dry cheerful! A fun place to wander around. Several Chinese temples, with incense wafting into the street.

Bars?? What bars??.title: Bars?? What bars??
Bars?? What bars??.body: Ive been here twice, seeking out the amazing backpacker nightlife I keep reading about. Nope. Just lots and lots...and lots of the same crammed in market stalls. If you enjoy shuffling in single file though and looking at the same watches, bags and bracelets on repeat every 3rd stall, then this is definitely the place for you.

Most bogus place.title: Most bogus place
Most bogus place.body: We have visited this place hoping for good and reasonable things to buy,but this market sell cheap cloths,there are number of massage parlors but most of them filled with prostitutes,streets are very narrow full of crowed some small road side restaurant are good but some were smelling very badly...sorry not recommended for class tourist.

Shopping and bartering!.title: Shopping and bartering!
Shopping and bartering!.body: Brilliant place to buy fake goods and Chinese kimonos and things. I came away with bags of stuff. You MUST barter, they want you too! You can always get up to 40 per cent off of the first price and you still leave the stall holder smiling. Great place to visit for gifts

Like so many other Chinatowns..title: Like so many other Chinatowns.
Like so many other Chinatowns..body: It's a place to visit , like we do in so many other towns . Nothing special or very different . If you have some spare time ...

Street food, souvenirs and bubbler..title: Street food, souvenirs and bubbler.
Street food, souvenirs and bubbler..body: Had fun walking around and looking for souvenirs. Ended up eating / taste testing everything that we haven't seen before and buying keychains and ref door magnets. Surprised to see one kiosk exclusively selling bubbler/glass bongs "souvenirs". That was interesting. Traveled November 2016.

Filthy Squalid Conditions.title: Filthy Squalid Conditions
Filthy Squalid Conditions.body: This is not an attraction, this is a slum. None of the vendors seem to be Chinese. Nothing to buy but fake junk. We wish we would have worn rubber boots, it was that dirty. So many better places to shop. Wouldn't go there again. Waste of two hours. Squalid conditions like out of a British colonial novel.

Best place to buy fakes bags, belts, wha.title: Best place to buy fakes bags, belts, whatever
Best place to buy fakes bags, belts, wha.body: I had been in many markets in Thailand and in Kuala Lumpur chinatown is the best place to buy the latest and more fashionable bags, belts, sleeps and many things. The best prices are here, and alzó the best quality if you really want to buy leather ones

Always good for cheap knock-offs.title: Always good for cheap knock-offs
Always good for cheap knock-offs.body: There are two times to go to Chinatown market - during the day when the main stalls are open or at night when they place additional stalls down the middle of the walkway.  There is an obvious problem when they increase the number of stalls - it becomes very squeezy and on a hot and humid night this can be unbearable.  Of course the atmosphere changes and as an experience the night market is so much fun.  Haggling at any time is imperative and if they don’t come down to your price just walk away- there is a good chance you will get the price you want at a stall with the same goods not far away.  Important thing is to have fun and also enjoy a break at the Swiss Inn in the Main part of the market.

good place for shopping.title: good place for shopping
good place for shopping.body: if you love the shopping go to this place, alot of shops which having everything you can imagine new and old with a very good prices.i went there 3 times during my visit to KL and i bought many things.Nice place and resturants arround.

The Petaling Street = the Bukit Bintang.title: The Petaling Street = the Bukit Bintang
The Petaling Street = the Bukit Bintang.body: The Petaling Street (Chinatown) in Kuala Lumpur is like the Bukit Bintang of the older part of Kuala Lumpur

A bargain buy place.title: A bargain buy place
A bargain buy place.body: The place is around 4 minutes walk from the nearest metro station and just next to the central market. The stuff ordered is fake or cheap copies and there is big scope for bargaining of you are planning to buy anything. I'll suggest anyone visiting this place to carry limited cash and no valuables as the place is a little shady

strolling around.title: strolling around
strolling around.body: Went here by LRT, station Pasar Seni. Probably the best time to visit is at night, because it is very hot and im not sure the stalls are open at noon. The goods price are not expensive yet not so cheap, you have to bargain at least 30% of offering price. You can find everything here, from foods, souvenirs, shirts, etc. Overcrowded on weekend. Beware of thieves, make sure to secure your belongings. Anyway, worth to visit at least once.

Something for everyone.title: Something for everyone
Something for everyone.body: If you're looking for something cheap for your holiday or gifts for a friend, here is where you need to go. They can sell anything to anyone, but be prepared to barter! There are lots of great food stalls here too, so you won't go hungry!

A chinatown is a chinatown.title: A chinatown is a chinatown
A chinatown is a chinatown.body: The problem I have with Chinatowns in foreign cities is that they are all exactly the same. They are busy, shops sell the exact same things and people and most of the times hygiene is neglected in the Chinatowns. This one was no exception I'm afraid.

got some great bargains here.title: got some great bargains here
got some great bargains here.body: great bargains, good atmosphere  and nicely decoratedbut you must also know when to say nois usually crowded but in a good wayJust do not know why this is called a fleamarket because they only sell new stuff, also  counterfeit stuff, bjut nothing second hand as far as I could see

Not the Chinatown that it was..title: Not the Chinatown that it was.
Not the Chinatown that it was..body: This place is not an indication of what Chinatown should be, it’s so commercial now it has lost all its charm.  The street vendors are no longer Chinese, mostly illegal Burmese immigrants selling counterfeit items.  Yes, there are some heritage shops still around dealing with traditional food and cakes, they are still good bit sad to say most of the other stalls are rubbish.

its called ForeignerTown.title: its called ForeignerTown
its called ForeignerTown.body: Really lack of local though own by mostly chinese owners ... though it is cleaner and shaded but the ambience could be less than comfortable. lots of good food nevertheless

Super Hot & Crowded.title: Super Hot & Crowded
Super Hot & Crowded.body: We did not come to do any shopping but only to eat in the middle of the day, probably wrong time to come.  It was soooo oppressively hot & humid, crowded & no A/C anywhere.  Food was delicious but the surroundings & everything else we did not really need.

Crazy Bustling.title: Crazy Bustling
Crazy Bustling.body: 3.5 Stars for our visit:We came for lunch to Petaling  before our own walking tour of attractions nearby & found it a busy maze inside covered canopy.  Very crowded at mid-day, hot & stifling so it was not the best time to visit.  We ate in the food center, not have any A/C unfortunately & we were dizzy, faint from the heat.  Food was delicious & we ate well, had Chinese food choosing from items prepared and placed out.

Night market and local food..title: Night market and local food.
Night market and local food..body: Worth going to check out the local food and this fake goods haha.If you planing to get some fake goods, always bargains the price. Exp: if they offer RM300, always bargain at least 80% lower and tell them you will pay only RM70.

Vivid and lively.title: Vivid and lively
Vivid and lively.body: It is very vivid and lively and we can really enjoy the street market and food. I fully recommend very cheap items and used ones. Also there are so many street food including Malaysian, Indian and Chinese cuisine. If you want to get fresh vegetables, fruits, meats and any local intems, please visit there.

Quite disappointing.title: Quite disappointing
Quite disappointing.body: A lot of people recommended that i go to petaling street for buying souvenirs or cheap shopping, besides it was pretty high rated on trip advisor too for go to places in KL. I visited petaling street on my way back from the central market so i had already bought most of the souvenirs but i didn’t regret buying them from central market at all. Stuff may have been slightly cheaper here but the experience of shopping here is extremely unpleasant. Its walkways are very narrow, extremely crowded, shop keepers are literally following you and forcing you to buy stuff. Quite frankly nothing seemed to be worth my money.Not recommended!

Not bad.title: Not bad
Not bad.body: Some shops has a good discount for chocolate and coffe but electronic stuff are not gauranteed and u may smell some weird things 😅

FUFU CLOTHES.title: FUFU CLOTHES
FUFU CLOTHES.body: Man got Supreme, man Fully brand. Big man thing, sellers bit annoying, but cool tho. Get discount, get cheap price dont let them foool you. okay boom.

ok type of place just to grab some souve.title: ok type of place just to grab some souvenior
ok type of place just to grab some souve.body: Grabbed some T-Shirts of twin tower image !!!Walk around ,friend of mine purchased some copy watch etc.

Market to buy souvenirs.title: Market to buy souvenirs
Market to buy souvenirs.body: Its like divisoria in manila. Cheap items to buy pasalubong and souvenirs. Buy more to get lowest price!

Ideal if you are into fake designer item.title: Ideal if you are into fake designer items
Ideal if you are into fake designer item.body: I am not into markets but we wanted to visit this part of  Kuala Lumpur since it’s it near to the central market , Masjid Jamek mosque . It was a good job that we went hence I ended up buying my girl friend 3 designer hand bags. Like all the markets you need to be a though  barterer . You should be able to get at least 40% of the asking price . Don’t be shy and stick to your price and be prepare to walk away if your offer is not met . Look around at leats 3 stalls and check the asking price to get an idea about the starting price . It’s an good experience I would highly recommend it . Don’t forget the central market is 5 minutes away with an all together different shopping experience and has lots of food stalls and coffee places .

Terrible not worth to go.title: Terrible not worth to go
Terrible not worth to go.body: I got a shock when I went there.... although i very long never go there but it was totally changed!!! It shouldn't call Chinatown should change name to Arab town!!! Very few Chinese local there... the famous KL hokkien noodle Jin Lian ji was the most terrible noodle I had tried!!! The last time I came was nice but now cooked was not cooked by Chinese, all foreigner... cheap labor damn horrible taste!! I recommend if want to try KL hokkien noodle either go to lot 10 hutong or Sunway Pyramid. Here totally waste your trip...

You have to see this place.title: You have to see this place
You have to see this place.body: This is an experience not to miss. Its all a load of copies, buyer beware. Its a lot of fun haggling with the sellers get it as cheap as possible

very cheap.title: very cheap
very cheap.body: i learnd a lots of chinese culture and malaysia travel spot. we have been spend the day to around this place to seeking many gift, its lowest price

Good history but now a tourist trap.title: Good history but now a tourist trap
Good history but now a tourist trap.body: Classic Chinatown with crowded streets and lots of shops/stalls selling watches, sunglasses clothes and memmentos. Good for  a walk through and a cheap Tiger beer

Same same but not really different.title: Same same but not really different
Same same but not really different.body: Same same but not really different. Copy copy copy a little lacklustre for a Chinatown precinct. All the same copy items and no real reason to want to buy

Too messy.title: Too messy
Too messy.body: Noisy and dirty, i wish i didnt go. I know that there are some very good restaurants there, but the streets are so messy that i simply didnt feel like eating there. And the shoos sell a lot of crappy items. Not charming at all for me, but it could potentially become much better under the right management

Amazing place to visit.title: Amazing place to visit
Amazing place to visit.body: Fantastic atmosphere and great place for bartering for your holiday shopping. You can buy almost anything there but the fun is bartering on the price. Great experience

go for the fake products....title: go for the fake products...
go for the fake products....body: all kind of fake products like watches, belts, bags etc. etc you can buy there at Petaling street. They build up from 15;00 hrs and will stay till late evening. Do not pay the asked prices as the game is to deal. Be aware that all products are fake and that it is by law not allowed to bring these goods to your country

China.title: China
China.body: The China town was good, I' ve never been in China so far but in this street you can experience China a little bit. There is plenty of Chinese and Malaysian foods and drinks. There is a bunch of stores ,like bazar, which sells different kinds of meat, fruits and...

Average place.title: Average place
Average place.body: Not worth the hassle visiting this place much cheaper items at the local stores within the city of KL. Hawkers charge tourist prices, don't forget to bargain.Overall worth visiting but not a must

A must to visit.title: A must to visit
A must to visit.body: Central Market in China Town are a must to visit when in KL.Not only touristic attraction also nice for shopping

Great atmoshere.title: Great atmoshere
Great atmoshere.body: This is a great market for handbags, shirts, watches etc. I bought a small rucksack but I realised many stalls sell the same things so suss out the prices from different stalls of what you want. Then go for a third of what they ask and hopefully you can get it for half of what they asked for! Everyone takes this in good spirit so keep smiling through the bartering process.

More Disappointing with Each Visit.title: More Disappointing with Each Visit
More Disappointing with Each Visit.body: Good if you're looking for cheap knock-offs and want to test your haggling skills. Way too crowded and not much variety of stuff. Food there a little overpriced.

Light shopping.title: Light shopping
Light shopping.body: You can always nego with them.Bought two Soccer jerseys $30rm each short sleeve & Long sleeve.Actually they sell almost everything the same there. You’ll have to walk around first and recce the price before buying them

Crowded Market.title: Crowded Market
Crowded Market.body: Interesting place to visit but nothing worth to buy. If don't mind about fake goods, this is a good place to go.

Beef noodles & Musang King Durian.title: Beef noodles & Musang King Durian
Beef noodles & Musang King Durian.body: If you go to this place to find some souvenir, you have to bargain with the seller. Remember the quality of the souvenir at herw is not good as you think.I like go here to eat beef noodle, durian musangking and air mata kuching. Must try.

Not like before.. much change.title: Not like before.. much change
Not like before.. much change.body: Market is full of junk and doesn't seem to be run my Chinese so give has changed. Rather just go to Sung Wei mall to get same stuff and nicer people.  Some of the hawkers are rude!

Place to go to buy a handbag.title: Place to go to buy a handbag
Place to go to buy a handbag.body: Jumped on the LRT to get to Chinatown, so easy to get to. Really just a market with lots,of stalls selling fake brand gear. Handbags, watches the usual things. The stall holders are easy going and don't hassle you though.

Crowded and dirty.title: Crowded and dirty
Crowded and dirty.body: Though the place is a delight for shoppers, the crowded atmosphere and dirt makes it an unpleasant experience.

Best Markets ever \" FANTASTIC\".title: Best Markets ever " FANTASTIC"
Best Markets ever \" FANTASTIC\".body: Great Souvenir Market PlaceThis is the place to go if you want a bargain and souvenir's. You could spend hours going through these markets and still not see everything. There is an abundance of stalls for souvenir's, top quality clothing, luggage etc. to small restaurant's. I love this place and would definitely recommend to family and friends. Can't wait to go back again to see more of this awesome tourist place.

overly crowded.title: overly crowded
overly crowded.body: To be fai, I'm  not fan of too crowded places  but this particular place made me claustrophobic as hell. I remember mongkok and temple street in Hong Kong as busy but this place takes thw crown. Full of fake brands and beware of petty thieves. For the die hard tourists..

Typical Asian market.title: Typical Asian market
Typical Asian market.body: Petaling street is KL’s China town. Haggle away ! It’s your typical Asian market but I’ve seen better markets. But if you want to shop for souvenirs, you can get good deals

Great place to pick up some genuinely ba.title: Great place to pick up some genuinely bad fakes!
Great place to pick up some genuinely ba.body: Good fun to wander around so long as you don't take too much of an interest in a punters stand as more than likely you will be harassed until you part with your money.  Cool little street food stands, a total must.

Just for a Laugh and a phony phone, watc.title: Just for a Laugh and a phony phone, watch, bag
Just for a Laugh and a phony phone, watc.body: This is a fun walk down a major street full of vendors selling everything from watches, hand phones, and ladies bags..BEWARE many of these maybe knockoffs, or bootleg. Just remember if the price is too good to be true...it is! That being said you can a great time walking down the main street and find a shirt, jacket or dress, or better still you can try eating at any of the local shop behind the main shops and find great Chinese foods very cheap and very delicious.

Shopping with the cheaper price.title: Shopping with the cheaper price
Shopping with the cheaper price.body: Have a lot of souvenir,local handmade with the cheaper price. We also can negotiation about the price

Shop shop shop and eat.title: Shop shop shop and eat
Shop shop shop and eat.body: This was a great night spent at china town.  Plenty to see buy and eat. Would recommend a visit.  Friendly store holders, joking and helpful

Hmmm.....title: Hmmm....
Hmmm.....body: If you are looking for a bargain for cheap 'original look-alike", this is the place. You can find almost everything under the sky here and at a very affordable price if you are good at bargaining. Just be informed of the quality as some may last just short period of time. But some are still good bargain.Still. its a must see if you are in KL to feel the excitement of the environment here.

Not that great...title: Not that great..
Not that great...body: Small shops offering clones of watches, glases, cloths and stuff.. bargain/walk away if you find it interesting..

Crowded but fun.title: Crowded but fun
Crowded but fun.body: Very crowdes and narrow.So many bargains and copy goods. If you dont like the smell of malay/chinese food then this is not the place to go.Be prepared to haggle hard.

Nice market for bargains and cheap food.title: Nice market for bargains and cheap food
Nice market for bargains and cheap food.body: Chinatown!! Bargain Bargain Bargain....branded replcas easiy available at lower price, and if there is suffice time, it is a must visit place for shoppers!!

Good for trinkets.title: Good for trinkets
Good for trinkets.body: Great place to buy trinkets and gifts especially in Petaling St before leaving for home. Make sure you bargain well as the first price offered is not the real price. Loads of fun for all.

Nothing great!.title: Nothing great!
Nothing great!.body: Walked through on a wet day in KL, it was a mass of stalls selling ‘genuine‘ fakes! Stall upon stall with little to distinguish them, the constant hassle from the stall holders was very annoying. One of the places I would not bother with if I returned to KL. Visit by all means but an hour is enough.

Not my favorite.title: Not my favorite
Not my favorite.body: We went to ChinaTown our first night in KL. It was not my favorite experience. I found it to be way too touristy and the food we tried was not good. To be fair, we really were overwhelmed by the amount of food offered throughout and didn't know what to order. But we also were not impressed with the amount of fake designer merchandise sold everywhere and the number of westerners buying it. Disappointing.

Really worthless and just a hassle.title: Really worthless and just a hassle
Really worthless and just a hassle.body: If you're interested in same overpriced low quality things repetitively displayed, go here. Otherwise, you're better off going to a regular mall like Times Square behind The Federal Hotel in Bukit Bintang, where you pay basically the same money, get much better quality, aren't hassled constantly, and find much more diversity of goods but without dust and filth on them in an A/C environment.

Don\u2019t waste your time.title: Don’t waste your time
Don\u2019t waste your time.body: China Town is supposed to be great for shopping - but we weren’t impressed. The only benefit of going is that I now know what it is. Not one person in our group of 3 bought anything. However, we did find a lot of items at the air conditioned Central Market instead (which I highly recommend). I’ve been to many markets in Asia (Thailand, Vietnam, China) and South America and this is the only one NOT worth a visit. It’s just a closed off street with stalls that have the exact same items as the next one. There is one cross street. I kept hoping we would find something unique — nope.

Busy street..title: Busy street.
Busy street..body: Also known for Petaling Street. Day or night, visitors keep coming to Petaling Street to either dine on the famous street foods here or to get some good bargains on things sold here. Petaling Street is the shoppers' paradise if you want to bargain your way to some cheap things (Fake of Branded items). A stone's throw away is the Central Market of Kuala Lumpur .. which is air-conditioned.Be ready to do a lot of bargaining.

Don't get the hype.title: Don't get the hype
Don't get the hype.body: I really don't understand what the hype is with this place. It is literally a closed off road full of the same market stalls on repeat. We walked down it and didn't particularly want to turn back to go to the bus stop as we got majorly harrassed. You need tunnel vision whilst walking through if you are not interested in buying anything.

mr.title: mr
mr.body: great place to shop for bargains any kind of merchandise you can think of very safe and the people are very helpful

Be Aware of Fraud in Kotaraya-Chinatown.title: Be Aware of Fraud in Kotaraya-Chinatown Petaling-Kasturi Street, As Long As You Are Aware,Everything is Gonna Be Alright
Be Aware of Fraud in Kotaraya-Chinatown.body: My friend needed to buy a mobile phone, then he went to Kotaraya Mall. Kotaraya is near Chinatown Petaling Street. It can be said as the same area with Chinatown Petaling street and Kasturis but separated with main roads. At Kotaraya Mall, 1st seller from official mobile phone store approached and offered him a mobile phone with the price as RM 700. The mobile phone store was looked like official with branded mobile phone logo. He said it was included free simcard, charger, power bank and cover. It was a package, he said. Because the package price looked very cheap, compared to normal price, then my friend agreed for buying the mobile phone and gave the money to seller. The 1st seller passed the money to his friend at the store.The 2nd seller appeared from the store and approached them. He said to activate the mobile phone, he offered the registration form to sign, then my friend sign the form. The other seller asked the passport number and existing phone number, and he acted to register the passport number for registration.Then the 2nd seller explained that there were different package price between the package price from the store and from mobile phone provider. He said to my friend that the phone price as RM 700 is not included for activation. So, if my friend would like to activate the phone must pay RM 1320 for internet package. But my friend insisted that he paid the price of RM 700 for the phone that was included the activation. My friend said that in anywhere, the price was included when people buy a mobile phone and the phone itself was ready to use regardless price.Then the 3rd seller appeared from somewhere and approached the crowded (my friend, 1st seller and 2nd seller) and said that it was true that the phone could not be used without activation. He said my friend could pay with installment if he could not pay 1 time payment. So, he offered to my friend the installment as RM 110 x 12 (for twelve months) by using credit card.My friend said he didn't have any credit card and kept insisting that he paid RM 700 for the phone that they promised in advance. My friend did not want to installment by using credit card. He also didn’t want pay any extra money. The seller said it was ok then. But when my friend asked for his money RM 700 back, they said they could not get it back because they had already registered my friend’s name and passport on the mobile provide system. It had been registered, so the money could not be returned. My friend insisted and asked them to return his money. They said my friend had signed the form and it was considered as penalty fee because of cut-off the agreement. My friend got mad and said this was a fraud and you were scumbag. He said that he would report them to police. When he asked where the police station, no one there (including all sellers from neighbor stores there), none of them gave my friend any information about the location police station. They all said you could not report to the police because you were foreigner. My friend went out from Kotaraya Mall and looked for police station. By the information from people outside Mall, finally he reached the near police station and reported to the police officer. He said that he was a student of state/national university in KL and he told his story to the police. They were a fraud syndicate group. Then suddenly, a call came into my friend’s phone. My friend picked up his phone and someone said that why he reported to the police, it was no use. Then my friend said please explain it to the police.  My friend gave his phone to the police officer. The officer threatened them by saying it was a fraud and they were scumbag. Before he wrote an official police report, please return the money back. The seller said that not to make a report and he promised to return the money. Then the police cut-off the conversation and asked my friend to go there to pick up his money. My friend went back to the mobile phone store and asked, “where is my money?” One of sellers returned the money of RM 700 to my friend. Afterward, my friend left the cursed place immediately for good.So, beware of fraud syndicate around Kotaraya area as well as Chinatown Petaling Street area, because I have heard the same modus operandi with different group/team are in this area too.I love go walking, side-seeing and shopping in Kotaraya area - Chinatown Petaling Street area - Kasturi Street area. As long as you are aware the same, similar, even different type modus operandi that might be happened, every thing is gonna be alright then.

Nothing more special than any other Chin.title: Nothing more special than any other China Town you’ve seen
Nothing more special than any other Chin.body: It is what it is.. a China town. So if you’ve been to a couple of China towns elsewhere in the past, this one is probably a let down. I didn’t see any great bargains here or anything unique in terms of what was being sold. Most of the shops were being run by Indians and Bangladeshis rather than Chinese though I am pretty sure the stuff they were selling was made in China.I picked up a few cheap and ordinary mementos to take back home but was done with the crowded street in a quick 45 min walk without coming across anything that really caught my attention.

Busy Place.title: Busy Place
Busy Place.body: We visited Chinatown a number of times during our stay. It is certainly a beehive of activity. At first the Bangladeshi stallholders and their persistent and insistent sales pitch was very intimidating but after we got used to it we just ignored the stalls where items for sale weren't of interest to us. We did learn how to haggle when we were wanting to buy. We were able to purchase quite a few presents by sticking to our low offer and being prepared to walk away if they wouldn't drop their price enough. We did get one stalholder to drop the price of a leather satchel from RM385 to RM70 by not being intimidated. The restaurants are good too. Look for places the locals pack out and you should be fine. The noodle shops across from the old barber shop were the best we found.

Targeted at Tourist.title: Targeted at Tourist
Targeted at Tourist.body: It was raining heavily when I went to Chinatown. There is mostly no shelter & the floor was slightly flooded. It will be pretty lively if there isn't any rain. It was 10-15 mins walk from the train station.

Interesting place..title: Interesting place.
Interesting place..body: This is a very busy market where vendors use everything in their power to persuade you to buy their stuff.  It is an experience one should not not miss out on.  But do not linger at a stall if you don't want to buy.

Hall of mirror.title: Hall of mirror
Hall of mirror.body: Fake football shirts, fake trainers, fake watches & fake handbags. Then repeat forever. This place is a waste of time.

Fake Chinatown.title: Fake Chinatown
Fake Chinatown.body: This was a absolute disappointment for me.Expected to see real Chinese shops and products, but it was just a street with some Chinese lanterns and only local people with tourist shops...Went to Chinatown in Bangkok before, it was so much better. Complete pig heads for sale, giant fish in aquaria, etc.

Mainly for cheap shopping..title: Mainly for cheap shopping.
Mainly for cheap shopping..body: Good and cheap restaurants nearby. Try durian fruit. Handmade stuffs but also fake items. Pay attention to what you buy. Good Central point to visit rest of KL.

Chinatown Markets.title: Chinatown Markets
Chinatown Markets.body: Average markets, some bargains. There are plenty of souvenirs and a zillion watches to buy. We also had lunch at a quaint little Chinese restaurant upstairs.

Lots of delicious street food can be fou.title: Lots of delicious street food can be found!
Lots of delicious street food can be fou.body: Its more than a tourist attraction. For many, this place contain dozens of good food memory of their.

Eating and shopping.title: Eating and shopping
Eating and shopping.body: One of the many places to indulger in KL. Reasonable prices and huge selection of various goods. Not overly special, but situated adjacent to Chinatown and central market.

Very Busy.title: Very Busy
Very Busy.body: Restaurants, stalls, vendors, hawkers and a lot of people. Something for everyone, but busy. Mainly shopping and eating, not overly special but worthwhile when in the area.

Great place for cheap studf.title: Great place for cheap studf
Great place for cheap studf.body: Seriously busy but you can get pretty much anything you want for a 1/10th of the price of what you’d normally buy for it.Be prepared to barter as well!

Many people.title: Many people
Many people.body: This place really good to buy something cheapers..many choice..very crowded..before several year to visit china town..and to show for our family..how their bussiness..before many chiness operated there..but this year after 2 years not going there i saw many Indonesian/bangladesh people work there..

get the gifts from Chanatown.title: get the gifts from Chanatown
get the gifts from Chanatown.body: as we know the travelers eventually gonna buy gift or antiques for his lovers or something to remind him about this trip, make your plan to visit Chinatown and you will find all the kind of gifts like clothes , bags,suitcase,twin towers statue,toys,women accessories and perfumes all more with cheap price but you have to bargaining on price,don't be hurry Chinatown has many shops,so take your time to see what you need, hope you all enjoy the trip

Memorable!.title: Memorable!
Memorable!.body: While I'm not a huge fan of KL or its Chinatown (childhood experiences), I had fun visiting Petaling Street again with my family, as there's always great deals to be found and while one could call the sights, sounds and smells overwhelming, I like to think of it as a unique experience.

Wow busy busy.title: Wow busy busy
Wow busy busy.body: Wow very busy crowded hot and great shopping . Bags galore shoes and clothes watches jewellery. Street food galore .

A place for shopping, food and cheap hos.title: A place for shopping, food and cheap hostels
A place for shopping, food and cheap hos.body: Chinatown in KL got few things to offer. Cheap hostels, good local foods with low price, beautiful old architecture to see and take pictures and to do some shopping specially for souvenir, but don't forget to bargain, prices are almost double of what it should be. After asking for price, just say it's expensive and walk away, he gonna continue down for u sometimes tochqpf, then u can return back to buy haha.

Good fun.title: Good fun
Good fun.body: Lots of shops and restaurants and the big Petaling Market. All in all a great place to go - I would go later in the day and have dinner there and do the markets then rather then early in the day when the atmosphere is less.

Not that cheap shopping.title: Not that cheap shopping
Not that cheap shopping.body: In my experience this is a first china town I`ve visited. You should go there if you need to buy souvenirs, t shirts or fake accessories. First of all you need to negotiate a lot, otherwise your purchase will be expensive. Be ready you may see rats and the area smells not that pleasant, this place only for those who really need to make wholesale purchase, but if you just want to see the place it doesn`t worth it.

What happened?.title: What happened?
What happened?.body: Petaling street was a great kl tourist attraction lots of fun people watching, eating, drinking and haggling with Chinese stall and shop owners. Last trip two years ago now where are the Chinese? Most stalls now seem run by non Malaysians and these people are not fun. Many shops closed the restaurants are being driven out by the Talibanisation process it's much quieter and frankly has an air of run down desperation. Not going back I'm afraid oh and Jalan sultan has been destroyed by an ugly train station and gentrification gone is the Foo King Coffin shop and it's like. So sad

Qatar.title: Qatar
Qatar.body: You can find cheap goods and food and And nice  fake braYou will find Trish fruit and beautiful gifts

Pleasure Walk.title: Pleasure Walk
Pleasure Walk.body: Nice stuffBargain as much as you canWalk away is very narrowPlace is smelly at timesNice place for Ladies bags cheaper clothing and accessories

If you want to save more from souvenirs,.title: If you want to save more from souvenirs, then you should go here!!
If you want to save more from souvenirs,.body: There are a lot of things to buy here. From clothes, pins, dumplings, ref magnets, and all. Name it!! Be aware that if you want to buy something authentic, don't go here!! Almost everything here are all fake. But if you want to spend less just for the sake of souvenirs, I highly recommend this place. Also, be cautious about your things because there are a lot of pickpockets here ;)TIP: Don't take walking tours here. You can visit the whole place just by yourself! :)

Great place to eat & have some fun.title: Great place to eat & have some fun
Great place to eat & have some fun.body: Our group of four walked into Petaling Street @3pm for some late lunch & then on to a bit of market shopping. There is a variety of eateries to choose from with varied styles of food.We were mainly there to do some shopping in the market stalls so after lunch we hit the street. Plenty of opertunity to bargain hard & we didn't dissapoint. We walked the four parts of the street & bought a few things. The market starts to really get busy @6pm so keep your senses about you whilst you are there.

Two sisters.title: Two sisters
Two sisters.body: Such fun , good natured haggling , no more to say some like it some don’t because traders start at a wildly expensive and hopefully ends with both parties happy

Food in Petaling Street.title: Food in Petaling Street
Food in Petaling Street.body: There are many great restaurants in this area and several cuisines to choose from.  The food is good and very reseanable with prices.  Some restaurants have smaller plates of food than others so choose wisely.  Lots of massage and pedicure places for after you have eaten also.

Pasar Malan.title: Pasar Malan
Pasar Malan.body: Most vendors are selling the same items. Bargaining is welcome and you can get better discount when you buy in bulk.

Cheap street food.title: Cheap street food
Cheap street food.body: We went there very early in the morning so half of the places were still closed, but I figure the place must be lively during the day, thought we didn’t stay there long enough to see as we liked to avoid the crowds. There were interesting local restaurant to try real-local-Chinese food with just about 6-7RM, very worthy to try.

A place for fake brands..title: A place for fake brands.
A place for fake brands..body: All fake brands and first copy of products will be available. T-shirts, wallets, sunglasses, bags, shoes and watches are common items you will find there. They will price you very high but if you have good negotiating skills you can buy some fake products.

Cheap but low quality products.title: Cheap but low quality products
Cheap but low quality products.body: My honest opinionYeah! You can save a lot ! But it is safe? Its up to you to judge 😅Be careful with your surroundings coz got high record of thief around the area. let’s say go there on ur own riskOn the other hand, its instagrammable afterall 😀

Nice street to walk but slightly messy..title: Nice street to walk but slightly messy.
Nice street to walk but slightly messy..body: Previously my visit there were roadworks but I think it's ok now. If you like street food then this place is just for you. Prices are relatively average, not really dirt cheap. Go walk around you won't regret.

Place to shop for fake designer goods an.title: Place to shop for fake designer goods and being annoyed by sellers
Place to shop for fake designer goods an.body: If you're really into this kind of stuff, then the best time to visit is at the end of the day, if you just want to take a picture visit early in the day when the streets are still empty. In the evening

Just a shopping belt that sells all the.title: Just a shopping belt that sells all the same things..
Just a shopping belt that sells all the.body: Think: counterfeit branded bags, leather goods, watches etc.etc. That's really all about it on Petaling street. Other than that, it's just street food. Nothing much to rave about for this street. Central Market, which is about 5 mins walk away is a much better place to shop.

All kinds of everything.title: All kinds of everything
All kinds of everything.body: The markets are a great spot. You can find all kinds of 100% genuine fakes here. I didn’t purchase but friends did and to be fair the stuff looked good. There’s a lovely atmosphere on the street. Not the best china town I’ve been to but a good 1 all the same

Poor Quality products sell at high price.title: Poor Quality products sell at high price
Poor Quality products sell at high price.body: It is an over priced tourist trap selling very poor quality cheap items on a market street. They are selling only fake rubbish good. People go there because they've heard about it. There are small shops selling local food items are also there. Don't buy goods from this place they are made of low quality chaina products.

Good place to get cheap goods.title: Good place to get cheap goods
Good place to get cheap goods.body: It is good place to get cheap duplicate china goods. The goods are of very poor quality. If you bargain they will lower the price. There is lot of cheating is happen in this market. Food are cheap and good. All be careful when you purchase goods from this place.

Bustling!.title: Bustling!
Bustling!.body: Plenty of traders peddling fake designer goods , if you’re interested, be prepared to haggle hard! If you’re not , don’t tarry- they often won’t take no for an answer! Keep a tight grip on your bags , pickpockets are not unknown in the area. Very busy with tourists, shoppers and traders. Take a blue cab to get there and back ,some of the red cab drivers are somewhat less than scrupulous!

A must do that lives up to expectations.title: A must do that lives up to expectations
A must do that lives up to expectations.body: Chinatown often appears the same in most big cities but this is quite extensive and both markets and side shops. Bought some really nice items here. We would not have eaten in the street without encouragement from some friends as pretty basic facilities but the food was amazing and fully recommended

Very cheap and vibrant.title: Very cheap and vibrant
Very cheap and vibrant.body: Famous for tourists. There are many shops and streetfood and very crowded with tourists. You can also haggle the prices here to as low as possible.

Interesting Area To Visit..title: Interesting Area To Visit.
Interesting Area To Visit..body: Another area that I would recommend to other travelers to visit. It was easy to reach and lots of points of interest to us.

Good Deal..title: Good Deal.
Good Deal..body: if you want to find a gift for your family,friends, or neighbor you can go to this place, They served many choices such as key chain, and other malaysian signage here, or you can find a fake poloshirt, bags, wallets, belt and many things but don't forget to bid in a lowest price to the seller, if not you will received a tourist price, which is higher than usual. this place similar likes a patpong market in Thai or Ladies market in Hong Kong. You can also find a lot of food street here, the taste was good, but be careful for non halal food there. enjoy!

China town visit.title: China town visit
China town visit.body: The people selling goods are really unfriendly lot, seems they are filled with some kind of hatred, dunno what! Very rude​ sellers. I saw a product mobile ring , did not understand what it was, on asking I was told rudely it's a 'mobile ring' in asking what does that mean, he says I am supposed to know it, when I checking the product , I just said wow and walked away.behind me he was ranting away in some unknown language.i think they should just convert it to Chinese food street and it will do very very well.you can miss it without any regret.

Good for fake stuff..title: Good for fake stuff.
Good for fake stuff..body: Go there if want to buy knock-ons of fake wellknown expensive brands of watches, bags, Pens, etc. It's a partially covered street about 3-400 feet long. The street is full of cart-shops with vendors crying out their wares. Bargain, haggle, bargain.

Good for Souvenirs.title: Good for Souvenirs
Good for Souvenirs.body: This place is good for souvenirs and cheap products. From its name, China Town, it is full of Chinese people and Chinese products.

Cheap tourist tack at the market.title: Cheap tourist tack at the market
Cheap tourist tack at the market.body: Not much new to see here, just the same old cheap plastic and counterfeit "goods" from China. A bit of food, but not much variety. Better to go at night when it's a bit cooler.

Hawker Paradise ...title: Hawker Paradise ..
Hawker Paradise ...body: We went there for some shopping .. but it was very crowded and very difficult to move around .. it was actually a wrong day for us .. There are lovely products from all around the far east .. It is not just the chinese products .. You need to be sure of the quality and bargain as per the product .. not much of a place for a second time for me .. you also get to taste some good local cuisine ...

Perfect place to do Window Shopping with.title: Perfect place to do Window Shopping with huge bargains
Perfect place to do Window Shopping with.body: I can say wow ....lots of Shopping option for ladies , gents and kids . From leather bags / watches / cosmetics / clothing and much more . visiting other country its always in agenda to buys gift for family members . Right place for shopping  do not forget to bargain .

Great for Travellers..title: Great for Travellers.
Great for Travellers..body: If backpacking and in need of some well haggled vests and shorts this market is are perfect for you. Didn't attempt the street food but shopping is good.

Fabulous deals.title: Fabulous deals
Fabulous deals.body: You get lots and lots of stuff here .. to clothes, shoes, bags to everything. But you need to bargain to half the price at the road side stores. Lovely things available for a cheap price

Good to see but haggle prices.title: Good to see but haggle prices
Good to see but haggle prices.body: Good to see, undercover so as it was raining, ideal. Just make sure you haggle prices as goods are not genuine....

Crowded and Dirty.title: Crowded and Dirty
Crowded and Dirty.body: I was not surprised to find it overcrowded and dirty. Too many shops, restaurants looking very dirty, and thousands of people. We walked down Petaling street and saw everything you would ever wish to purchase. Most of the food places looked "scary" to USA standards. We will go back but not for food. We just want to experience the culture and the people.

Visit China in Kuala Lumpur.title: Visit China in Kuala Lumpur
Visit China in Kuala Lumpur.body: There is a small street in central part of Kuala Lumpur which has shops selling Chinese goods, Chinese food, a Chinese temple and hence the name.  Most of the sellers appear to be from Bangladesh.

Good to haggle.title: Good to haggle
Good to haggle.body: A very busy but interesting place for souvenirs and other tourist related goods. Lots of eating places and easy to find your way around. It's always good to haggle because you will be surprised at the price !

Don't even bother.title: Don't even bother
Don't even bother.body: Every country I visit i alwsys visit their China town. This one I did visit but didn't see t 30 minutes. The place is crammed and dirty. I went into one stall to buy some shoe comfort padding and the Chinese women and workers in the store was so rude and impolite along with all the other workers that I just dropped it and left. I tried to go in to one of the other stores but the passage way was so narrow with both sides stocked with items I felt claustrophobic and hot..I just turned around and got a taxi and left.I would not recommend

Fabulous shopping with lots of haggling..title: Fabulous shopping with lots of haggling.
Fabulous shopping with lots of haggling..body: Ignore the negative reviewers who had misunderstood the purpose of this market. Most stalls sell the same thing and you do much better if you are buying in bulk. Offer half of what they say and haggle. It is meant to be fun! Full of tourists and everyone realises that it is a place to buy knock offs and be very careful with your wallet. Great football shirts and handbags. Graf advice from earlier reviewer who said be prepared to walk away. The price drops suddenly. Nice little fresh fruit stall near central market entrance.

Great Laugh.title: Great Laugh
Great Laugh.body: This is a very busy night market but great fun. Lots of fakes and haggling is a must, all very good humoured. Great food available as well and definitely a great place for a visit and a bit of banter.

Best place to buy souvenirs.title: Best place to buy souvenirs
Best place to buy souvenirs.body: China town is the shoppers' paradise and you found everything to bargain your way to some cheap things. There are also restaurants and few hotels. Interested place

To buy soverniour&stuffs and exchangecur.title: To buy soverniour&stuffs and exchangecurrency
To buy soverniour&stuffs and exchangecur.body: In this market nothing serious to buy either than sovernier bells choclates from shop no 29 and very good price and near by also an Chetinand Aprahar Indian restaurant very good food to check fr veg&nonveg

Everything under the sun..title: Everything under the sun.
Everything under the sun..body: Lovely to browse through stalls. Can spend hours here looking for your bargain.  Great choice for food. Liked the atmosphere.

Not for shopping - but a different exper.title: Not for shopping - but a different experience!
Not for shopping - but a different exper.body: Firstly, this is NOT a place for shopping! Most of the stuff has a cheap look and feel to it and it gets pretty crowded in the evenings (especially over the weekend) but if you have never had a typical 'Chinatown' experience - then you got to try it once - and once is quite enough!!You can take the Monorail but its a bit of a walk, so a cab or UBER is better.BTW, we are frequent visitors to KL and since of late UBER is the way to go!! Much quicker and no haggling with some of the knuckleheads who drive regular taxis!

Worth to Visit if you are in KL.title: Worth to Visit if you are in KL
Worth to Visit if you are in KL.body: One of those places that you should visit to know what is really going on there.It is an area full of imitation goods of branded bags, watches, clothing...etcTo buy or not, is up to individual. But if you want to buy, do bargain or check a few stalls.There are many local foods available there are well. Give it a try!
