The roast duck, hokkien mee, yong tau fu, herbal dessert, bak gua, stir-fried pig intestines......etc I still go there once in a while, not for shopping, but for the feel & for the foods + local tibits that i can get there, selling by an old uncle.

crowded and full of fake stuff.title: crowded and full of fake stuff
crowded and full of fake stuff.body: Did not enjoy this at all. The place was crowded with people and stalls and everything they sold was fake.

Prices higher at one end..title: Prices higher at one end.
Prices higher at one end..body: Prices were much higher when we entered from Maharajaela monorail station side.  If you bargain they will reduce some amount.  When we reached the Jalan Sultan side the same goods were offered at much lower prices without bargaining.

Run the gauntlet.title: Run the gauntlet
Run the gauntlet.body: It is an experience. Yes there are bargains to be had, after you have endured the charms of the stall holders calling you young beautiful and lucky

cheap market.title: cheap market
cheap market.body: We've been there for 2 hours. you get cheap fake stuff here. negotiation is a must. you can get them down to 30% of initial cost. The food is delicious and lots of options available. super crowded place, keep your belongings safe.

Enjoy.title: Enjoy
Enjoy.body: Definitely need to visit, it is a true experience for all. We were entertained feed and freed of our money whilst walking here. Definitely should be on your itinerary

My goodness please visit.title: My goodness please visit
My goodness please visit.body: This is chaotic and fun. Lots of likey likey products  at  affordable prices unless you are in the social circles that would recognise a copy don't go

A lot off food.title: A lot off food
A lot off food.body: A lot of street food like most Chinatown's around the world.  The shopping is okay at best.  The shopping in Central market was a bit better.

Busy night market.title: Busy night market
Busy night market.body: Loved our walk through this market, lots of food stalls to sample, plenty of fake goods to barter for, stall holders do hassle a bit but where don't they! Makes an enjoyable evening to just wander around and enjoy the sights tastes and smells!

Cheap Market With Great Food.title: Cheap Market With Great Food
Cheap Market With Great Food.body: I've been here for 3 hours. Looking around and buy some souvenirs to bring it back to my own country. Try to negotiate with the seller before u purchase some goods. The food is more delicious and more cheaper than jalan alor in my opinion. It's really crowded here, make sure to keep your belonging safe for pickpocket.

Nice old walkabout.title: Nice old walkabout
Nice old walkabout.body: Had a walk through the market. If you want fake gear here is the place. It's a nice walk, the calling and bartering can get annoying but it's everywhere in the markets

You've Lost That Loving Feeling....title: You've Lost That Loving Feeling...
You've Lost That Loving Feeling....body: Kind of grew up here as a boy; when school holidays meant s holiday in KL when Dad was sent to KL for training. Chinatown, KL, has sadly lost a lot of its charm. Local Chinese traders have either sold their businesses or farmed them out to foreigners to man. It doesn't feel nor look like Chinatown anymore; when you have Indians, Nepalese and Myanmese running the gamut of this.Pros:1. Architecturally, it still resembles a Chinatown.2. The old gentleman who sells heavenly peanut pancakes is still there.3. World's Best Fried Hokkien Noodles is opposite Chinatown.4. There are still local hawker fare served up.by locals. The Curry Chicken Noodles (go for a vermicelli and yellow noodles mix), Curry Puff & Wanton Noodles are still good.5. Excellent photo opportunities. 4:30pm - 7:00pm time period gives you both day & night shots.Cons:1. Stalls are mostly operated by foreign labourers who are generally rude, obnoxious and aggressive.2. Goods are mostly from China and Thailand.3. Many local snacks and treats have disappeared. The Water Chestnut and Bean Curd stalls are still around & a must try (located in the center of the cross section).4. Most of the food served up here lacks the punch it had in the past because they are cooked up by foreign cooks (local cooks can be found along the fringe roads surrounding Chinatown).Summary:Chinatown has been reduced to a largely photo opportunity. Shopping is cheaper and of a greater variety elsewhere; like night markets for instance. Food quality has dropped drastically & generally overpriced. Jalan Alor offers better deals when it comes to food (but again, beware of the foreign cooks). I'd.make Chinatown a 3-hour (see time frame above) stop for photos. Accessible by Free Go KL (Purple Line) bus, taxi and metro (Pasar Seni station).

Chaos..title: Chaos.
Chaos..body: This market is huge, it has hundreds of stalls selling everything. You will be pestered but politely. Be aware that you may get lost inside or may cover the same ground/stalls twice.

Love this place.title: Love this place
Love this place.body: The vibe is always pumping here and there is always something different to see. If you’re looking for knockoffs this is the place to be! Alternatively there is nice fresh fruit and nuts to enjoy too. It is a nice place to walk around after sunset with a nice fresh mango ice cream.

Took friends for their furst time visit.title: Took friends for their furst time visit
Took friends for their furst time visit.body: My wife and I have been to Chinatown on many occasions over the past 24 or more years. This time we took some friends who thoroughly enjoyed the vibrant atmosphere and amazing deals that can be had at the myriad of stalls - better than the real thing!!The local food outlets are great value andthe food tastes really good, but I suppose for some the "presentation" may put them off. On the edge of Chnatown is Central Market- an indoor market with an array of local craft outlets and more eating places . Chinatown has become a legand in its own time - a must experience.

Back Alley of China town.title: Back Alley of China town
Back Alley of China town.body: I am no fan of the bright street China town. There are always hidden treasure in the alley and back lane. If you like being adventures try venturing into the alley. You be surprise what you will be discover. Food that long lost and a lot of human interaction. This is the true living of Kuala Lumpur.

Down memory lane.title: Down memory lane
Down memory lane.body: Visited here a long time ago and going back to check out the various shops selling their goods. Lots of tourists mingling with the locals and atmosphere was great.

Just a cheap market..title: Just a cheap market.
Just a cheap market..body: Though the street vendors offer cheap rates but you should have bargaining power. Not attractive for ahopping.

A shopping place for the tourists.title: A shopping place for the tourists
A shopping place for the tourists.body: The place is pretty crowded. Lots of street shops on both sides. Beware of pick pockets.. Look out for two wheelers .. even at foot paths..

Not really worth to go.title: Not really worth to go
Not really worth to go.body: They sell mostly junk, prices are much too high. Bought a watch once, worked one day, bought a belt, threw it away after a month. Can't compare it to China Town in some other cities in Asia.

Become Indian town.title: Become Indian town
Become Indian town.body: Have a walk after dinner in the area and found the place change a lot since last time (7 years ago) we had been here. There seems to have more Indian than Chinese in the area and could find many traditional Chinese stores. Kind of run down.

everything in there.title: everything in there
everything in there.body: This place is so good for whom want to buy cheap gifts and you can find bag, sunglasses, hat, cloths, ... and also several kinds of Chinese food that it worth to taste . so go there and have good times .

Not interesting - tourist trap.title: Not interesting - tourist trap
Not interesting - tourist trap.body: Chinatown and its market is just for tourists and it lacks the actual Chinese atmosphere. Where are the good dim sum places, tea houses, temples etc ? Not worth the visit

A flea market... Sort of....title: A flea market... Sort of...
A flea market... Sort of....body: Again a place to wander around and take life as it comes ! Not much more than that... A few things to eat and drink, just do as locals do and don't worry ! Good place to be when raining but expect not to be the only one to have thought of that !

Good market for low price knock off foot.title: Good market for low price knock off football tops and Trainers
Good market for low price knock off foot.body: Really good value in premier league football tops and American football and trainers.as little as 4 euro per top

Nostalgic Touch Missing.title: Nostalgic Touch Missing
Nostalgic Touch Missing.body: A Chinatown run mostly by aggressive and rude foreign labour? You've found it. Chinatown/Petaling Street/"Chee Chong Gai (Cantonese) has been losing her nostalgic feel and flavour over the past 20 years when local Chinese vendors started selling out or outsourcing daily operations to foreign labourers. These foreign labourers are generally rude, uncouth and aggressive.The quality of the food has plummeted because the cooks are now foreigners.For shopping, I only patronize stalls, shops or mini-marts run by the local Chinese. The same applies for dining.I'd give the "yong tau foo" & "cheong fun" stalls in the "middle alley" a miss even though the locals recommend them highly. They are overrated, bland, not fresh and overpriced.I still go for the peanut pancake.(RM1 a piece), "muah chee" - sticky dough rolled in crushed peanuts & sugar (RM5 a pack), "wanton meen" - barbequed pork and dumplings with egg noodles (RM8 for a big portion), Fried Hokkien Noodles (RM 10 for a small portion) - only the stall found opposite Chinatown that's cooked by a local Chinese cooked & Curry Chicken Noodles (RM6 per bowl).Shopping: Stuff is mostly from Thailand & China.Great photo opportunities in the late afternoon and evenings though.

Chinese product.title: Chinese product
Chinese product.body: Nice place in center of KL . lots of bargaining is required else you will get fooled here all china made products  ..

Great Food Hunt.title: Great Food Hunt
Great Food Hunt.body: You can find many traditional local food in Petaling Street. They really taste good! Especially the porridge, wantan noodle, sweet potato balls, soy bean, herbal tea!

A typical chinatown experience......title: A typical chinatown experience.....
A typical chinatown experience......body: Lots of stalls selling real copy watches, clothers, bags, leather goods, sunglasses, toys, food, etc etc. There are a couple of restaurants down one of the streets. Very near the KL central Market which has more of an established feel and proper toilets and cafes etc.  Good to wander through Chinatown but you do get fed up with being asked if you want a watch constantly...

Shop ti'll you drop.title: Shop ti'll you drop
Shop ti'll you drop.body: This is a great place to do all you shopping done. if you are shopping for your friends and fam and looking for little things to buy, this is the place. A lot of shops and stalls that offer great touristy products. You have to bring your A-game when it comes down to start bargaining with these people. My wife bought a nice scarf from one of the stalls here and they started at 45 ringgits, my wife got them down to 30 ringgits, of course after several attempts. There's also a nice spa called Aura's Spa which is really good, the girls here a nice and courteous and offer great pricing.

Be courteous Theyre only trying to sell.title: Be courteous Theyre only trying to sell to live
Be courteous Theyre only trying to sell.body: Merchants are same everywhere,they sell to survive-a no thanks is good enough to leave you alone,and,its polite. You get "young man (im 72yrs old?) trust me, best price,first customer best price" Now! Tactics Start bidding at half their price,walk away,but if you want you will sense their bottom price range-SO- drop another 10rungat and it costs you 5 extra and you have won-and so has merchant. If you find a good one and need repeat order-use them because you know his 'modus'.Don't be bullied scared and the old timers?? Stay away from them they're old and cheaters-Nothing is genuine-Bkk China made but premium grade clothes are Thailand and perfume -in glass bottles not plastic and from Doha-again not original but aroma lingers for 30 minutes not 5 minutes .Food excellent- and cheap-go where the locals go and survive Hameeds is good- hotels up end market dearer but Swiss Inn food good and reasonable priced.On street excellent variation and cheap and chinese is real chinese .Hotels are reasonably priced-cheaper than Klcc -and you always visit chinatown.every city on trip no taxi fares. Free bus PINK to from Klcc and obliging staff assist... Bukat Bintang is bit African wild- go by day early dont get drunk .. . Wear waist bag zipped closed -pickpockets-.and nighttime is safe in chinatown.Im a monthly visitor for 5 years  and 1st time pickpocket-oh oh i wore cargo pants -easy mark I'm told.Go after 12oclock then they set up and extra stores after 3 oclock and go nth -sth east west streets and look around behind main street- inside Kota Raya mall- Sentral market Whatever you want its there.

Everything under one 'ROOF'.title: Everything under one 'ROOF'
Everything under one 'ROOF'.body: Want a bargain and not sure where to head?  Or want to eat something local and not sure where to have it? Well come over to Chinatown or Petaling Street in the heart of KL. For shoppers try your luck at bargaining for your goods. Food is a plenty!!

Indeed this is a China Town , vow a temp.title: Indeed this is a China Town , vow a tempting market
Indeed this is a China Town , vow a temp.body: Umpteen vhoices of window shopping and bagging whatever you come across, needs good bargaining skill

Will come back for the food.title: Will come back for the food
Will come back for the food.body: Lots of things to see. The items they are selling are similar in every stalls. Prices are the same too. What I come here for is the food. Good selection from the available hawker stalls. Just be sure to be aware of your belongings as the street is very busy and crowded.

Interesting, busy, colourful..title: Interesting, busy, colourful.
Interesting, busy, colourful..body: We went at evening to sample food and shop and we were not disappointed. Good food at a good price and got some bargains to fill our suitcase too!

Over-rated!.title: Over-rated!
Over-rated!.body: The main street is full of street stalls with many vendors pushing to sell fake items from handbags to watches. Ok if that's what you want but not for me! Can't see why it's listed in the top 10 things to do in KL.

You can find anything here! Literally An.title: You can find anything here! Literally Anything!
You can find anything here! Literally An.body: The place has litterally a little bit of everything! During my visit, there are numerous traditional food stores that showcases Malaysia’s unique food culture from traditional rice noodle paste also known as chee cheong fun! Which is actually quite fun which is served at an affordable price! There are also many cool stuff which you can buy, but be warned, almost everything branded is fake but when you can’t find something that you wanted, for sayIf you want to buy air soft gun, you can find it there, anything you want, I can bet a good 80% chance of finding it. For example, when I went there, I was looking for a police baton and I found it. The place can be quite crowded, so it is advisable to visit in the morning, great place for breakfast tooEnjoy Cheers!

I was expecting way more.title: I was expecting way more
I was expecting way more.body: At first it sounded pretty exciting to visit that place. But honestly it was a not very long street with not much to offer just a few stalls selling some carft and fake brands. It couldn't fully deliver the sense of China town. Maybe my expectations were too high. But I will not recommend spending time here.

So...so....title: So...so...
So...so....body: There was nothing really special about Petaling unless you are looking for cheap product imitations of signature brands. It was a little bit dull and somewhat dirtier than the average thrift night market. There was not a whole lot of food options either.We would suggest going to the Taman Connaught night market instead (held on on Wednesdays from 6pm onwards). Your time and money are better spent there! 👍🏻

BUZZING.title: BUZZING
BUZZING.body: If you enjoy the hustle and bustle of a market place, you,ll enjoy this, some good crafts here and there, and plenty of good eating places, you can get plenty of bargains or just enjoy the day ,

Good tat.title: Good tat
Good tat.body: I love tourist tat. Cheap and nasty stalls that make wonderful presents. But that is all this is. No restaurants. Not even street food. And the same key rings and model planes over and again.Don’t go out of your way unless you have a million people back home expecting a fridge magnet.

Crowded place.title: Crowded place
Crowded place.body: It's a nice place in Kuala Lumpur, a lot of things in there.. you can buy any food in china town, and convenient things if you want

Fun flea market next to Chinatown.title: Fun flea market next to Chinatown
Fun flea market next to Chinatown.body: No high end knock offs, but better low end quality. Selection is basically the same so best to do a couple of laps before buying. Definitely cheap prices and worth a look, especially at night time.

An amazing shopping, culinary experience.title: An amazing shopping, culinary experience
An amazing shopping, culinary experience.body: This place is like an ocean where you get everything in several shops...be careful while picking up stuff as the same can be purchased at another shop at a lower price....the food you get from street vendors or stalls are yummy...there might be lot of new things to try..be careful while choosing the dish as the local authentic flavour can be overwhelming...overall this is a place to visit for it's own kind of experience..you might want to go back for it's own charms.

Typical Chinatown with food and non genu.title: Typical Chinatown with food and non genuine goods
Typical Chinatown with food and non genu.body: It is a typical Chinatown where you can find in many countries.Pretty interesting for tourist to come and experience the crowd, food and fake goods. Please do your bargain here when you are buying things but make sure you buy when you get the price you want.Otherwise you will get it from the rowdy sellers and many are foreigners too. You can try the street food but the proper restaurants nearby which mostly is occupied by tourist may charge you the tourist price, if you know what I meant.Happy holidays!

Chinatown full of Bangladesh Vendors.title: Chinatown full of Bangladesh Vendors
Chinatown full of Bangladesh Vendors.body: Chinatown was once packed with local vendors selling variety of food now are mostly made up of foreigner vendors. Some traditional food such as stew duck feet are no longer selling. Even famous Fried Hokkien New is now fried by foreigner. Thank God, taste still acceptable

Down memory lane in Petaling Street.title: Down memory lane in Petaling Street
Down memory lane in Petaling Street.body: Growing up within walking distance of Petaling Street developed in me a leaning towards crowds, bright lights, and stall owners shouting their wares. However, the Petaling Street I remember is one of food and more glorious food! Today though, stalls peddling bags, T-Shirts, souvenirs and trinkets rule the street. As a child, I was always bright-eyed and always pleasantly welcomed by sights, smells and sounds of this oh so "adventurous" place! Yes, going to Petaling Street was always viewed as a mini adventure. Having seen the night markets in several other countries however, I am now of the sad opinion that Petaling Street can't measure up to those in Hongkong, Siem Reap, Hatyai, or Singapore. Much needs to be done for Petaling Street to reclaim its former glory!

Nice Chinatown.title: Nice Chinatown
Nice Chinatown.body: Good for a walk around and look for bargains. Better to come here early evening.Some good Food as well avialable.Can get busy

Petaling street Flea market.title: Petaling street Flea market
Petaling street Flea market.body: great place to buy "genuine" stuff be prepared to haggle that's half the fun of buying knockoffs  be prepared to walk away the price will improve

Fun Fun Fun.title: Fun Fun Fun
Fun Fun Fun.body: We love coming to these markets when we visit Kuala Lumpur.  The people here are friendly and helpful.  Prices are good, and you can barter. There are always taxis waiting when you are finished.

Nice, but busy!.title: Nice, but busy!
Nice, but busy!.body: The stalls are great, but most have the same products and they charge about the same.  Also very irritating that you have to give way for cars driving through the crowds in the middle of the market, while you are enjoying a relaxed stroll.

Lovely day out!.title: Lovely day out!
Lovely day out!.body: I loved all the stalls, but everyone sells basically the same thing, for the same price.  Combine Petaling Street with Central Market, which is much more interesting and ALOT less chaotic.  In the alley by Central Market there is a little stall called Juicee. Try any smoothie or fruit shake, but the Red Dragonfruit smoothie is delicious!

A busy place to people watch and shop -.title: A busy place to people watch and shop - lots to look at smell and taste!
A busy place to people watch and shop -.body: This is a very bustling part of KL. I think the main draw is the shopping, but everything is a nock off in the market as far as commercial goods are concerned.  Its a great place to explore the wet markets for fresh produce, and there is some great eating to be had if you dig a little.

OVER-RATED for goodies but AWESOME for f.title: OVER-RATED for goodies but AWESOME for foodies!
OVER-RATED for goodies but AWESOME for f.body: The first thing I headed to buy on Jalan Petaling a.k.a the China Town of KL, was a hat to beat the sun......honestly, I had bought a similar hat in Manhattan at half the price. My Indian friends, let me tell you (and I am qualified as I have spent six decades here), the bargains at Lajpat Nagar and Sarojini Nagar are much more attractive, both from the price and quality point of view. The plus points are that the place is expectedly very congested with plenty of food options of all choices ranging from pure vegetarian to the steaks. I got a chance to speak with some visitors. The general psychology was that not buying anything from here would be infra dig. Get rid of that feeling and try out the wide variety of edibles on the street itself and surroundings.I had my first taste of the  notoriously famous fruit Durien here, and loved the taste!  Unlike a general impression, quite different from the jackfruit. Has some great freshly extracted suger cane juice too.  And of course many other things including tea from a giant kettle.An important piece of advice: Once you are done with the China Town, DO NOT MISS the Pasar Seni as well as the over 125-year-old Central Market. You could be in for some very pleasant surprises including delicious "Paratha with Alu Dam" at the legendary Old Town White Coffee outlet.

Fascinating Kuala Lumpur Authentic Exper.title: Fascinating Kuala Lumpur Authentic Experience
Fascinating Kuala Lumpur Authentic Exper.body: Lots to see and eat here! Plan to be here for a while. You'll have the experience of a lifetime bartering and buying, but beware of street thievery and snatching. I hear it happens often. The food here is super cheap and worth trying as much as your stomach can carry. Each bite is delicious.

Just a market with fake stuffs.title: Just a market with fake stuffs
Just a market with fake stuffs.body: I live next to the China Town in HCM Vietnam so this place is not new to me. You can see all brands from shoe to cosmestic here but they are all fake from China. It looks dirty so we didnt want to try any food there

A congested place for shopping.title: A congested place for shopping
A congested place for shopping.body: If you are ok with shopping in the sweltering heat at a very congested place, then this is the place for you. Be ready to really come with your "A" game in bargaining otherwise you will have to spend a lot of money. The food stalls dont look very hygienic, so eat at your own risk.

Shopping and Dining !!.title: Shopping and Dining !!
Shopping and Dining !!.body: If you are looking for a bargain, this is the place.  You have to know how to bargain or negotiate. Price quoted is always 1/3 more than what you are willing to pay.  Get better at bargaining.  Don't pay the price quoted.  If you are happy then by all means get it if not go somewhere else.  Happy Hunting!! Remember if he won't sell you at your price, you bargain too low.  Lesson learned!!

1 st Visit KL.title: 1 st Visit KL
1 st Visit KL.body: Visited Chinatown over the weekend of FI GP .Found the place to be busy and most stalls selling the same cheap quality goods.. You will have to bargain with stall owners.Can also get extremely hot walking around looking for stuff .If you  have time and want the Chinatown experience ,then go but be prepared.I found most of the malls and shops located in city center ,example Time Square mall with the same stuff at reasonable prices ,opened to offers and malls being few floors with a variety of shops , air conditioning and a much better experience especially if you have young children.

Authentic Chinese World & The Central Ma.title: Authentic Chinese World & The Central Market
Authentic Chinese World & The Central Ma.body: It is a typical Chinese environment with the many shopping opportunities, crowded but a sincere welcome by the sellers. There is the Central Market close to China Town and you may enjoy the handycraft products there. The main difference is that you must bargain in China Town but you can not in the Central Market as it is touristic.

A crowded market, worth to see it.title: A crowded market, worth to see it
A crowded market, worth to see it.body: Few souvenirs, fake reproductions of famous brands and street food. It reminded me somehow Kaosanroad in Bangkok. I think it is worth seeing it if you are in KL

Take photo and move on....title: Take photo and move on...
Take photo and move on....body: I dragged my partner to Chinatown with every intention of spending the whole day there...mmmh. What a disappointment. I suggest you take a photo of the sign saying Petaling Street, then walk 30 steps into Chinatown, take another photo of the hanging lanterns and then tick it off the list as "Done"! Vendor after vendor selling the same rip off stuff...watches, handbags, shoes, clothes and sunglasses. If the price is too good to be true....you know why. Nothing authentic about this market except the prep areas for the food places...and trust me, after seeing this part, you will not be having lunch here. Rather move swiftly to the Central Market for authentic and beautiful Asian and South East Asian crafts and fabrics.

Good shopping experience.title: Good shopping experience
Good shopping experience.body: My wife and I hit Petaling Street and had a great time shopping. Many bargains were found. Awesome street food also.

Drink and eat and nightlife Chinatown.title: Drink and eat and nightlife Chinatown
Drink and eat and nightlife Chinatown.body: Chinatown is home to a number of cocktail bars, open air restaurants and street market for vendors selling a wide variety of items from handbags, sunglasses, caps watches, etc Haggling is the name of the game. You can spend  whole.afternoon and evening here and still not experience it all. A great photographic opportunity. Well worth the effort.

Petaling street always crowded every day.title: Petaling street always crowded every day
Petaling street always crowded every day.body: Every day always crowded in petaling street china town. You can find everything there from food, clothes, bags, any stuff for cheap prices, also you can find cheap hotel here. Nice visiting...

Chinatown - Petaling Street.title: Chinatown - Petaling Street
Chinatown - Petaling Street.body: Spend half a day in the area. We used the tube to get to Maharjalela station which is 5 mins walk from Petaling Street. Alternatively taxis are a convenient way to get there. If you don't like the crowd then go for a morning visit when it is relatively quiet. Prepare to haggle as it's the only way to get a good deal. Also close by is the Abdul Jamek Mosque which is worth a visit. The Mosque is over 100 years old and they allow people to go in outside prayer times. Right next to the Mosque is the Abdul Samad building which is an important national monument. There's plenty of places to eat close by, McDonald's, Starbucks or if you're feeling brave, give the street food a go.

Emily goudie.title: Emily goudie
Emily goudie.body: Please be careful of rogues and bargain. Lots to offer food cheap & delicious. Great cultural experience. Go for it temples & lots to see & do.

Good for food and shopping.title: Good for food and shopping
Good for food and shopping.body: Went there for food and also visited Petaling street, which is famous or rather infamous for cheap imitations of the big brands (or genuine fakes as they call it). Colourful and interesting place.

Shady.title: Shady
Shady.body: My local Malaysian brought me there for a day tour and she said the district is quite shady and that security is not very good in the area.

Good fakes, cheap prices.title: Good fakes, cheap prices
Good fakes, cheap prices.body: We visited Chinatown in the search of food, but were unsuccessful. The street is just full of little stalls with fake products. Coming from China, this is not very exciting for me. If you're after good priced and quite genuine looking fakes, then this is the place for you.

Enjoy the shopping.title: Enjoy the shopping
Enjoy the shopping.body: It was good to visit this place and did shopping. Most of goods are reasonable prices with good quality. it would be better if you have good bargaining skill so you can get 30%-50% discount from original prices

Good price for you my friend.title: Good price for you my friend
Good price for you my friend.body: Chinatown is a nice a fun area, where you can enjoy the hustle and bustle, buy food and drinks and then you can SHOP, SHOP and SHOP copies of numerous designerbrands at very low prices.

Shops for tourist.title: Shops for tourist
Shops for tourist.body: Mainly shops full of Chinese clones of important brands and junk items for tourists. In my opinion don't worth a visit

Bargain hunting at its best.title: Bargain hunting at its best
Bargain hunting at its best.body: We went during the day, which I would recommend as at night the place become a bit more "exotic" and perhaps a bit more prone to pickpockets as well. We shopped for a few nice bags and things, but best is to ask for the "Korean" imports, not the local ones, as there is a quality difference. We were asked to come to a separate stall with high quality goods, and as we were with 5 persons, we took the chance to look at higher quality merchandise away from the main street. It was worth the visit. Take the challenge and be very set in the price you want to pay for an item, and you will be surprised what difference there is between asking price and sale price.

Once called the \"China Town\" is now a.title: Once called the "China Town"  is now a "Bangladesh Town" - Visit if you have nothing to do.
Once called the \"China Town\" is now a.body: Only Few Chinese stores, all fake goods, plenty of Souvenirs shops. Nothing that great. Just be aware  of your Wallets and Personal belongings. However i suggest you can skip this place and visit amcorp mall for flea market on Sundays or just cross the street and enter into the Central Market which is well organized and beautiful.I was disappointed with this China Town street.

Finally got here and picked up some barg.title: Finally got here and picked up some bargains.
Finally got here and picked up some barg.body: I read different reviews but I think if you are in to cheap copy stuff with an understanding of bartering and have your wits about you. It's fun !! I probably think Bali or Vietnam or even Bangkok (has not necessarily better quality) but more options on offer. But it is what it is and we enjoyed our time and would definitely come back at night time to experience a different flavour and food options. Definitely a must do though , would recommend

Not sure it's worth it..title: Not sure it's worth it.
Not sure it's worth it..body: Have spent a couple of afternoons wondering around the makers.  Same old rule if you see something you like buy it then and there as I couldn't find this fs the following day.  Watches are cheap and nasty.  Bought 3 (paid way too much) and within a day one stopped working and the others coating tarnished.  Some quite nice bags but go into the shops and ask for there better quality ones.  You may pay 50 plus more Ringet but it's definitely worth it. Can't say I'd come back.

Petaling street Chinatown.title: Petaling street Chinatown
Petaling street Chinatown.body: A visit after a few years back to petaling street still the hustle and bustle in the evening markets is very busy , never pay the asking price always haggle for a good deal .definatly worth a visit there .

TOO PUSHY SELLERS.title: TOO PUSHY SELLERS
TOO PUSHY SELLERS.body: This is an experience. There are lots of places to eat. You can't really get lost as there are only really 2 street in the form of a cross. The sellers were really pushy.

Souvenirs good price.title: Souvenirs good price
Souvenirs good price.body: We visit this place as our destinantion to buy some chocolates which we knows this place you can make deal with the sellers to can get good price. So , i bought some chocolates , snacks bars , key holders and fridge magnetic as souvenirs. good deal though :)

Shopping place for bargain hunters.title: Shopping place for bargain hunters
Shopping place for bargain hunters.body: This is a place which is meant for bargain hunters looking to buy items at a cheap price. You have have to fight hard to bargain for the prices as the shop keepers tend to quote a high price.  ost shops tend to sell the same item. There are quite a few street vendors selling food as well.

Bargain shopping market.title: Bargain shopping market
Bargain shopping market.body: Very good for tourists. Plenty of souveniours to buy and lots of unusual local delicacies. Surrounded by different nationalities.

Too hyped.title: Too hyped
Too hyped.body: Went here after hearing from a friend. 15 minutes into the street and you would’ve seen everything because all the stores have the same things. A lot of bag and shoe stores that sell replicas. A couple of them have pretty good stuff but one had to bargain well to get the best out of the place. A couple of souvenir stores are available apart from clothes, toys and electronic stores. Nice to walk in the evening with all the lights around. But heard that a lot of theft happens, so keeping your belonging safe is important.

lots of bargains.title: lots of bargains
lots of bargains.body: We had fun shopping here, with lots of bargains. We bought brand trainers and bags, do browse around and haggle. There are food streets but we were not brave enough to eat there, saw dishes being washed in a big bucket! A good time to spend half your day in KL.

great shopping.title: great shopping
great shopping.body: Large selection of above average quality merchandise.  Plenty of food vendors and shops.  Fun afternoon

Not for the faint-hearted...or claustrop.title: Not for the faint-hearted...or claustrophobic!
Not for the faint-hearted...or claustrop.body: While Chinatown itself is a hive of activity and delicious smells, there's also the absolute bedlam of Petaling street...we didn't shop so cannot comment on whether the prices are worth the trouble but it is so tightly packed in and so short of air that you had better be sure you want to buy something!!! Not for the browsers!

Sights Sound and Smells...title: Sights Sound and Smells..
Sights Sound and Smells...body: Very colourful, noisy and a clash of smells. If you are going there to shop, you need to be a very good negotiator to bring the price to what you want to pay. Obviously do not expect stuffs to be genuine...mostly genuine copy. Your visit would be more colourful if you wonder deeper into the small lanes where you can find some delicious fare.

china town.title: china town
china town.body: we went here last week and is great for all your bargains and for good food at very reasonable prices, Is a must to haggle can get for a silly price if you just say a price and walk away they then say ok

Get ya fakes.title: Get ya fakes
Get ya fakes.body: Got to come to the fake capital of the world, so much fun and so easy to haggle, every conversation goes this is the price I could do this price but my final price is....well you can knock off at least 15-30% off that ha. Definitely go even if you're not interested in fakes as it's good to take in the hussle and bussle although we went with a pram and it was fine so don't be put off

Didn't Impress.title: Didn't Impress
Didn't Impress.body: I was hoping for something like the lively Tung Choi street of Hong Kong where you are bombarded left and right by tons of choices. I was ready to haggle but was a bit disappointed to be greeted by just a few stalls and not a lot of choices at all. My son did find a cool fidget spinner and that was about it. Ended up walking to Central Market and enjoyed that place more.

Probably more accurately copy town.title: Probably more accurately copy town
Probably more accurately copy town.body: This is a very compact network of streets the central part “ petaling” street is a bustling busy market . We arrived late afternoon and the central walkway was being set up for the night markets . This would make and already congested area even more cramped . Never felt threatened although everyone trying to flog some copy of everything from bags, sunglasses and quite worrying perfume, it’s all about haggling so if you don’t like this I would suggest don’t go. Basically top tip offer a quarter of what they ask for and if they don’t move close walk away . We had everything from staff saying it’s my first day , sit down , basically every trick in the book .

Yet another flea market....title: Yet another flea market...
Yet another flea market....body: I went there as a solo traveler and I think that’s the most positive piece of advise I can give: avoid going with children or in couple.Dirty place lot of cheap imitations in a smelly and environment.Avoid it if you can...

Worth the time to visit.title: Worth the time to visit
Worth the time to visit.body: If you are a tourist in Kuala Lumpur you must visit Chinatown for bargains, entertainment and the general oriental atmosphere.

Very touristy, I dont see why you should.title: Very touristy, I dont see why you should be here at all
Very touristy, I dont see why you should.body: Very commercial and tacky, touristy shops selling batiks and sounvenirs. Please dont waste anytime here. I was literally done in 5 mins. Accessible via the new subway line, exit at Pasar Seni station.

Meh!.title: Meh!
Meh!.body: The main shopping street is just a bunch of stalls selling junk. Not worth a visit for that. The other parts of Chinatown are far more interesting.

Nothing to see or shop.title: Nothing to see or shop
Nothing to see or shop.body: If you are Indian, you will feel like you are in some local foot path market. whole market is filled with cheap fake copies of shoes watches and sunglasses. you won't find anything exceptional item which is not available at same price in india. bought some souvenirs and later found same material, may be a bit better than that is available at same rate somewhere else.would suggest to avoid the place. may be some other areas in locality are worth visit but the market area is just to avoid.

Fake......title: Fake.....
Fake......body: This place called as china town where they sell all sort of clothing's, watches, shoes but all the items is fake. This place are dirty and people are keep shouting. The prices are super expensive when see the foreigner.My taxi driver warned before enter this place to bargain the prices .

Bustling area of KL.title: Bustling area of KL
Bustling area of KL.body: Spent half a day here, very busy and lots of cheap shopping. We walked from Merdaka Square, stopping to see various sites along the way.

Just for the atmosphere - most of it is.title: Just for the atmosphere - most of it is junk!
Just for the atmosphere - most of it is.body: Its nice to have a stroll down china town just for the atmosphere.Stay away from the watches!! ALL break!! Boys clothing, tshirts, soccer sets, shorts - they fine to buy.Shoes - not worth it, rather buy the real deal.Handbags - fine to buy. Rest of the stuff - junk and not worth it.The shop workers - rather very rude - some have a stinking attitude!

All the same.title: All the same
All the same.body: Nothing to exciting down here, once you have walked past 10 stalls you will see the same items again and again. Fake handbags, watches and sunglasses . Bit of a let down.

Not really impressed.title: Not really impressed
Not really impressed.body: Too many stall selling the same things.  We went there on the hop on hop off bus we didn't stay very long too many people....

Running the gauntlet.title: Running the gauntlet
Running the gauntlet.body: Everyone wants to become your instant friend. Lots of similar inexpensive/knockoff goods with the usual Malaysia t-shirts and commemorative paraphernalia. Petaling Street is the main artery for other shopping streets in the area and benefits from being completely covered by an awning, good for sun and rain.

Bad.title: Bad
Bad.body: Had a little look while passing on the way back to Batu caves. Full of designer knock offs and cheap looking tat

China town very hot!!!!.title: China town very hot!!!!
China town very hot!!!!.body: We went on the Hop- On- Hop- Off bus and it was fab, every thing you can imagine on sale, lots of bartering and you can buy anything form a pair of pants to an Elephant Lol food great and very clean there and cheap What!! very very cheap, had a great time would go back anytime.

Street markets and cheap food options.title: Street markets and cheap food options
Street markets and cheap food options.body: Great place to visit if you want to do some street markets and shop for souvenirs or fake designer brands. Bartering accepted! There are a few good cheap food options where you can sit down on the street and watch the hustle and bustle go by

Average market, some worthwhile sights.title: Average market, some worthwhile sights
Average market, some worthwhile sights.body: A typical market, by now lacking any 'oriental' flair - prices are high and almost no bargaining. However, and especially for those who have not visited Asia before, there are some side streets that offer good photo opportunities and some temples that deserve a visit.

Local taste!!!.title: Local taste!!!
Local taste!!!.body: A must visit to anyone travelling to KL to get a taste of local atmosphere. small shops, bargaining, food on the street, lanterns all adds to the experience. Don't hesitate to bargain for anything you like to buy. mostly you can get at half the initial prize. Also try the food at food outlet in the street. great authentic food for a cheap prize. May be better not to take children since most of the way is filled with cigarette smoke.

Good street market.title: Good street market
Good street market.body: Another great street market, although this one is covered, good variety of items at fair prices, friendly vendors, food and drinks available, worth a wander, buy a T shirt and a Rolex, spoil yourself. Ha Ha

Haggling and shopping in China Town.title: Haggling and shopping in China Town
Haggling and shopping in China Town.body: No pretending. Cheap, nasty and mostly fakes. You know what you are buying and no shame in starting at 50% of whatever the seller was proposing.Walk away if you don't like the price.Bought scarves and trinkets

No big deal.....title: No big deal....
No big deal.....body: It's a few streets of stall of clothes, fake goods, etcIf you have not been to one in other countries such as Indonesia or Thailand, then it is worth goingIt's still worth a wander if you want somewhere to goYou can still get a bargain or two in the place.

Dont Go.title: Dont Go
Dont Go.body: This is the place of gangsterism in Malaysia. Dont try to bargain with the seller. If you dont buy the stuff. The will force you

Love this busy place for fossicking.title: Love this busy place for fossicking
Love this busy place for fossicking.body: Been here before, the food is excellent and cheap! I noticed this time, more insistent hagglers....a sign of the economic times?

Just a few streets.title: Just a few streets
Just a few streets.body: This is probably smallest Chinatown I have ever visited, just a few streets. A lot of fakes around for little money. You can enjooy there food on the corner...

Exciting Times!!.title: Exciting Times!!
Exciting Times!!.body: What a wonderful experience! Very hot and crowded, but that's all part of the vibe! You can find everything here from fashionable clothing and accessories to tasty samosas and coconut pancakes!

Aggressive Salesman Stay Away.title: Aggressive Salesman Stay Away
Aggressive Salesman Stay Away.body: Too many people here selling can't take a 'no' from you if you try to haggle for a price of your own. I had several people cursing me and using abusive language simply because I did not want to pay the price they requested. End of the day if your in a haggling zone then you gotta have the mentality you'll win some and lose others. But over here they want to win at all costs and if they don't they become really aggressive and cause an unsettling scene. If your with family or your loved one's I'd stay away from this place as it will be far from a peaceful shopping experience.

No longer cheap prices.title: No longer cheap prices
No longer cheap prices.body: Although the food and beer are great in this area are fantastic, the shopping prices are not cheap. If you are looking for jade, do your homework before you arrive. They will try to show you that it is not plastic by putting a lighter to it. BE KNOWLEDGABLE!! and warned.

Typical Market.title: Typical Market
Typical Market.body: Yes everything is cheap but i wouldn't recommend leaving your kids to walk alone. Some of the male shop owners can make you feel very uncomfortable.

Good area.title: Good area
Good area.body: Everything you need here, food drinks clothes different areas have a different scene. We love visiting here, join in with the locals

Loved it.title: Loved it
Loved it.body: Nice markets the people working here are not so pushy to make you want to buy if you buy ok if not no problem.Very safe walking around and the food stalls I found had good food and low price.

petaling Street markets ...great for fir.title: petaling Street markets ...great for first timers
petaling Street markets ...great for fir.body: i have been here a number of times and decided to go again , it is disappointing  that the stall holders are still selling the exact same goods that they were 5 years ago nothing seems to have evolved at all. That being said if you are a tourist please go and see it

Not that impressed.title: Not that impressed
Not that impressed.body: Just a small market and you may not buy many stuff from here. Probably a time waste. Not the quality products they sell.

Your one stop shop for cheap knock offs.title: Your one stop shop for cheap knock offs
Your one stop shop for cheap knock offs.body: It's not as good as a market in say, Bangkok, as all of the stalls in Petaling Street are owned by one person. So a lot of the stalls do have all of the same stuff.However, if you're after a better quality knock off and speak to the right people, they can take you to a shop in one of the buildings by the stalls where they have much better quality stuff, but at a higher price, of course.It's still a good experience regardless of whether you actually want to buy anything. If you do, enjoy haggling to get your perfect price!

Mrs.title: Mrs
Mrs.body: Went to China town Very busy there Lots of goods for sale and very cheap It was a nice experience at night

So busy.title: So busy
So busy.body: Be prepared for this place, it's very busy and people will be shouting to get your attention to sell you knock off bags and random KL items. Did find a nice restaurant which is part of a hotel. Only good thing about this area.

Not Really A China Town.title: Not Really A China Town
Not Really A China Town.body: Most of the stalls/shops are now run/owned by non Chinese people, so it did not give real feel of genuine China Town like one in Singapore.

Haggling Rush.title: Haggling Rush
Haggling Rush.body: Most of the shopkeepers are either Malay Chinese origin or Bangladesh nationals. They are very sweet and kind but can drive you crazy. So take enough cash to buy cheap and fake stuff and NEGOTIATE THEM DOWN.

Very busy.title: Very busy
Very busy.body: Having been to China Town in other countries was slightly disappointed with this. Was looking forward to seeing the street cooking and spices etc in sale, instead it was like a market full of copy goods, plenty of bags, watches and shoes to choose from.

Cheap cheap cheap.title: Cheap cheap cheap
Cheap cheap cheap.body: All cheap in a good way. Save $$$ esp if you're uni students like us haha. Visited China town to look around but ended up spending on magnets and touristy things. BARGAIN BARGAIN BARGAIN or you will get ripped off

Counterfeit, Imitation heaven, haggle, b.title: Counterfeit, Imitation heaven, haggle, bargain and negotiate - Go prepared.
Counterfeit, Imitation heaven, haggle, b.body: I cannot say how people will rank this as excellent/very good etc. Its a combination of narrow streets which get narrower as you walk in. Street stalls selling counterfeit and imitation watches (some with good quality), bags, clothing, jewelry etc. In the beginning there are a few large organized shops at the back of the stalls where you can shop specially for jewelry and they are nice. Then there are good and bad sellers - some are down rude and some deal pleasantly. Go around and find bargains for good quality imitation watches. Whatever number they quote you come back with half of it and at times they just agree on that. I know for a fact that this place is far cheaper than Bukit Bintang or other places in KL. Also I did get a few watches on my last trip which asfter 5 years are still in good shape and perfectly working well. You just need to examine the items closely, look at various stalls and then make up your mind what to get. Being crowded with narrower streets, go prepared as it its somewhat stinky and some or the youngsters just roaming there are actually eyeing your bag/belongings. So be careful !Its totally unorganized and I cannot seem to see the logic of taking a guided tour or something like this. Dont wast your money on that. Just go prepared and you will come back with a lots of good quality imitation goods.

Wouldn't recommend sorry.title: Wouldn't recommend sorry
Wouldn't recommend sorry.body: Fake goods and many issues with people trying to pinch stuff out of  your pocketsWould not tell anyone to go here

Hmmmm......no.title: Hmmmm......no
Hmmmm......no.body: Easily accessible from the GOKL bus route but it's full of fake goods and people trying to steal your walletYou need your wits about you

Branded.title: Branded
Branded.body: In This Place U Can Buy a lot of branded Bag, Wallet, Accesory, with low budget also u Can ask the seller the best price for you.

Had awesome shopping experience.title: Had awesome shopping experience
Had awesome shopping experience.body: I really enjoyed Chinatown. The foods alone were great, many cool things to try. The shopping was cheap and varied in quality, and bargaining is fun! Just be really careful, watch your belongings as pickpocketing is common here.

very crowded place.title: very crowded place
very crowded place.body: this place is full of Indian and cheap shops .not so clean and be careful about your cellphones and bags .nothing attractive for me.like poor areas in my country

two streets that cross each other so hot.title: two streets that cross each other so hot and full of Indian shops.i saw no chinese there and u can buy cheap things as
two streets that cross each other so hot.body: so hot and full of Indian shops.i saw no Chinese there and u can buy cheap things as souvenirs.if u are not looking for cheap gifts better not waste ur time there.i didn't like that place at all

Petaling street.title: Petaling street
Petaling street.body: This is part of the KLHoponHop off tour. The place is very busy and lives up to its name. There are lots of stalls to visit and try food at. It can get a little hectic at times as traffic is quite bad as this is also close to the central markets

Must do.title: Must do
Must do.body: Strolling through these streets witch Chinese cheap stuff is a must in KL.Opens around 5pm and is closi g around 10 pm.Have a drink in between 😀

KL's Chinatown..title: KL's Chinatown.
KL's Chinatown..body: While this place is known for its market and imitation goods and souvenirs, there is good food (the notable ones is the tau foo fah stall, wantan noodles stall, and porridge and chee cheong fun stalls) to be found as well. There are also hotels to be found here. There are various shops selling all sorts of stuff.

Dinner.title: Dinner
Dinner.body: Good Chinese food in the food court.. And reasonably priced..worth going for food lovers.. Lot of variety ..

Souvenirs!.title: Souvenirs!
Souvenirs!.body: Another good place in Kuala Lumpur to buy souvenirs and do some cheap street shopping. Haggling is a must!

Much of a muchness.title: Much of a muchness
Much of a muchness.body: If you have ever visited a "china town" anywhere in the world, this wont be a new experience. This seems to be similar, if not identical, to most other markets here in KL which we have visited. You can haggle or barter for your purchases however the same applies for "Central Market" which offers a less crowded and more relaxed shopping experience. Also next to Central Markets is a Art market with an awesome selection of varying arts as well as a quality Antique shop which has a section devoted to antiques of the local area ( not for sale ) however very well presented and interesting. If you had to choose between the two then my choice would be Central Markets.

Great food.title: Great food
Great food.body: As in all chinatows around the world, this one also have great places with street food and restaurants. Also have two nice temples, one chinese inside Chinatown and another one Indian in the entry

Average market place.title: Average market place
Average market place.body: If you have visited Chinatown in Singapore, then this one is a big disappointment. Average roadside shops, nothing much interesting available, prices are quite on the higher side. The items selling in the temporary shops seemed rather unattractive and ordinary. No interesting eateries either. Not worth the time.

Chinatown...or Migrants-town.title: Chinatown...or Migrants-town
Chinatown...or Migrants-town.body: Sadly, the hard truth about Chinatown in KL today is that it has evolved into a stretch of street stalls manned by migrants...from Bangladesh, Nepal and Myanmar mainly. The local chinese seem to have outsource their business. What used to be a rich cultural experience has now become purely business oriented; even so, there is a need to be very cautious about price versus quality...at times, these "foreign migrants" are rude...these goods, already fake, are still "swapped" during packing to a lower grade...prices inflated! Be mindful of surroundings as snatch thieves and pick pockets are loitering...seeking opportunities; would be wise to haveca good handle of purse, wallets, bracelets and gold chains. Having said this, there are still a couple of genuine faithful chinese proudly operating here since the chinatown of old; business handed down from generations. These, one must try. The "mata kucing" drink stall at the corner, near the main entrance, is still the best. Opposite, there is a soya bean drink seller; also try their smooth "tau foo fah"...soy bean custard. Within the vicinity is a humble stall near Olaiya BBQ roast pork, known as "Char Wong"...roughly translated as Tea King...serving the best local coffee and tea...be it hot or cold. Yes, the BBQ roast pork slices is also to crave for. Further down the street towards the opposite end...one can find a chinese lady manning small little push cart stall selling the most delicious roast duck..."sei ngan chai" it is commonly known. Be sure to try the roast duck feet wrapped with duck liver and meat...held together with duck intestine. As awful as this may sound, it simply taste awesome. Must pack some home...goes well with a couple of cold beer! This is just a short take on what used to be Chinatown in KL. Still worth a stroll...

China town main street.title: China town main street
China town main street.body: This is a happy mess with street shops, street food, hundreds os people passing by. A place to visit, for sure, and buy cheap stuff.

Not much to see but...!.title: Not much to see but...!
Not much to see but...!.body: I expected something more... so my friends and I were a bit disappointed. It was small area with Chinese wholesale shops like toys, hair accessories, etc. and China town is with the petaling street where you can buy various imitation bags and watches etc. And in Chinatown, there are 2-3 Chinese art supplies shops. You can Chinese painting material and also like oil painting colors or water color etc.

Reasonable and Negotiable.title: Reasonable and Negotiable
Reasonable and Negotiable.body: Prices negotiable and varieties of things to buy. HP, acessories, tshirts, watches, shoes, etc.. Near shopping complex and choices of food stalls available. Easy transportation using buses, commuter, LRT. Fast food such as KFC, McD, around the corner. All items intended to purchase can negotiate to a reasonable agreed price. Buyer and seller agreed and happy.

Goos for shopping gifts.title: Goos for shopping gifts
Goos for shopping gifts.body: Before flying home it is a great place to shop for gifts to bring back home. There is a great food court next to it with lots of variety.

Good deals. Good food..title: Good deals. Good food.
Good deals. Good food..body: I have been to more than 10 china towns all over the planet. This KL china town was not bad at all. It has better deals than the one in NYC. The food was good. I would not go again. It's a one time good experience. Now a days malls and online stores offer better deals than old street markets. Have a great day and best regards. Dr SD.

A fantastic mess.title: A fantastic mess
A fantastic mess.body: It is what it says... China Town... a bunch of street stores where you can buy all kind of forged stuff and eat and drink a lot of diferent kind of foods.A must visit when in KL!

Petaling street, kuala lumpur.title: Petaling street, kuala lumpur
Petaling street, kuala lumpur.body: Petaling street, located at chinatown kuala lumpur, this famous night market also many visitors during morning/day time.This market selling, souveniers, bags, cloths, watches, toys, also food stalls.Closed kasturi walk, pasar seni, central market.

A must place to vist.title: A must place to vist
A must place to vist.body: Interesting place with lots going on. Seemed to be some changing of shops mid afternoon. Interesting to watch how quickly one perosn packed up and another stall opened. Probably get anything in this market. Also long as you accept it is fake.

Lots of cheap finds.title: Lots of cheap finds
Lots of cheap finds.body: Most items are made in China.  Prepare to haggle.  You can easily get lost here and end up buying lots of things you don't really need.

If you like visiting china town's all ov.title: If you like visiting china town's all over the world, then this place is for you!
If you like visiting china town's all ov.body: This is a tourist trap! There are shops around Petaling street that sells everything cheaper. Even if you haggle, you will find it all cheaper somewhere else.Best to try the street food, drinks and take photos!For buying local merchandise, walk towards the Central Market. Inside has AC, and around it have a lot of shops.

Authentic Chinatown.title: Authentic Chinatown
Authentic Chinatown.body: A very authentic Chinatown experience which can be taken one of two ways. Either you get bogged down by the fact it's not as clean as KLCC for example and it's busy and crowded with people trying to sell you things or you embrace the place for what it is. It's a vibrant area which clearly has a lot of history. There are loads of different eating options down here. Stalls selling clothes, electronics etc I had a fresh coconut and a bbq pork roll from one of the many food outlets that was very tasty. Although, take a wrong turn down a back alley you can see exactly how everything is prepared (not for the squeamish.) Overall a must do experience in a city like KL which is a mix of so many different cultures. It's near to some other famous sights as well so definitely worth doing

Full of scam artists.title: Full of scam artists
Full of scam artists.body: Didn't like the haggling for everything. All the items are fake, but there starting price is close to real one. But after that you have to negotiate it down. Doesn't recommend buying anything from there.

Best food and cheap shopping!.title: Best food and cheap shopping!
Best food and cheap shopping!.body: One of the best Chinatown places I have visited. The atmosphere was vibrant. The shops are affordable. The food was more than what I expected. Lots of places to eat. Close to the train station and only a couple of blacks from Sentral Market.

Cheap overpriced items.title: Cheap overpriced items
Cheap overpriced items.body: Its a street with cheap and duplicate items which are overpriced just to make fool of the tourists visiting it. I dont think any locals buy any items from there.

Chinese goods.title: Chinese goods
Chinese goods.body: A place with a lot of chinese shops and restaurants. decorated with lanterns on all sides. Close to KL sentral

Night visit.title: Night visit
Night visit.body: Amazing experience, smells and sights- busy busy with everyone trying to sell you their freshly cooked food and selling you their goods -  not too sure about some of the food on offer but a great experience to watch

Must visit place in KL..title: Must visit place in KL.
Must visit place in KL..body: A must visit place in KL if you love shopping. Market is flooded with cheap Chinese products and copy items.

Very nice and colourful.title: Very nice and colourful
Very nice and colourful.body: Visited it during the night very bright and vibrant filled with colours.You've got all your Asian food there, what ever tickles your fancy you will find it there.

Cheap and low quality knock offs.title: Cheap and low quality knock offs
Cheap and low quality knock offs.body: Cheap and low quality knock offs.. ambiance not so nice as Hong Kong ladies market. All electronics low quality, restaurants and other services around too shaby

Interesting piece of Malaysian culture.title: Interesting piece of Malaysian culture
Interesting piece of Malaysian culture.body: This is a busy market, full of life, fresh fruit, interesting flavours and fake goods, it is a bit of fun. The purple line free bus leaves you outside, which is convenient. Worth taking a peek

Many shops with cheap goods.title: Many shops with cheap goods
Many shops with cheap goods.body: If you want to buy souvenirs from KL or  only have a good chinease food, I recommend here to go. Many of small shops.

Good for food & fake goods!!.title: Good for food & fake goods!!
Good for food & fake goods!!.body: We went to China town a couple of times because there are loads of places for good food. We had 2 very enjoyable, and cheap, evening meals in Chinatown. As others have said it the place is very busy and lots of fake goods which to be honest are not very good. However, if you are in KL I would recommend a visit as it is a good experience.

No longer a Chinatown.title: No longer a Chinatown
No longer a Chinatown.body: Once the hustle and bustle a must go place in kl it has since lost its shine as traders are replaced by foreign workers. There are still great food there and thats about the only reason why one would want to visit this ppace. Easily accessible by public metro system.

Knock off central.title: Knock off central
Knock off central.body: Another must visit in KL just for the knock off goods alone make sure you bargain hard as everything is inflated by about 100% loads off nice foods place around the area as well so make sure you get to tried them out

Fake goods abundant.title: Fake goods abundant
Fake goods abundant.body: Not my type of place to shop especially if it's during weekends or public holidays. Very crowded and selling mostly fake goods from anythg you can wear or use. You name it and it can be found there

Bargaining and recognition of goods high.title: Bargaining and recognition of goods highly sought for.
Bargaining and recognition of goods high.body: Great place to be, KL Chinatown. From Gucci bags to Paris Hilton perfume and lot more varieties of other goods. All you need to convince yourself before asking the shopkeeper "are these original?" is not to ask because you know it already. However bargain as much as you can. I liked the varieties they offer both the goods and the people from different nations.

Long established must-visit spot..title: Long established must-visit spot.
Long established must-visit spot..body: In the past it was a place to find all manner of stuff including military grade binoculars from Russia. Nowadays it is fashion, fashion and fashion with a few other things thrown in. It is one of those places you have to visit if visiting KL - like Chatuchak in Bangkok (but smaller). Beware of pickpockets and haggle hard!

Great fun.title: Great fun
Great fun.body: Do yourself a favour...... goThere were 5 in our group and we had a great time at the markets here. Bartering is a must and the quality of the goods is really not bad at all. Don't get there before 10:30 am as it's all still opening and setting up prior to that time. There is a great range of products on sale and both men and women are catered for. Found some great work shirts, good quality and fantastic price:)

Good place for wholesale Purchase.title: Good place for wholesale Purchase
Good place for wholesale Purchase.body: There is several stored surrounding it which is a wholesaler selling hair clips etc. Pertaling street is one of the most popular street for bargain hunter. Parents with baby not recommended with stroller cos it will blocked the passageway. Wear comfortable shoes cos there is a lot of walking. Along the Chinatown streets you may get to purchase a ready made bouquet of flowers for the ladies too.

Must place for shopping- specially bags.title: Must place for shopping- specially bags and Do bargain 👍🏻and go on Weekdays
Must place for shopping- specially bags.body: So i am from india.. i found everything was of same price when i visit Malaysia for business purpose or somthing other... but this place have the best luggage and ladies bags at very nominal price.. yes u need to bargain for sure..If they are saying u somthing for 100ringget tell him to give it for 60and some how they will agree to give it for 70/- and if u r buying like 3-4items from one person try to go for 50ringget and trust me they will give it.. it just u need to find the right person!Try to visit on odd hours or weekdays where they have time to give u the best  things

Not quality.title: Not quality
Not quality.body: This is not somewhere I would re visit. It's not as friendly as the what we came to see on a daily basis in other areas. Sogo is a much better option as is central markets. No matter it's an experience. Make sure you only use metred cabs and never let them tell you a fixed rate. Taxis are so cheap you will be super pleased and there fixed rate will be more than double the metre.

Haggle city.title: Haggle city
Haggle city.body: A fun place where you can buy lots of things. Lots of copies I found electronics, watches and bags that you would be better saving no buying the real thing. Cloth and sunglasses r good quality and in general a fun experience even though some of the sellers are a bit OTT.

you can buy souvenir.title: you can buy souvenir
you can buy souvenir.body: it's like traditional market but not really traditional. If you need some cheap things, souvenir maybe you can go to her and for price.. you can negotiate with the owner

cheap imitation stuff.title: cheap imitation stuff
cheap imitation stuff.body: it got lots of cheap stuff but just keep bargaining hard.its ok place as KL city does not have much to do.

dirty old part of town.title: dirty old part of town
dirty old part of town.body: it was suppose to be cheap shopping destination but ruined by cheap bad quality Chinese products. its close to bukit bintang but the quality of products is really bad. Thailand has 100 times better markets than this. its waist of time all stuff is duplicate with bad quality and worst sales man .its lokks like a red light area .

Place to get cheap goods.title: Place to get cheap goods
Place to get cheap goods.body: Got my cheap Ray Bans here for 20 RM after a bit of a haggle. The sunglasses did lose a screw not even a week in, but it was replaceable. Let's see how long they will last!A friend of mine got a cheap DW watch in Bangkok in Nov 2016 and it's sill working, so on this trip to Malaysia he bagged a few more whilst roaming around Chinatown here.The rest of the market looks great, but we weren't in a shopping all day mood, so came what we came for and left.

An experience - ALSO HAGGLE!.title: An experience - ALSO HAGGLE!
An experience - ALSO HAGGLE!.body: Plenty of replicas and cheap trinkets. Always haggle & batar. Usually less than half the price.We got around KL in Ubers (safe & set price) you won't get ripped off..Some items we bought (approx indication of price at the market)Sunglasses - 15RMCheap Small watches - 40RMMedium watches - 80-100RM'High quality under the table' watches 175RMLV female wallet medium size (good quality, as theres two 'types') - 70RM

Bargain hunter paradise.title: Bargain hunter paradise
Bargain hunter paradise.body: Full of "genuine copies" Petaling Street is a must just for the experience even if you don't want to buy. We had two teenage girls so they made the most of it. Copies range in quality so look around first before buying. Make sure you go prepared to bargain. They expect it! Great fun!!

Go only if you have time on your hands.title: Go only if you have time on your hands
Go only if you have time on your hands.body: The chinatown market used to be a great place to shop at but with rampant number of china and india tourists, the store owners there have become hard faced and rude, thinking that all tourists are out to fleece them. If you go into a store to see what it sells, chances are you will get an obnoxious person trying to get in front of you to rearrange their stuff all while clicking their tongue angrily and giving you an awful stare. It is still a good place to get fakes that look real but i would only recommend it if you have nothing else to do. Otherwise there are other malls in city centre like Sungei Wang and the night markets opposite it that serve the same purpose and nicer people

Is that still ChinaTown?.title: Is that still ChinaTown?
Is that still ChinaTown?.body: Has not been there for ages, and decided to spend sometime to explore and check it out if there's any improvement or changes... But as expected, besides of nicer place, new signed board, and fittings, there's no soul. Crowded with people, which was ok, but come on, Seriously? You really wanted to visit a ChinaTown which operate by other races? When I was in ChinaTown, It make no sense at all that I ate at Chinese Food stall which served and cooked by Bangladeshi! I intended to buy a jade at the Chinese stores but I bargained with an Indonesian!  Where were all those Chinese? City Council should have change the name to International Town, that will be more appropriate.

Good if your want imitation label goods.title: Good if your want imitation label goods but otherwise not fantastic
Good if your want imitation label goods.body: This was somewhat of a disappointment, there is nothing particularly Chinese about it and it crammed full of stalls so it's hard to move. If you don't like the hard sell traders and haggling then this is not the place for you. You won't find decent souvenirs here and the central market is so much better for that. Having said that you can get all the decent imitation label stuff you want and if that's your bag then come here.

Get your haggle on!.title: Get your haggle on!
Get your haggle on!.body: While other reviewers are correct regarding the price of good being a little higher than other places in the city, you'd do well to remember this is a tourist destination and things are priced accordingly.That being said be smart, as most stalls sell exactly the same stuff, buy as much as you need from just one and haggle them down.I went during the day and found a food court with 6-7 small stands around it and ate like a queen for $2

A place for fake designer goods.title: A place for fake designer goods
A place for fake designer goods.body: There are a few Indian/Chinese restaurants and cafes around the place, so it's ok if you wanna pop by and eat something nearby. The whole market is full of hostels hotels and guest houses, but I wouldn't really recommend you to stay there, as it's way to crowded and easy to get lost, plus there's not much to check around. Fake watches, bags, belts, fragrance and so on. In a word, it's a place for you if you wanna buy some fake designer goods.

Liked it.title: Liked it
Liked it.body: Not a fan. It is crammed And narrow. I keep bumping into people. I would recommend central market much better

Good shopping experience..title: Good shopping experience.
Good shopping experience..body: Good shopping experience from another continent.  Haggling skills are useful and expected. Can be very hot at particular

Sad.title: Sad
Sad.body: Not much authenticity left of what used to be Chinatown, place just seems full of non Chinese people selling the same stuff, stall after stall. Also seemed to be a limited amount of genuine food vendors or restaurants in this location. Some old buildings still exist but clearly run down. Real shame.

Not worth it...title: Not worth it..
Not worth it...body: After seeing the Chinatown in Singapore, this place was really a mess. The sellers were extremely rude when you showed a dissatisfaction with a price. We have seen a giant cockroach in one of the souvenir shops! If you have limited time, don't waste it here - go to Central Market instead, where you'll feel the culture..

A must to go explore.title: A must to go explore
A must to go explore.body: Best to come at night when there is a certain vibe to the street. Sellers galore with souvenirs and knock offs a plenty! Bags, sunglasses, watches, clothes etc. It's all here. You can barter with the market stall sellers which is good fun. There are hawker stalls selling amazing food.It is just wondered to explore and walk around and then when done to relax at a table overlooking the street to watch all the people go by.

Good to see!.title: Good to see!
Good to see!.body: Went here on our brief stay in KL,  had a great time haggling and bantering with the street merchants.  Also had dinner in one of the restaurants that was full of locals, one of the best meals we had the whole trip.  I wouldn't bother booking a tour guide for this we all felt very safe.

Eat and shopping.title: Eat and shopping
Eat and shopping.body: Just a place for eating & shopping, look like Mongkok Woman Street in Hong Kong. We went there at night.

Ace to explore.title: Ace to explore
Ace to explore.body: So colourful to walk around - especially at night when it comes alive. Petaling street is the night market full of hawker stalls, souvenirs and knock off goods! Loads of fresh food and drink including coconuts to buy! Near by there are a few temples to explore. Loved it here just exploring or people watching.

You've got to experience it.title: You've got to experience it
You've got to experience it.body: Best to come here at night but things to see during the day as well.Do not get your souvenirs anywhere else! They are really cheap here and you can get the store owner down to a cheaper price by haggling. Loads of knock offs but it looked ok quality (from afar!). Loads of watches bags perfumes sunglasses etc etc.It was enjoyable just to walk up and down the streets.Loads of hawker stalls which I love. We sat over looking the street with some duck and people watched - was great to see how many different cultures walked by. If in KL you have to come here!

Too busy.title: Too busy
Too busy.body: We went past China town i guess it worth seeing if you are there but really nothing special there and all the shopping items are of poor quality.

Very disappointing.title: Very disappointing
Very disappointing.body: I always seek out Chinatown in cities where I visit as they usually offer a step back in time experience; including an interesting array of shops where unique treasures can be found and restaurants or eating houses that inevitably surprise and delight with tantalising smells and unique tastes... but unfortunately Chinatown in Kuala Lumpa is just row of dilapidated buildings stuffed with 'Made in China' or 'Made in Taiwan' mass produced rubbish items. The area is generally filthy and street vendors have been replaced with aggressive hawkers and pickpockets. My advise - don't bother...

Cheep and not necessary stuff.title: Cheep and not necessary stuff
Cheep and not necessary stuff.body: Chinatown as chinatown😁From jewerly to bags, watches omg how many watches 😁stuff and stufff and craap...everything you need or don't need for price you can bargaining all night long😏

Not a friendly neighborhood but must go.title: Not a friendly neighborhood but must go
Not a friendly neighborhood but must go.body: Sellers inside the chinatown are not quite friendly. Most sellers will try to charge you large prices at the first sight. Sometimes they stress you to buy things even if you just inquire about them. So be aware.

Good Shopping.title: Good Shopping
