Good Shopping.body: We visited the Chinatown market one night on our KL stay and found it lively!It has a great rang of knock off brands and also other touristy stuff plus eateries and drink places.Its much like markets in Thailand but has a greater range of shops selling watches which we did buy!Its fun and well worth a visit!

Lots to buy.title: Lots to buy
Lots to buy.body: As a typical Chinatown, lots of goods to buy and bargains and batering to be done.  We enjoyed looking at these markets, we only bought a couple of things, and then went to the central markets which were much more orderly and air conditioned!

Center of Fake.title: Center of Fake
Center of Fake.body: They sell all kind of stuff here but be aware that the majority of products are fake knock-offs; quality might be good but still fake.And: Bargain as much as you can as the are set very high!

Chinatown fun..title: Chinatown fun.
Chinatown fun..body: With so many streets to wander through one is sure of picking up a bargain. Traders will haggle with you, always remember to smile whilst trying to obtain a discount. Don't buy the first item you see, there are many traders selling the same wares.  A great way to spend a few hours without stress. Use the hop on, hop of bus to visit Chinatown. There are no time restrictions as you can catch the bus when your feet get sore. Authentic Chinese meals are also available. They may not be fancy restaurants but the food is scrumptious with patrons constantly frequenting these establishments. English may not be spoken in some establishments, photos are available to assist when choosing your meal. Lunch time is always very busy here. A great way of seeing this part of town whilst having an enjoyable adventure. Recommend it highly if in KL and have a love for markets.

Not worth it.title: Not worth it
Not worth it.body: Not really a Chinatown as most stall/shop owners are not. Very pushy and everything the same. Not an enjoyable experience and unlike Chinatown experiences elsewhere.

Not worth.title: Not worth
Not worth.body: This place not Chinatown is Little India.There are a lot shop are sell by India or Middle East people. Not enough place to eat and so many shop make road very crowed.Im not suggest to go.Be careful ur bag BTW

The food!!!!!! So good!.title: The food!!!!!! So good!
The food!!!!!! So good!.body: A must on your list, so many options to have a great meal. It's super busy but just fun to be around and eating with the locals.

a very dirty place.title: a very dirty place
a very dirty place.body: We have seen a lot of old China Towns around the world. We have not seen a dirty place like this.. Also, for two ladies alone in the evening, there is no feeling of security. The only positive thing about it is that you can bargain the prices for almost everything (including a bottle of mineral water)! What a pity.

Many rip-offs, but some good places to e.title: Many rip-offs, but some good places to eat, drink, buy from!
Many rip-offs, but some good places to e.body: Tourist rip-offs abound, but if you know what you SHOULD pay, there are some great places here. Do your homework before you visit!

Shop and eat.title: Shop and eat
Shop and eat.body: This place is famous for shopping and also as a good place to find a wide choice of cheap, local fares. There are many Chinese hawker food stalls in the area, and numerous bak kut teh outlets as well. We went there to shop, then off to find food to eat , enjoying the bustling atmosphere here.

Good for nice n cheap stuff.title: Good for nice n cheap stuff
Good for nice n cheap stuff.body: Can buy a lot of stuff at cheap price. U have to negotiate for a good deal as u are tourist. They usually offer high price for tourist. Please try to cut the price by 50%. Good food n stuff to buy. Highly recommended to go.

Petaling street is nice but the side all.title: Petaling street is nice but the side alleys are much more interesting!
Petaling street is nice but the side all.body: The main street of Chinatown, Petaling Street, is a fun place to visit.  We decided to wander down the narrow side alleyways and discovered hidden markets with real local character.

Worth seeing but perhaps use a tour.title: Worth seeing but perhaps use a tour
Worth seeing but perhaps use a tour.body: There's a real hustle and bustle here - lots of little stalls selling cheap designer labels or food. I'd recommend taking the Be Tourist Malaysia Heritage walking tours to sample Chinatown and more.

CHINA TOWN WITH LESS CHINESE.title: CHINA TOWN WITH LESS CHINESE
CHINA TOWN WITH LESS CHINESE.body: The China Town consists of more other immigrants like Indians,Bangladeshis etc more than the Chinese. The bargain limit is quite huge. If he tells you the price as 225 ringits you can ask for 10 or 15 rinits. Such is the range. It became very tiresome and headache. I started visiting some of the shops owned by the Chinese and I fond them to be more reasonable. Buy from the shops in the China Town but not from wayside vendors.

Huge market!.title: Huge market!
Huge market!.body: My husband and I visited Malaysia in August 2017 for vacation. We researched the top places to go to in Kuala Lumpur and made our way to the Chinatown district. It is huge and has literally hundreds and hundreds of stalls selling all types of goods that you can possibly imagine. There are a lot of places to eat as well but some of them are a little sketchy.  It is definitely a place to come to to do some shopping and pick up some souvenirs. Definitely bargain with the shopkeepers because they will drop their prices by 30 to 50%.

Shopping with family.title: Shopping with family
Shopping with family.body: We enjoyed the shopping in Chinatown and we payed cheap thing it's not original but it's work and the Chinese very friendly

Great fun in the market..title: Great fun in the market.
Great fun in the market..body: If you like haggling and crazy markets then this is a great place for you. If you don't, then maybe not so. Don't buy electronics, shoes or bags expecting it will last you a long time. It will probably break within weeks to months. But small things like wallets, belts, football shirts, souvenirs are great to buy here. Always half the price of what they say. If you are a foreign tourist, they rip you off- so make sure you haggle! Walk away if you think you are getting a bad deal. But all in all, it's a fun market and you can get yourself some great deals!

Colorful.title: Colorful
Colorful.body: Beautiful place to spend your time eating and shopping.Saw also lots of cheap rooms advertisements.

Must view.title: Must view
Must view.body: If you like Chinese food,or simply you wish to shop whatever item,be sure you will find it!Make sure you negotiate as first price is always too high.

Street Food.title: Street Food
Street Food.body: This is the place to go to if you want to enjoy the Malaysian street food.The area is buzzing with activity,

lots and lots of stuff.title: lots and lots of stuff
lots and lots of stuff.body: Long street with heaps of vendors that sell you almost everything. The sellers are bit annyoing as they really wanna sell you something and don´t forget to bargain.

Good Toys Collection.title: Good Toys Collection
Good Toys Collection.body: Good Range of toys,however be cautious about the prices .Need to bargain quite a bit.The Stores run by chinese appeared very resonable .

Hustle and bustle of Chinatown.title: Hustle and bustle of Chinatown
Hustle and bustle of Chinatown.body: You can't miss out on Chinatown while in KL. There's so many little always to get lost down. We wandered past stalls selling tourist goods at tourist prices, then turned right down a tiny dingy alley and found where the locals get their fresh meat, fish and vegetables. They have crates of live chickens and buckets of innards from fresh slaughter. Next door they were selling fresh greens and vegetables.  This is the Malaysia with seeing. Don't forget to try Auntie's mua chee! Malaysia's version of mochi, it is chewy, coated in peanuts and extremely addictive. For only 5RM for a box you're crazy not to try!

TRIP TO CHINA.title: TRIP TO CHINA
TRIP TO CHINA.body: This is a hustling place, full of out of the way type shops that can offer u just about anything ur looking for.

All way shopping.title: All way shopping
All way shopping.body: There are multiple paths and when entered you wont exit without any items bought in hand. Put your best bargaining skills & mostly start with 20% of the said price. You will settle with 50% of the quoted price.

Best of Bargaining Market.title: Best of Bargaining Market
Best of Bargaining Market.body: Visit this place if you have a best bargaining talent. The place is a shopping heaven. Get what you want at your price if you have the mouth for it. It will eat your time a lot. Be prepared with refreshments.

the classic China Town.title: the classic China Town
the classic China Town.body: I passed here to have a look. it's the classic China Town that you could find in every big city in South East Asia. So nothing special. A lot of stands selling cheap souvenirs or bags etc together with Chinese or Indian restaurants. here and there crummy massage centers and people strolling around. That's it.

Take time to visit here if you like shop.title: Take time to visit here if you like shopping
Take time to visit here if you like shop.body: huge market place, great for cheep products and food, very  crowded on the day I visited easy to spend hours  window shopping or spending

alike most other chinatown.title: alike most other chinatown
alike most other chinatown.body: in my mind, it is alike most Chinatown in every city. There would be more Chinese restaurants and Chinese decoration. If you are interested in Chinese culture, it is fine to go there. if not, there are more interesting things to see in Kuala Lumpur.

Here to taste the \"Air Mata Kuching\".title: Here to taste the "Air Mata Kuching"
Here to taste the \"Air Mata Kuching\".body: China Town is located near the Central Market, i was more preferable to go to central market when buying some unique souvenir of Malaysia (more comfortable and more chocolate shop there, even though price in China Town somehow cheaper)i was here just to taste the Famous Air Mata Kuching (Cat Tears in english).it is not exactly made from cat's tears, it is traditional beverage of Malaysia, and it is taste good, i like it.here, also you can find a few streets food, and chinese delicious restaurant

Lightful Lanterns Along Petaling Street.title: Lightful Lanterns Along Petaling Street
Lightful Lanterns Along Petaling Street.body: Beside of some landmarks of Kuala Lumpur, there was Petaling Street or maybe somebody called it Chinatown. Nice to go here, beside of there's so many lightful lanterns along the Petaling Street, usually when I went to KL, this place was be my favorite place to buy some souvenirs to bring home. The price also cheap and so variable items to buy.

Maybe you can skip.title: Maybe you can skip
Maybe you can skip.body: You do not need to go to chinatown in KL since a substantial number of the people are actually chinese so you can find chinese restaurants very easily. Still you can go for some cheap handicrafts.

too crowded and nothing special.title: too crowded and nothing special
too crowded and nothing special.body: there is a huge variety of food stalls, but if you have seen china town in other countries than this one has nothing special to offer...the place is too crowded and it's suffocating...the food stalls have occupied most of the road, hardly leaving space for pedestrians to walk

Interesting historical neighbourhood.title: Interesting historical neighbourhood
Interesting historical neighbourhood.body: Interesting part of the city to explore on foot. Tips: Walking distance to Merdeka (Independence) Square and Central Market but hot so take an umbrella to avoid the sun. Temples are small and tucked away so can be hard to find. Food looked interesting but not suitable for vegetarians. Easily accessed by the free GOKL buses.

Nice, though less organised than in othe.title: Nice, though less organised than in other major cities.
Nice, though less organised than in othe.body: If you go there, prepare yourself to bargain everything! All the sellers have more or less the same merchandise. Is not bad, you can buy some KL souvenirs at a much better price than in the airport.

Touristy- Not attractive anymore.title: Touristy- Not attractive anymore
Touristy- Not attractive anymore.body: The night markets were attractive as of previous but not anymore.The food (black noodles) with its lard & strong Wok-Hae are no more comparable to the good old days.  Wan Tan Mee (lard) use to be tasty too, but alas.Previous of this attraction, are packed with locals & tourist but even the drink stalls their prices has risen at least 3 times the last 2 years.One item that we will really miss is the  uncle who sells Ap Keok Pau (goose web+intestines wrap)... superb in taste & freshness, alas we will miss.Even the variety & stall holders are finding it difficult to be creative by binging in attractive goods to be presented for sale here.  So unless its spruce up  & improve, with a trade mix - jalan bukit bintang / jalan alor is now the place in every else lips.

Fascinating!.title: Fascinating!
Fascinating!.body: My wife and I made a short stop at the Petaling Street market.  To me, it was fascinating.  The hawkers are mildly aggressive, which is not my style, but looking is still okay (just don't pay them attention if you are not too interested).  If you decide to buy something, then be prepared to haggle over the price.  The street is full of people, and even the occasional car or motorcyle passes through.  Lots of purses, wallets, scarves, cell phone cases, etc.

Sunday shopping.title: Sunday shopping
Sunday shopping.body: Here you can find really cheap copys. If youre looking for sneakers they have lots of different brands who look exactly the original.

Get cheap Chinese knock offs!.title: Get cheap Chinese knock offs!
Get cheap Chinese knock offs!.body: Chinese and Indians selling Chinese knock offs. Lots of bags and clothes shops. I would recommend buying here but try to haggle hard. I haggled a bit too hard and didn't buy some stuff cos I thought they were a bit too expensive but regretted it afterwards, so I think this is probably a good place to buy knock offs as I did not find a better place with same quality knock offs.

Down right dirty.title: Down right dirty
Down right dirty.body: Without for the following:PICK POCKETSFAKE PRODUCTSDODGY FOOD OUTLETSAll together a waste of time, all the stalls sell the same fake stuff and are really overpriced.The food stalls and most restaurants and are filthy.

Everything you could possibly want.title: Everything you could possibly want
Everything you could possibly want.body: Any dream you have had for any fashion accessory you will find here. Knock offs of every single brand with a heated atmosphere filled with debate and haggling on price. This little spot can soak up hours of any shoppers time, trying to find the best replica, and the finest option. Loved it. Downside is the general smell and the attitude of the merchants.

Great market.title: Great market
Great market.body: A lot of clothes sunglasses watches bags You need to bargain a lot! Ask the price then leave and they Will Low the price more than half!

very busy but good value & experience.title: very busy but good value & experience
very busy but good value & experience.body: good place to buy all sorts of stuff at the right prices, but dont forget to haggle adds to the fun, u can also eat there as well

Busy and hot.title: Busy and hot
Busy and hot.body: If you are after imitation designer goods then this is definitely the place for you.  All starts to look the same after a while - handbags, watches, shoes, clothes, sunglasses.

Cheap good quality products.title: Cheap good quality products
Cheap good quality products.body: I had a great time and made good deals and bargains with the dealers.Had some drinks and food at the nearby stalls and there are taxis waiting at the corners

cramped street.title: cramped street
cramped street.body: the lane is cramped with small shops making it difficult to walk around the street and the shops....

Such a cool area.title: Such a cool area
Such a cool area.body: We loved Chinatown. It's the perfect place to eat, as there are lots of nice authentic restaurants with tasty food and quick service. It's also a really funky area with beautiful traditional buildings and gives you a great idea of KL's heritage and cultural diversity. We did the walking tour around Chinatown within the red city map.

Shopping, Flea market.title: Shopping, Flea market
Shopping, Flea market.body: You can find some really nice dresses, cute slippers that I use often when I head towards beach. It was fun.But some other shops can be a disappointment too. Duplicate of luxury brands.Cloth bags were nice. I ate chestnut for the first time here.

Truly Asian Market and food Street..title: Truly Asian Market and food Street.
Truly Asian Market and food Street..body: An original Asian Market and Food street in the old style. Perfect for enjoing an afternoon, or evening out shopping small goods of any kind, having original Asian food in a vibrant atmospohere.

Excited but not so worth for me.title: Excited but not so worth for me
Excited but not so worth for me.body: We have been here thinking of finding some exciting place where we will see lot of things which will amaze us but there was nothing like such here which can be seen in that way. Just normal shops selling chinese products which you will find in your city as well bit expensive here though you need to bargain here to get your shopping in memory of KL. People are good here and will behave normally but do bargain for sure.

Fun walkthrough.title: Fun walkthrough
Fun walkthrough.body: Many shops and food stalls. Fun to walk through. Parts are covered against sun and rain. Just be surprised by the many shops

It's Genuine Fun.title: It's Genuine Fun
It's Genuine Fun.body: As you walk through Chinatown you hear the stall owners shouting "genuine fake" so that gives you the idea of what's on offer. All brands in their counterfeit options are piled high. It can get very busy in the evening so the best time is around 10.30am when stalls are being put up and the stall owners are anxious to make their first sale. It's a friendly enough place but do not expect rock bottom prices.

Mini \"Bazaar\" within KL.title: Mini "Bazaar" within KL
Mini \"Bazaar\" within KL.body: A small shopping arcade within centre of KL. One will never regret visiting this "chinatown" as it houses & displays variety of items like watches; clothing; leather bags;  shoes & many more items to attract all walks of life &  ages. An excellent place to bargain for your moneys worth. In the midst one can also find eatery stalls & beer joints. For drinkers, nothing like a cold chilled beer & hot sumptuous  chinese dished after a tiring stroll in the chinatown. As always said "seeing is believing".

Poor quality items.title: Poor quality items
Poor quality items.body: I wouldn't buy anything from here, over the years I've bought several watches all seem to stop working or let in water when having a shower. If you must buy a replica watch do it on your first day so you will have time to return it before you go home. Get a receipt with the stall number, get it dated, try all the buttons on the watch 90% of the stopwatch don't work, much better choice and price in Bukit Bintang. Watch out for pickpockets.

Welcome to KL Chinese Street Mall.title: Welcome to KL Chinese Street Mall
Welcome to KL Chinese Street Mall.body: Apart from a 1 stop centre for foreigners to drink or hangout at bars located adjacent to the mall@Chinatown & its a common gathering place & overnights for the backpackers community.

Fake items.title: Fake items
Fake items.body: If you would like to buy counterfeit labels at cheap prices, be sure to go here and to buy any price they give, you start a bargain with a third.

oh.. another china town.title: oh.. another china town
oh.. another china town.body: this is just another china town but with a large roof for all weather shopping.. the shopping is great... like any china town... the food kiosks is great, like any china town.. visit if u have time..

Not chinatown.title: Not chinatown
Not chinatown.body: This place is not chinatown but more to bangla town or dhaka town..all traders and their workers is 80% imigrant from bangladesh,10% from myanmar and 10% from vietnam or philipines..and they are rude.Its hard to find any malay or even chinese..avoid this place unless you are fanatic of fake branded item.

awful.title: awful
awful.body: Where to start? Its a big market that is very tight so you could defiantly be prone to pick pocketers. The people at the market get right in your face so you have to just be blunt and say no thanks. I don't care what anyone says but you cannot eat from the street stalls there, the hygiene by the stalls is appalling. Your asking for food poisoning if you eat from them. The place smells of sewage. The train station near by isn't much better either, its very shady. I wouldn't fancy walking to it alone at night if I was a women, their was people crashed out on the stair ways and it was very dark.

Overrated destination.title: Overrated destination
Overrated destination.body: Nothing much to see unless you are after fake goods.  Touts everywhere.  Also ladies watch your handbags

Convenient ride to KLIA 2.title: Convenient ride to KLIA 2
Convenient ride to KLIA 2.body: I was taking a ride from Putrajaya to klia2. The schedule is on target and it costs me 10% cheaper to purchase the ticket via kiosk using credit card. Convenience and comfortable.

China in KL.title: China in KL
China in KL.body: A lot of Chinese shops a lot of colours and people very typical very cheap to be visited when in KL, easy accessible from KLCC using the LRT

Important place to visit.title: Important place to visit
Important place to visit.body: China town is also the place for great food and a great market. Just near the market there are street food cars that serve amazing food. Just have a seat and order some pork belly and rice. China town is a great and fun visit.

Not that good.title: Not that good
Not that good.body: I Will go and have a look. But it is not that great I guess Just like and other market. But if you like to shop and buy crap it is the way to go.

Bangla-Town.title: Bangla-Town
Bangla-Town.body: When I visited Chinatown 15-20 yrs ago, most traders were Chinese. Then slowly Nepalese took over. Then Myanmar. Now Bangla. Traders speaking Banglish. Doesn't have the Chinese "feel" anymore.

Nothing too special, yet nice to visit..title: Nothing too special, yet nice to visit.
Nothing too special, yet nice to visit..body: If you're looking for replicas of branded bags, wallets, watches, shoes, caps or shirts, then this is the place. Average quality and good if you wanna bring back home some souvenirs for friends and family. Just be vigilant and take care of your belongings while walking and shopping. Snacks and drinks available at several stops.

there was nothing interesting at all....title: there was nothing interesting at all...
there was nothing interesting at all....body: its just like a big flea market. the central market right next to it is much better. visit only if you like to haggle and buy cheap stuff.

Street Market and Street FOod.title: Street Market and Street FOod
Street Market and Street FOod.body: Chinatown located near Pasar Seni and better to visit in the evening.So in the afternoon you can visit Pasar Seni first and take a look some interesting place near that.You can find cheap street food and it's good place to buy souvenir. Better if you can speak chinese or hokkien dialek, so you can bid or discuss easily with the buyer.I really enjoy all chinesse food / snack / drink in Chinatown.

Vibrant.title: Vibrant
Vibrant.body: Morning and night totally different feel. Morning will not be that crowded and you can enjoy lots of local food stall. Love the beef noodles soup and raw fish porridge. Night can be crowded and not suitable to bring young children due to narrow space.   Good to bargain for items you like but mostly foreigner take care the stall aren't we in Chinatown?

Not the same anymore.title: Not the same anymore
Not the same anymore.body: Petaling street once upon a time was a famous tourist spot. The traders were local Chinese and  there were variety of food sold. The night market was the best.  Many traders used to sell variety of things i.e fake watches, bags, t shirts, compact disk, etc. You can find all brands name it, u can get it. These days, this place are run by the foreigners and they could also be the owner of the business. The fun of going to this place is no longer the same. No excitement.  Local Chinese traders have sold or leased their business to these Foreigners.

Really great place to find a bargain.title: Really great place to find a bargain
Really great place to find a bargain.body: If you want some hippie pants or a new t-shirt this street is a really fun place to shop. You can get souveniers here for friends and is under a shelter so you can even go here if its raining.

Petaling Street is really fun..title: Petaling Street is really fun.
Petaling Street is really fun..body: This shopping street in the centre of china town is really fun. Selling clothing and fake watches and bags. Great for a walk down and is undercover so you can go here even when its raining.Make sure you barter for any item you want to buy as the inital price will be around 20-30% higher than what you should be paying.

A poor title and lack of effort.title: A poor title and lack of effort
A poor title and lack of effort.body: First of all from the get go this isn't a Chinatown at all,it is now filled with foreigners who man the stalls selling fakes,theres nothing worth of interest to be gained and it is a poor excuse for a Chinatown, my biggest wish is for this place to be labelled as something else

Pretty standard Chinatown.title: Pretty standard Chinatown
Pretty standard Chinatown.body: Lots of stalls selling everything from fake handbags to selfie sticks. Lots of haggling needed. Plenty of places to grab food and beer. It gets a little crowded so best to keep an eye on your belongings.

Nothing worth buying, but great photo op.title: Nothing worth buying, but great photo opportunity
Nothing worth buying, but great photo op.body: Overpriced Chinese fake goods market, but you can take very bright, distinct pictures of a place. There's a very authentic Chinese temple if you go along the street that is parallel to the Chinatown street (if you start at the South Gate, the street will be on the left).

Very interesting place if you have time.title: Very interesting place if you have time to spare
Very interesting place if you have time.body: This is similar to many other China Towns around the world but what is different is the hundreds of street vendors selling fake designer bags and products of all kinds. Be prepared to haggle fr prices though. This is right around the corner from the Central Market.

Would be better if you weren't pestered..title: Would be better if you weren't pestered.
Would be better if you weren't pestered..body: I love China town... great atmosphere, food and amazing things to buy that are fake designer but look authentic and real. However, the owners of stalls will not leave you alone, if I want something I will look for it and ask.... unless you are strong willed and willing to be quite rude, you won't make it very far in China town.

If you want to buy fake brands....title: If you want to buy fake brands...
If you want to buy fake brands....body: Everybody wants to sell you fake goods! So if you you wanna buy Gucci,D&G,Prada and other brands and you don't care about the quality,this place is for you!) P.S. Street food is delicious.

Malioboro KL Version.title: Malioboro KL Version
Malioboro KL Version.body: Cheap Cheap CheapThey sell anything.BagT shirtSouvenirFoodEtcYou really can buy anything.But you have to watch your bag, bit risky about pickpocket here, because this place really crowded on the night

Mini China..... great bargains.title: Mini China..... great bargains
Mini China..... great bargains.body: Visit the place along with Central Market.Only 150 odd metres from the Central Market.Grsleat place for imitation purses wallets n belts.Alshas bags , goggles, n curios in abundance.Only a small open lane with portion of the path occupied by hawkers.Bargain upto 50% of the quoted costs. You will get it.

Interesting shopping.title: Interesting shopping
Interesting shopping.body: looking for a bargain or just looking at different sights!Chinatown in Kuala Lumpur is well worth the visit

Good place!!!.title: Good place!!!
Good place!!!.body: You can visit this place during your trip...lots of things to shop... does get crowded during evening...bargaining is the key here.

China Town of Kuala Lumpur.title: China Town of Kuala Lumpur
China Town of Kuala Lumpur.body: It's a street rich with local culture. A heritage walks will make you know more on local culture, including the food & people

Cheap shopping , bartering expected.title: Cheap shopping , bartering expected
Cheap shopping , bartering expected.body: We loved the petaling street market , it is your typical market but not as large as some I have been to. It is hot and sticky and has lots and lots of brand knockoffs . Great food in little side alleys . Take the time to look around and remember these people make a living from what they do so when you settle on a price do it with good grace

Shop till you drop!.title: Shop till you drop!
Shop till you drop!.body: Any visit to KL China Town is Must. What ever you want is here!  Nudge nudge wink wink! Know what you want and be prepared to haggle for the best price. Oh no matter how how good you think you are,  the always win! But hay that's half the fun

Nice place to visit if toy want to get a.title: Nice place to visit if toy want to get a fake brand watches or pesrses
Nice place to visit if toy want to get a.body: Nice place to visit if you want to get fake brands but most of the sellers are not Chinese the taxi driver who is a Chinese say 3rd generation of malesian Chinese don't like to work there anymore just around the corner there is a temple called Sri Mahamariamman Temple you can walk to it and give it a visit

Real Chinatown feel.title: Real Chinatown feel
Real Chinatown feel.body: Definitely worth a visit on any trip to KL a real bustling market with a great atmosphere. Take some time to walk around the whole area

Chinese calligraphy.title: Chinese calligraphy
Chinese calligraphy.body: Dragon Art is a good calligraphy shop tucked upstairs in Bagunan Selangor on Jalan Sultan in China town. You can go to this rather cramp, chaotic shop packed with unexpected treasures. This is were you get all things to do with Chinese calligraphy from books to paper, pens, ink and brush stands - the lot!I bought two seal stones to engrave as chops.  Pretty and more expensive that I had wanted to pay but of a good weight so a good investment.

Worth a quick look.title: Worth a quick look
Worth a quick look.body: .Everything is fake  here  and the quality for most things are poor . The stall holders are very pushy  after 30 mins we had had enough  and left .

Shopping!!.title: Shopping!!
Shopping!!.body: If you need souvenirs come to this place.If you wanted quality please pass this place :-)A lot of fake brands.Cool atmosphere and the restaurants between the shops are nice and the view you see: shoppers doing a bargain is really nice and comfy.

Shopping fake stuff.title: Shopping fake stuff
Shopping fake stuff.body: Cool place to visit. A lot of souvenirs to buy here. The advantage: cool and cheap stuff. Nice food, cool drinks and fresh fruit.Also the sellers are not chasing you to come into there shops.Disadvantage: i don't really care, but for a billion dollar brand... this is killing seeing a lot of fake pelroducts with your name on it.

Not so big and nothing new.title: Not so big and nothing new
Not so big and nothing new.body: Same night market you see on other places. Recommended for any one who hasn't been to a market in South East asia can visit. otherwise may skip it

Nice but crowded.title: Nice but crowded
Nice but crowded.body: Visiting chinatown is like visiting a random chinatown somewhere in the world... they all look alike. The place is packed with the usual stores, shoes, bags, shirts, sunglasses. Remember to bargain at least 50% of the mentioned price, just walk away and you'll see that you get it for this price!

Buzzy and don't be afraid to try the str.title: Buzzy and don't be afraid to try the street food - it's fabulous
Buzzy and don't be afraid to try the str.body: Petaling Street is a great place to visit at night when the markets and food stalls really come to life. Be prepared to haggle hard with the stall holders. The street food restaurants provide a wide range of different offerings and don't be put off. It's usually cooked in front of you and the seafood is all freshly caught.Try the Pork Buns - delicious!

Good to visit.title: Good to visit
Good to visit.body: Bargain, Bargain, Bargain! any given price can be broken down to half and don't be shy to push and get a good deal. Lots of fun things to buy.Only if you are sensetive to bad odor or if you are clustrophobic, you better skip. There are no more chinese people left here and there are more from Bangladesh. Nice people ☺️

A great market.title: A great market
A great market.body: Like any market if you do a bit of research and find out what a reasonable price to pay will be you can get some great bargains.

Knock off heaven.title: Knock off heaven
Knock off heaven.body: If there's nothing you can't find here, then it doesn't exist. many knock offs of everything...still room to negotiate prices. great food. it is crowded, be cautious of your purses and valuables.

Strolled round here for an hour.title: Strolled round here for an hour
Strolled round here for an hour.body: Nice place to stroll around and visit the sites - the place is vibrant and friendly - I went to the temple and sat for a while just taking in the atmosphere - Lovely hour out and away from sterile shops !

Classic Chinese district.title: Classic Chinese district
Classic Chinese district.body: When walking around the area, you should go to Chinatown. There is no specific things to visit and different to other Chinatown districts in Asian city, but the district is well located and Petaling street is a must see when going to Chinatown

Bangladesh town.title: Bangladesh town
Bangladesh town.body: Having a family in Malaysia, they all rave about petaling street and how cool it used to be. I can assure you this is not anywhere near cool anymore. 80% of vendors are in fact Bangladeshi not Chinese - and are pushy, annoying and too touchy, they are terrible at haggling unlike the Chinese who always offer good friendly service and prices. There is very little left of what once was Chinatown, it's now BanglaTown, and only recommended if you want counterfeit goods which you can get some great purchases Top tip - DO NOT buy what's on display AT ALL. This is the WORST quality cheapest goods, ask them to show you the best quality bags and watches as they have more stock in the back. Do not ever buy display goods they are of disgusting quality and I could make them myself. Buy from their showrooms or stockrooms - and remember, ALWAYS haggle! If they offer a silly price just turn around and walk away - another stall will sell the exact same thing and might offer you a better price, a top tip for bagging is to say 'your friends stall over there offered me '....' insert a reasonable price you're willing to pay. They'll match it to not lose your custom to their 'friend' who you've just made up - works a trick LOL

A very touristy market.title: A very touristy market
A very touristy market.body: If your in the area then a walk down Petaling Street may be fun but I wouldn't go out of my way. Every 3rd stall is selling the same ......all aimed at the tourist you could be in HK, Bangkok or any other main Asian city

Largest Bags/handbags Street.title: Largest Bags/handbags Street
Largest Bags/handbags Street.body: You can find lots of "branded" bags, handbags, backpack, school bag, luggage here.May try lots of nice food along the street. Cloths available here as well.It's crowded, beware of pickpocket.

Chinatown shopping.title: Chinatown shopping
Chinatown shopping.body: Good for shopping with cheep prices but you may get copy and non original itemsEasy accessable with ( the menorail Two stations after time square)The usually start with double or triple the real price ''

Bargain, bargain and again bargain.title: Bargain, bargain and again bargain
Bargain, bargain and again bargain.body: Funny cheap fake things to buy in a different china fake bargain district. This is not the Singapore or San Francisco China town, much different than those mentioned. Worth a visit if you hang around in Kuala Lumpur!!

Be prepares to bargain the seller.title: Be prepares to bargain the seller
Be prepares to bargain the seller.body: Make sure you bargain with the seller. It is always good to go with a local so he/she can help you Lots of imitations but sometimes you csn find antiques too. Also rings, bracelets made of silver. Those would be niceThere are also small stalls that sell food and deinks. Many are not halal. Be csreful for muslimsFor souvrniers you can walk down to central market which is very close by

Nothing interesting.title: Nothing interesting
Nothing interesting.body: Nothing interesting in China Town of Kuala Lumpur. Only fake bags, glasses and wallets. The only thing worth it is a restaurant called Old China Café.

Polish your bargaining skill.title: Polish your bargaining skill
Polish your bargaining skill.body: This is the place to come for all the knock off name brands, be careful of the watches most are broken so check well before purchase. A reasonable Rolex replica should set you back 150 MYR get a card from the vendor if you buy so you know where to return when it stops working, there is no problem with the replacing your purchase. I guess they know most of the stuff is garbage.

Good markets and food.title: Good markets and food
Good markets and food.body: Found some good cheap buys or knock off bags, t-shirts and toys.  The vendors were very happy to barter.  We had a delicious Nasi Lemak and Char Kway Teow in the market restaurant at a very cheap price of around AU$3 each.

Another Chinatown.title: Another Chinatown
Another Chinatown.body: Similar to other Chinatowns around the world. Lots of stalls selling "stuff." Crowded walk ways, soem decent street food but not much.

Japan Patraling should be called Dodgy g.title: Japan Patraling should be called Dodgy goods street
Japan Patraling should be called Dodgy g.body: Lots of fake brands including watches, handbags, leather good and clothing.Buyer beware I would say. Fun to haggle though

China town Fakes.title: China town Fakes
China town Fakes.body: We were told to go here for fake handbags and watches. And it was true. Bags at every stall, watches, tee shirts and leather items.You have to haggle hard to get a bargain. All part of the fun. If you want some cheap items at knock down prices (but a lot of the items were looking a bit shabby so stay awake and pay attention.On the way out we saw the police getting ready to raid the area and we did notice that a lot of the street seller had walkie talkies so I think buying some of the items could be illegal and you may not be allowed to bring them back to your home country so be careful,We bought a couple of items which looked like designer range but had a different label on them.

Interesting for a bit of bartering.title: Interesting for a bit of bartering
Interesting for a bit of bartering.body: If you have not done this sort of down market bartering in another Asian city, have a go for a bit of local colour.   This is a 30 min/1 hour excursion for cheap knock off brands. The smallholders are all courteous and not pushy, this is not Morocco!Interesting once but, not amazing.

Interesting local experience.title: Interesting local experience
Interesting local experience.body: A busy afternoon and night market. Expect lots of haggling. Stalls start to look the same after a while, as a number of them sell the same stuff.

Come see the old KL.title: Come see the old KL
Come see the old KL.body: This is a place for people who like to see authentic places while travelling. It is old and nice. It truly show the old KL as it was 40-50 years ago. For snobbish people who enjoys modern 5 stars hotels, please stay away. It is not for you.

Crowded area with less Chinese people.title: Crowded area with less Chinese people
Crowded area with less Chinese people.body: When get to know about this place then thought will be actual China town but when visit then understood that all the all shops selling cheap quality Chinese stuff with over priced tag and sellers from local or Asian but not Chinese. If go for food then can taste is very normal and as usual so high. Actually street food never see expensive then good hotel food. One dish which we eat at our hotel for 40 MYR that same order there and later found it's for 70 MYR. Make sure to ask the price for everything u order there before they start cooking otherwise later you realize it's your mistake. In short nothing special there to see or visit and if skip then no harm

Shopping haven.title: Shopping haven
Shopping haven.body: Almost everything that one wanted...Food, shopping and some temple sight-seeing. right in the heart of the city. Crowded at night, so be careful of your valuables. Must visit when in KL...

Petaling Street is Patong for MY.title: Petaling Street is Patong for MY
Petaling Street is Patong for MY.body: Just full of merchandise stores.  However a great old market and food court just off the main drag.Food in the the food court was excellent and very reasonable prices.  Good value on beer as well.Worth an afternoon wander.

Great food places.title: Great food places
Great food places.body: Very crowded but some fantastic food places at very reasonable prices. We went twice in 2 days because we enjoyed so much. Lots of stalls too.

Fun fakes.title: Fun fakes
Fun fakes.body: Bargain well so you don't get ripped off and ask for the better quality stuff not the tacky display items!! Always pack your manners even when haggling!!

A smelly place.title: A smelly place
A smelly place.body: Its a very crowded cross full of shops. Very smelly in some areas. There is no price tag on the goods so the shopkeepers just pop out the price 3 or 4 time the real price and you have to bargin. My son wanted to by a pair of shorts 55 was the first price provided by the guy . Finally he agreed on 25 ringet!!!!!! I did not like the whole script but if you are good in barginning and not very sesnsative to different smells this is the place to shop.

Crowded and expensive.title: Crowded and expensive
Crowded and expensive.body: We went here mid to late afternoon for some quick shopping with our children. We stopped at a restaurant on the main strip for a cold drink and my husband went upstairs to go to the toilet. On his way up the stairs a large rat came running down the stairs and scratched my husbands ankle. It bled for a few hours. Thankfully he caught no disease from the incident but it put us off a bit! The kids did not really want to hang around after that! We did a little bit of shopping but found alot of the stalls excessive in their prices and the couple of things the kids did buy, we got for well under half the initial asking price. Bargain hard!!

Stroll through town.title: Stroll through town
Stroll through town.body: Was very interesting, lots to see, eat and many interesting sights. Busy and bustling noisy and very active. Street food galore if your keen.

Charmed at Daylight.title: Charmed at Daylight
Charmed at Daylight.body: We recently explored street photography at Petaling Street at daylight while sampling the breakfast served piping hot at this early hours. First up, it's the rice noodles (cheecheongfun) stores along the main junction of the street that offers squabbling owners trying to attract customers, surely this happens throughout the day, they can get quite loud at times. Next, enjoying a nice cup of coffee further down the street of a store naming themselves The King of Tea. Would recommend to try and judge for yourself. Walking around the street and snapping the hustle and bustle of a street gearing up for a full day of business was an enthralling experience. This place has the charm of the olden Kuala Lumpur while the modernity is slowly trying to bust out. It's good to be a witness to history in writing.

A MUST PLACE TO VISIT.title: A MUST PLACE TO VISIT
A MUST PLACE TO VISIT.body: Found area to be safe to walk around even though it was busy.Easy to find and get to from all parts of the city.Well worth a visit.

Took over by foreign labours?.title: Took over by foreign labours?
Took over by foreign labours?.body: I'm kinda shocked to learn that the Petaling Street aka Chinatown in KL has been operating mostly by foreigners! I rarely see any Chinese there, rather Nepalese / Burmese / Bangladeshi / Sri Lankan etc mending the stalls. They even prepares and serves the local favourite dishes, surely well trained by the respective food stall owners! Some can speak the local language, Bahasa & even Chinese dialects, but minimal English. Sadly, it no longer has the old Chinatown ethnic enclave of Chinese. It's a pity to lose this cultural touch. Overall, the place is still very much the same when I first visited in 1993, except running by foreigners instead of locals. Selling imitation branded goods, cheap souvenirs made in China, and wide selection of local foods, which is very affordable. It's worth a trip just for an experience, if you're in KL.

do not go..title: do not go.
do not go..body: worst place ever! no Chinese in FAKE CHINA TOWN. Pakistan, Indian and Bangladian sell fake awful bags at the ridiculous price and even Chinese food is yucky.

dont waste your time.title: dont waste your time
dont waste your time.body: do not waste your time, money and taste. there is nothing to come again. even the food was awful. no Chinese culture in Chinatown.

Mwoa...title: Mwoa..
Mwoa...body: Not very special, almost only the same shops: watches, food, vegatables and shoes.Not always very save as mentioned by locals

Disappointing in comparison to other pla.title: Disappointing in comparison to other places...
Disappointing in comparison to other pla.body: Having visited several markets in thailand,  this market seemed pretty small and lacking in variety. If you're not in the market for knock - off handbags, watches and shoes ('genuine copies', though) then this probably is not worth a visit. If you do decide to take a look, then haggling is essential as initial prices quoted are way too high.

Chinatown.....title: Chinatown....
Chinatown.....body: Chinatown is good locality for shopping and foodies. But i rather prefer thee one in Singapore. Good place though .

Good to get some fake goods.title: Good to get some fake goods
Good to get some fake goods.body: If you are after sunglasses, handbags, souvenirs etc. this is worth a visit - if not I wouldn't bother.

Don,t miss this street.title: Don,t miss this street
Don,t miss this street.body: What ever you want to eat you will find it in this street, i had a crack at the durian and yes it was what some people say you either love it or hate it ,but the food was to die for

Really?.title: Really?
Really?.body: I have seen better china town in NY, SFO and Sydney.  This place is a dump...very small....dirty, nasty and smelly.   Very close to Central Market which has better souvenirs...AVOID this place...

Lunch.title: Lunch
Lunch.body: Madras road Yong tau foo for lunch. Kl Chinatown area. Pretty good. Nice soupy mix of Yong tau foo variety. Popular amongst the local. Great food at average prices.

Great place to shop..title: Great place to shop.
Great place to shop..body: GREAT Shopping!! GREAT copy handbags. There are average copies and OUTSTANDING copies. Be ready to haggle. Bought some great pieces and really enjoyed the night shopping here. Only found one impolite stall holder. Overall I recommend a ramble in Chinatown. It was fun and worthwhile. There are also great places to eat closely.

Petaling Street Market with 3 kids.title: Petaling Street Market with 3 kids
Petaling Street Market with 3 kids.body: Came here in the evening at around 8PM.  We spent a couple of hours walking around the market and we all enjoyed it, even the kids.  It is mainly clothes, watches, shoes, bags, souvenirs, hats and toys.  You really can haggle here and many times we came away spending 30% of the asking price.  The key thing is to agree the price before you try anything on and make sure the kids know not to say too much as they latch onto the kids and make it harder to bargain.  We got some good 'polo' shirts/lookalikes for a couple of pounds.  There are some restaurants but there are two side market streets that run off the central crossroads on Petaling Street where there are some better street food places where you will see the locals eating.Great fun and worth a visit.

Not so Chinese's China Town.title: Not so Chinese's China Town
Not so Chinese's China Town.body: Come in the morning if possible to avoid the torching heat.Attractions in morning (8am to 12pm): Malaysian Chinese Breakfast, Roast Duck (pure succulent duck meat, not rice), Malaysian Iced Coffee/Tea, a local fresh/wet market for you to understand Malaysian's food culture, a couple of shops selling special Chinese Items which can bring back as souvenirs. and a few historical Chinese temples and an Indian temple near by.Attractions in the afternoon (12pm to 5pm): Different food (try for Kim Lian Kee's Chinese Wok Fry Noodles) and other is the same.Attraction in night: A night market that mainly dominated by illegal immigrants and foreign workers (hired by their possible Chinese boss) and thus nothing much to shout: not so Chinese's China Town anymore. There are better night market in KL.

Bargain place.title: Bargain place
Bargain place.body: Nothing too great about the market but we did find few things to buy. Bargain was crazy at this place. Would not highly recommend it but can be given a try for once atleast.

Must visit if you love shopping, and eve.title: Must visit if you love shopping, and even if you don't!
Must visit if you love shopping, and eve.body: While entire Kuala Lumpur is complete concrete, China town is a welcome break - the entire area is full of mini shops dealing in everything from watches, bags, clothes, accessories, souvenirs to restaurants and fruit vendors. Best part - this is like a dedicated open air shopping complex - no vehicles permitted inside. There are departmental stores as well, with labelled price tags - so if you are looking for a good price but do not want to get into bargaining, these stores are ideal. Really inexpensive stuff - depends on what you are looking for. Shops are roadside are bargain friendly (start with 50% was what I was told by a local) - stores on the sides have fixed price tag (with good variety). The place is buzzing with activity and its fun to have a feel of such a place in middle of KL. While you are there, don't miss out to grab the freshly roasted hazelnuts - would make your day!

Be very careful of quality and price.title: Be very careful of quality and price
Be very careful of quality and price.body: People here real cheat, but i knew this so we got good stuffs at a reasonable prices .Eg. If a LV clutch they mention for 200rn u can straight ask for 40/50 and they will sell it. They hike the price 4/5 times from the actual selling price. You should bargain well.

Not recommended.title: Not recommended
Not recommended.body: We really did not understand what people saw in China Town as touristic. My husband and I did not like it at all, and we felt that locals agreed with us.

Shopping at china town.title: Shopping at china town
Shopping at china town.body: Chinatown was a great place to visit to haggle over cheap second hand souvenirs. Moreover, the place really lights up at night, with many different roadside restaurants and a few watering holes to grab a drink.My suggestion is to grab a drink, and an authentic Malaysian cuisine by the main roads, to enjoy the general bustle of the place and also get an appreciation of the China town vibe.TipsKeep an eye on your wallets/belongings as it does get crowded and I have heard Petry thefts are common here .Wear sunscreen! It gets hot in Kl!!

terrible experience.title: terrible experience
terrible experience.body: this area has a lot of shops to buy souvenirs in good precises but you must bargain with the seller and the most important thing to take care of thieves, my friend's wallet was stolen there.

Sort escape.title: Sort escape
Sort escape.body: Visit with a friend.We could find many souvenir, fruit, also food here.For souvenir you need to bargain with the seller to get good price.

Nice place for shopping.title: Nice place for shopping
Nice place for shopping.body: Hi,  I visited here on July 17. Its cheap place for shopping.  But of course its not authentic. Just cut the price 50% from asking price.  Because some of them offered the high price. There is many discount on shops also,  you don't need to asking a cheap price because its fixed price.  But its cheap already I think.

Great market.title: Great market
Great market.body: One of the better markets I've visitedLots of bartering!I bought a tank top here and bartered him down to 15 ringgit from 40, not a really great deal but lots of fun!

So much fun!.title: So much fun!
So much fun!.body: Great quality copies of bags, wallets, watches, shirts, underwear and all sorts of 'stuff.' It is a place to barter and get a good deal. Be prepared and know your conversions. Walk away if your not happy with the deal and if they want your custom they will call you back.Eat on the street and take in the hustle and bustle of the array of the many people that walk past. Before you leave grab some fresh fruit. Taxis are plentiful too.It is a place that you will want to return to again and again,

Hen hao.title: Hen hao
Hen hao.body: Practical place to visit for buying presents and souvenirs for family and friends. Try to look around first instead of buying the first stall. Sometimes the goods in the inner part are cheaper than those from the outer area. Best time to go is late afternoon and early evening. Super cheap!

Good food, good buys!.title: Good food, good buys!
Good food, good buys!.body: Really love the Mata Kucing drink in the middle of Petaling Street and their famous Tau Foo Fa. If you're a shopper, you'll love this place too.

It is a very popular Night Market.title: It is a very popular Night Market
It is a very popular Night Market.body: Chinatown is one of the most popular tourist Market in Malasia.It's in Petalian Streetoffering all kinds of goods at cheap price.Haggling is the way of  life here.

Very crowded.title: Very crowded
Very crowded.body: If you are looking for knock offs at a cheap price, this is the place to be.  Be prepared to bargain and get things cheaper than the asking price.  Get a bag of the fresh roasted chestnuts to munch on while browsing through the hundreds of stalls.

No need for tour.title: No need for tour
No need for tour.body: This market is small compared to Hong Kong night marketEasy to walk around and pavement good for wheelchairsStalls are fake handbags, fake shoes, fake sunglasses, leather belts and fidget and tech stalls. Not much else.There is street food located centrally. Let your nose guide you but take your own risk as smell is not inviting.Good for a look.Bartering expected. Please be respectful when bartering or if you do not want, just say no thank you and walk on. I watch too many tourists rudely reply to stallholders when not provoked or pushed. Is hot so go late.Stalls begin to pack up 2130_2200 hoursSave your money, a tour is not needed.Grab a cab or walk from your hotel if residing central.

A little disappointing.title: A little disappointing
A little disappointing.body: After visiting Chinatown in Singapore we were expecting something similar - lots of stall, locals enticing you to buy and lots of variety.  There were lots of stall but the majority sold the same thing - if you wanted hangbags, sunglasses or watches you would be in your element but apart from that there wasn't alot of variety.  It was still nice to wander past the stalls and interact with the locals and haggle about prices.

Bad experience,not even Chinese.title: Bad experience,not even Chinese
Bad experience,not even Chinese.body: Bad experience. Selling only replicas sunglasses,watches and bags. Rude people here. Asking too much money. It is a tourist trap. not even Chinese. I met only Pakistani and Indians here. It is dirty and there aren't food stalls. I don't believe that this is Chinatown.singapores Chinatown is the best

Bad experience.title: Bad experience
Bad experience.body: Watch out for pickpockets. Rude stall owners. Only replica bags,sunglasses and watches here. Nothing to see

Not even Chinese.title: Not even Chinese
Not even Chinese.body: There are stalls selling only replicas bags,watches and sunglasses. Nothing special.too touristy.overated. Dirty. Not so cheap.rude stall owners. And all people I met wasn't Chinese. I met only Arab,Pakistani,Indians. At this street there aren't food stalls

Don't Bother.title: Don't Bother
Don't Bother.body: Absolute waste of time.  Do not bother unless you are interested in buying cheap, fake goods.  The whole area is dirty, smelly and hot.  Row upon row of pure tat.

Interesting Market, cheap and Bangkok st.title: Interesting Market, cheap and Bangkok style
Interesting Market, cheap and Bangkok st.body: You can buy fake Gucci, Prada, YSL, LV and similar stuff and they look genuine. It smells bad, but that is the point. It is crowded and shop owners invite you inside all the time. If you know how to bargain you can pay maybe 20-30% of regular asking price. Must see in KL

Very crowded but fun.title: Very crowded but fun
Very crowded but fun.body: I find the best way to attack crowded night markets is to make sure you have your sense of humor and have fun!  This we did.Every stall holder was persistent but a smiling 'no thanks' doesn't take much.After some pretty tough bargaining (at least 60 percent off) and lots of smiles, I got some great buy - kids clothes, handbags, jewellery etc.   Feasted on the fantastic dim sims - great variety and flavor.It does get hot and stuffy bit a great atmosphere and night out.

Don't waste your time!.title: Don't waste your time!
Don't waste your time!.body: Same same same...junk junk junk! Stall after stall of fake handbags, shoes, tshirts etc. the food was good, especially the dumpling seller near the entrance but go to Jalan Alor for street food.

Overrated and sleazy.title: Overrated and sleazy
Overrated and sleazy.body: This market and region is purely for the tourists these days. Not much street food on offer and nock off souvenirs. A few good cafes round the edges of the market and some nice temples to look at but not worth spending too long here. A large bus hub brings many local travellers to this district and loads of backpackers

Nice place for food and fake goods.title: Nice place for food and fake goods
Nice place for food and fake goods.body: - part of China culture, food and goods .- u should be clever in bargains to buy .- mostly crowded specially in evening time .- temple must be visit in the area .

Night shopping.title: Night shopping
Night shopping.body: The streets around this place sell anything and everything from T-Shirts to leather good and plenty of street food. Be careful about your belongings and bargain, Bargain...BARGAIN. Walk slowly and look for stuff. Don't buy without browsing. Take your time.

Busy and bargains.title: Busy and bargains
Busy and bargains.body: A very busy place. Good place to grab some bargains though. Also many food places. Enjoyed a quick visit here.

Rubbish.title: Rubbish
Rubbish.body: Complete tourist trap set up to fleece naive travellers of their cash. Shifty, wise guy type sellers flogging counterfeit designer goods for as much money as they can get. Narrow sweaty walkways so it takes an eternity to walk through the place. If you are looking for an authentic KL market experience with the same type of goods on offer then do yourself a favor and skip this place and go to Chow Kit (take the rapidKL public transport to the PWTC stop and walk from there) market area instead. Prices are much cheaper, there are barely any tourists (it's where the locals shop), and the selection is much bigger.

Hectic.title: Hectic
Hectic.body: If you're going during the day, it's very relaxed with less shops open, at night there's 3x the amount of shops open with a much better atmosphere. Mix between fixed price and bartering but can get a bit overcrowded

Now for the fainthearted.title: Now for the fainthearted
Now for the fainthearted.body: Busy, noisy, colourful and full of hawkers - everything you would expect from a Chinatown. The market (once in full swing) is fairly large with lots of tight lanes between the stalls. Plenty of kitsch to buy and plenty of hawkers wanting your money. Worth a visit for an hour. While your in the area checkout central market, which is open from about 10am.

Just stands.title: Just stands
Just stands.body: I was expecting to see a lot of Chinese shops and restaurants but to my surprise, the street was runes into stands selling all sorts of goods, not Chinese, and visitors were left with a tiny path that fits only one pedestrian. Not a real china town.

affordable place.title: affordable place
affordable place.body: comparing to other china towns in other towns, this one was the worst ever, I expected something typical chinese

Chinatown?.title: Chinatown?
Chinatown?.body: I believe Petaling Street locate in china town. So if you going to china town in KL, you will visit this place. Many Chinese people sell Chinese stuffs here. I suggest you to came afternoon cause in they not open at the morning.

Good place to find replica.title: Good place to find replica
Good place to find replica.body: As you know, china stuffs. You will find a lots of cheap products from china, korea, and japan. But most of them from china.The one i don't like is their hospitality and the atmosphere, they too arrogant and racist to another Chinese like me. But overall, this place is good.

Everything there.title: Everything there
Everything there.body: This place amazing you can find everything there clothes, watch , makeup and many stuff, but don't eat there the food wasn't halal

Cheap thrills.title: Cheap thrills
Cheap thrills.body: Plenty of cheap thrills-just be careful as probably everything with a logo on it is a faux - but it’s a nice thing to do anyway

Central Market.title: Central Market
Central Market.body: Lots of the usual. Nothing you can't find in every other market like this in Asia.Mostly knock offs and Chinese manufactured trinkets - not much true Malaysian items.

Cheap trills!.title: Cheap trills!
Cheap trills!.body: Chinatown is an area filled with colours; it is an exquisite neighborhood that never sleeps. The entire area is filled with stalls offering all kinds of goods, though this is an area where one should definitely bargain in order to get the best deal.  Regarding the shopping, my favourite purchase was a wooden necklace with my name written on it. I also bought plenty of handicrafts and souvenirs for family, friends and myself.

checking out the culture.title: checking out the culture
checking out the culture.body: there is no better way about learning the culture of new countries from there local markets  from there food to there crafts this was a great market for the food side when you got half way down follow your nose you will be pleasantly suprised

fake product.title: fake product
fake product.body: Average place and you can really test your bargaining skills. Duplicate products are being sold, and market is also to clumsy.

Bazaar.title: Bazaar
Bazaar.body: Street shops lined along, all selling the same stuff and almost all fake or imitation products of big brands.Good to walk through and get to the eat street :)

Wonderful old world Malaysian charm.title: Wonderful old world Malaysian charm
Wonderful old world Malaysian charm.body: Some of the very original traders of yesteryear  still have shops and operate businesses here.Great food choices and photo opportunitiesGreat insight into how chinese culture mixes in with malay culture.facinating area

Good for buying cheap price.title: Good for buying cheap price
Good for buying cheap price.body: The place is near pasar seni so this place is best price compare to pasar seni a lot of thing specially souvenirs can be bought here

Not good shopping places.title: Not good shopping places
Not good shopping places.body: Crowded and sell fake goods.. Not reccomended for tourist with family.. Many Men "gangster" Face Looking around, make uneasy to walk around even day. Better go to sungei Wang Mall or other night market.

The longan dessert drink here is recomme.title: The longan dessert drink here is recommended
The longan dessert drink here is recomme.body: Chinatown is not what it used to be. Chinese New Year is the best time to visit. Now it is highly catered for tourists looking for bargain buys or souveniers to bring home. Locals would go for the longan dessert drink and the black hokkien mee which is very nice. There are plenty of hidden gem food stalls to be found if you know how to navigate your way into the alleys and small lanes.

Cozy cafe at petaling street.title: Cozy cafe at petaling street
Cozy cafe at petaling street.body: I would like to recommend the cozy cafes at petaling street as they are really good and nice! Personally I love Merchant Lane and Leaf& co the most as I like the cafe design itself. Merchant Lane have very interesting paintings and designs at the cafe. The food for merchant lane is quite good and the cafe gives you a cozy and vintage feel. Besides, leaf & co have nice food and the service is very good. Both price for food are a bit averagely high, around RM35 for a lunch and a cup of coffee. However it will be a nice visit for relaxing of mind.

Classic.title: Classic
Classic.body: No matter what Chinatown you go to in the world, it's Chinatown. Just speak a different language. May sound negative, but still worth a visit. Always have to visit a Chinatown, just incase you find something different. Always different choice of food.

Not worth visiting.title: Not worth visiting
Not worth visiting.body: Stores tended by foreign immigrants rather than Chinese. Have a few popular stalls like Longan drinks, noodles place, peanut kuehs. Good for buying souvenirs and be careful with personal belongings.

Very interesting experience.title: Very interesting experience
Very interesting experience.body: If you ever wanted a Praia bag, or a Gucci watch, but didn't want to pay the high pricez, then this is the place to come. They have fakes galore! But, ask for the good fakes, and with some stalls, you will be excorted to an air conditioned room in the back, with the super fancy, high quality fakes. It's all a fascinating experience. But remember, it is against the law to intentionally bring fake goods into the UK, so be wise!

Walkabout.title: Walkabout
Walkabout.body: Place for cultural heritage appreciation. Less hectic on weekdays. Hate the goods immitation sellers though. Nice if u like tasting local delicacies originated from china also.

Only to buy souvenirs.title: Only to buy souvenirs
Only to buy souvenirs.body: Petaling street is good if you are tourist and would like to buy some nice souvenirs. There are loads of options (all China made stuff).

Good for Food and Bargains.title: Good for Food and Bargains
Good for Food and Bargains.body: It can be a little oppressive during the heat of the mid-day but is more pleasant after 4pm. There are plenty of Hawkers providing tasty food and ther are some great bargains to be had for those who are after footwear and fashion accessories. Its good to haggle. Start at 50% of the offer price and go from there.

Everything is cheap and cheerful!.title: Everything is cheap and cheerful!
Everything is cheap and cheerful!.body: My wife and myself spent an hour or so visiting Chinatown in KL. Here you can find cheap copies of almost everything but one cannot help but to wonder about the quality and durability of such products. Chinese eateries are in abundance here and food is served fresh, recommended for those who want to spend little money of authentic meals. It's worth noting that Chinatown is next door to KL central market which is definitely worth visiting.

Sleazy street market.title: Sleazy street market
Sleazy street market.body: Lots of similar things on multiple stalls. Sleazy stall holders often abusive if do not buy from there. Felt a little unsafe. If you like to haggle the you will enjoy this market. No price on anything so have to ask and the negotiations begin. Be prepared to be yelled at if do not buy. Good range of knock offs at reasonable prices if you negotiate hard.Interesting contrast to central market. Choice depends on what you are looking for. Hard to get taxi back to central Kuala Lumpur. Left feeling a bit ripped off.Be money safe.

Chinatown no more.title: Chinatown no more
Chinatown no more.body: This place is no more the Chinatown we used to visit. With the influx of foreign workers( legal and illegal), many stalls are operated by foreigners instead of the original Chinese. Therefore , do not expect to see or purchase any authentic local Chinese delicacies or souvenirs.

Great night life.title: Great night life
Great night life.body: The food and market are wonderful. If you are looking for gifts and bags this is the place to go. Got lots of great bargains but if you want female clothes your best off going to the shopping centre. Polos and tourist tops are everywhere. Best not to take children as everyone is smoking and there is very minimal room.

Shopping Heaven!.title: Shopping Heaven!
Shopping Heaven!.body: Yes it was very hot and crowded but if you are after cheap stuff, it's the place to go.  After just arriving from Penang and experiencing the night market in Batu Ferringi, this market was way cheaper and selling much the same stuff.  Be careful of bags and valuables and prepare to haggle!

Not a real chinese town.title: Not a real chinese town
Not a real chinese town.body: It was a cramp alley full of fake stuff. Thought i will find nice restaurants or some ethnic accessories, not really. It's really different than a common chinatown.

Shop shop shop.title: Shop shop shop
Shop shop shop.body: So much to buy near central markets. If your into fake handbags, t-shirts, replica football kits and street food it's the place to come.

Nothing different.title: Nothing different
Nothing different.body: The markets are OK but mainly bag, watch and clothing stalls that repeat and all appear to sell the same stuff.  It is interesting for 30 mins or so but then you start suffering from deja vu!

Very exciting.title: Very exciting
Very exciting.body: If you have the patience, the stamina and love haggling, then this is the place to go, you will be tempted by the thousands of varieties. One small advice, dont ask for the price unless you are going to buy, some retailers get offended.

Deep pockets,stamina (both phyically and.title: Deep pockets,stamina (both phyically and mentally), thick skin and the smile.
Deep pockets,stamina (both phyically and.body: To enjoy  shopping you will need the tools above, haggle is the key, never mind the attitude of some retailers, all are there to sell, most of them are good,  others would sweet talk you, while some will sing the " I will lose " tune, but it is really enjoyable and interesting.Will definitely come back

Fun but touristy.title: Fun but touristy
Fun but touristy.body: Great place to grab a souvenir or two but do a full lap and suss out prices before you start to haggle 🤣

A buzzing street in downtown KL.title: A buzzing street in downtown KL
A buzzing street in downtown KL.body: This is a must if in the area! There are plenty of guys who are going to try and sell you fake watches and t-shirts but it is still a pretty fun and lively street to walk down! Some of the food and drink stands along the way are great for a quick snack. There are off shoots down side streets to keep things interesting.

Always worth a visit.title: Always worth a visit
Always worth a visit.body: Chinatown has plenty of shops to see with some of the gear quite good but reasonably priced, but haggle. There are also a number of good restaurants to eat and it is easy to get there by taxi or LRT.

Buy from China town.title: Buy from China town
Buy from China town.body: Recommended place to visit in KL - you can find a variety of things to buy.Leather bags - watches - clothes - sunglasses from different and famous brands.You can negotiate on prices - drop it as much as you can.

Too rude shop keeper.title: Too rude shop keeper
Too rude shop keeper.body: I visited this place thinking shopping would be cheap, but in reality shopping in this Street is as good shopping in any shopping mall but you get cheap quality products for branded product price. This place is for people who has good bargaining skills. Bargaining from 150 MYR to as low as 30 MYR will work in this place

Evening Visit.title: Evening Visit
Evening Visit.body: We visited here in the evening and managed to buy a few bargains! Make sure you haggle as they will try to rip you off. The atmosphere here is great and I would advise anyone to visit for the experience.

Big disappointment, very little to see o.title: Big disappointment, very little to see or shop
Big disappointment, very little to see o.body: Few streets filled with junk, t-shirt, cheap souvenirs, dirty overpriced restaurants.Skip the main streets and head to the '' Portuguese". food vendors  or to the Central Market which is adjacent to Petaling street.

Parsons romp the Chinatown market.title: Parsons romp the Chinatown market
Parsons romp the Chinatown market.body: We spent about an hour at this market which is mainly fake bags, tee shirts, glasses, watches and foodIt's spread over 4 streets.Tips if your looking for s fake branded bag make sure you haggle hard my daughter purchased a Gucci back pack and was quoted 550 MRPs after 15 mins she finally paid 75  MRPs, my recommendation is hop from stall to stall saying how much as they all sell the same stuff and will reduce the price if you walk away, we also purchased a lonchamp fold bag for 30 MRPs from an original pitch from the stall holder of 150, ditto in respect of a Ted baker makeup bag.Simple story what ever they start at only pay 25% of the starting price The food places are tucked behind the stalls so hunt they out as it's worth a bashEnjoy and go grab a bargain

Unable to recognise the place.title: Unable to recognise the place
Unable to recognise the place.body: It does not look like Chinatown anymore despite the name at the entrance. Instead, it's more like Dhaka Town. It is beginning to lose it's character. However, it is vibrant and I can see that business there is thriving.

a good place to visit during daytime.title: a good place to visit during daytime
a good place to visit during daytime.body: nice place to walk around during day time. evening it's full full with all the shops so close to each other

You can here by LRT pasar seni!.title: You can here by LRT pasar seni!
You can here by LRT pasar seni!.body: So ac you arrive at LRT pasar seni, you can go towards central market, you will see texas chicken or KK Mart near the central market, go behind of the shop. you will see all the red colour tanglung/lamp , you will see china town there!

Great atmosphere and lots of bargains.title: Great atmosphere and lots of bargains
Great atmosphere and lots of bargains.body: If you hate crowded spaces, being hassled by vendors and opposed to a bit of bartering then this place is not for you. Petaling St is the heart of Kuala Lumpa's China Town district and forms the backdrop to a vibrant night scene with an eclectic mix of stalls and street food venues. You can buy anything here and if you fancy a designer label (the quality does vary) then you can barter to your hearts content. There are literally hundreds of stalls and the area gets busier as the day goes on. The vendors put in some hours as the market is open for about 12 hours each day. If you want to avoid the crowds the. Early morning is best. The compromise here is the atmosphere just isn't quite the same. We had some delicious food and a couple of large beers at one of the street stalls. The portions were big and the food tasted better than any Chinese food I have tasted at home. All for about 100 RM (£20).The hustle and bustle is great and worthy of a few hours of your time. We will definitely go back.

Everything.title: Everything
Everything.body: here, while walking alongggg the street, u can get almost anything (beg, cloth from copy, great AA) but u need to be very good in bargain :)

WIDE RANGE OF GOODS IN CHINATOWN.title: WIDE RANGE OF GOODS IN CHINATOWN
WIDE RANGE OF GOODS IN CHINATOWN.body: Kuala Lumpur's Chinatown is one of the best in the world in terms of quality, range of goods and prices. However, skilled bartering is a must if one is to achieve the best prices.The crowded walkways also mean that travellers must take precautions to keep their wallets and other valuables safe.

Branded things for cheap rate.title: Branded things for cheap rate
Branded things for cheap rate.body: One of the famous tourist attractions. You can get good things for good prices like wallets, Keychain and bags. But the place is very dirty.

Overrated.title: Overrated
Overrated.body: Stalls of fake goods sold at exorbitant high opening prices which have to be bargained down. Stallkeepers are mainly foreigners. But if you're looking for cheap souvenir t-shirts, you can find them here.

Be prepared to be hassled.title: Be prepared to be hassled
Be prepared to be hassled.body: Just another market with sellers flogging watches, pens and every other sort of junk. Give it a miss.

Walkabout in China Town.title: Walkabout in China Town
Walkabout in China Town.body: I went to China Town after quite some time.  Was a bit surprised to see so many foreigners with stalls.  Though it's a tourist attraction spot, the prices quoted are ridiculously high.  Bargaining is expected, and at times the stall owners sales people are quite rude as well.  Not good for Malaysia.

Food stalls.title: Food stalls
