Food stalls.body: So many food stalls, for snacks that you can eat while wandering and looking around or things that you can take away for later.The food is hot and cooked there in front of you, and is not like western food at all but I tried to try as many of the different dishes as I could I'd have no idea what I ate but all I can say is TRY them! They are so cheap and some of the snacks are really worth it!!The clothes and accessory stallshere and those like all over south East Asia that I have explored. "same same but different".There are all types of nockoffs from bags to shoes to tops. Then you have belts, the genie pants (that I love), different tops - both western styles and traditional.The streets of stalls seem to just keep going and going. I'd really advise a trip here, not necessarily to buy anything, but definitely to experience the atmosphere and the local market people.

The Place To Buy Counterfeit Everything.title: The Place To Buy Counterfeit Everything
The Place To Buy Counterfeit Everything.body: Petaling Street is KL's place to buy everything possible counterfeit. Handbags, t shirts, watches, wallets, belts-you name it. From Gucci to Prada to Ted Baker to Zara, from the highest end brands to the more affordable brands-you ll find fake products in all categories. Behind the street stalls you will find old retail establishments selling inexpensive merchandise of all type including indigenous Chinese products, medicine, fabric, gems, china.These days though there are more Bangladesh, Indian, Pakistani hawkers than Chinese. And whoever the salesman, be prepared to bargain. If they start at 300 RM, say you cant pay more than 80 or 100. Then say you ll buy two whats the best price. They ll come down even more. Then pretend to walk away or check elsewhere, he ll give you an even better rate until he settles mid way. But only ask price if you are really interested in buying, some salesmen take great offence if you ask price and then dont follow through. And some of these guys can get a bit rough if they get ticked off. Watch out for your pocket and belongings though, stay clear of secluded alleys/corners. Take a bagpack to carry what you buy, and take plenty of water. And while you get a great bargain for whatever you buy dont expect world class products. Like the old proverb "What is good is not cheap, and what is cheap is not good."After you finish here, head over to Central Market, or Mydin

Busy Busy Busy.title: Busy Busy Busy
Busy Busy Busy.body: Our hotel was situated here and boy is it load and busy. Throughout the day, before the vendors are set up, it is nice to walk through but at night it is hectic, people jabbing at youu to busy things or eat at their place and you won't get a good reply when you say no. Maybe worth a visit one time just for the experience!

Same same.title: Same same
Same same.body: Market stalls filled with fake replicas at a decent price IF you can haggle like a pro! Same old stuff in every stall and aggressive owners get boring. Must take a taxi to get there so save the fare and buy real goods

A must-go - great fun!!.title: A must-go - great fun!!
A must-go - great fun!!.body: The Petaling Street Markets in Chinatown are a must-do when visiting KL.  I personally had a ball.  I went on a Sunday around 11 am, so many stalls still opening.  Some great finds if you like the knock-off luxury stuff - which I do - it's all great fun.  Be prepared to haggle, this is expected.  The food barrows are great photo opps, but personally I wouldn't risk eating off them ... perhaps next time.

Not what we expected.title: Not what we expected
Not what we expected.body: Thought a visit to China town would be a like other "China towns" in other countries . It was a large market, selling all types of knockoffs, hand bags,watches etc. Vert hot and there are lots of stalls,selling the same things.

Easy to navigate, great temples.title: Easy to navigate, great temples
Easy to navigate, great temples.body: Definitely a must to see the Taoist temples along with the Hindu temple.  They are unique and each tell a story about the Malaysian people.

Everything under the sun sold here.title: Everything under the sun sold here
Everything under the sun sold here.body: You can get pretty much anything here.  The street has a sign and is covered so no hot sun beating down on you.

Different then what we expected.title: Different then what we expected
Different then what we expected.body: We expected China and Chinese in China town and what we found were hundreds of people from Bangladesh selling fake watches, sunglasses etc. Not much to do with China but worth visiting even if you are not planning tk buy anything.Hint - be careful with the prices. I am said to be a good negotiator so buying 3 small petronas towers RM 15 each, instead of 45 I negotiated finally 20 for 3 of them. Then 15 minutes later in the Sentral Market the same toweres were RM 7 each. I love negotiating but fkr those who dont - dont bother to buy anyting in China Town.

Uninspiring.title: Uninspiring
Uninspiring.body: The whole Chinatown area in KL is pretty horrible and really not worth the effort to visit. You're far better off visiting Chinatown districts in other major cities. The markets are shabby and the people dodgy, and a high proportion of the vendors aren't even Chinese. Best avoided.

Nothing special at all.title: Nothing special at all
Nothing special at all.body: This whole area is really quite disappointing . Nothing particularly interesting to see and the shops are generally pretty poor. Compared to Chinatown districts in other cities it's generally a very poor comparison. Not really worth the effort to visit.

Busy, hot, crowdy....title: Busy, hot, crowdy...
Busy, hot, crowdy....body: If you do not like tight hot places avoid it, but otherwise it's worth a visit if you are already in the area of central market.Huge amount of fake stuff of not so good quality. Watches were really pitifully looking as were the sneakers and stuff. We bought almost nothing, just a spinner for the daughter which was fist offered to us for 50MYR and we bought it for 22 at the end...We got Uber from hotel to here, but wifi was not working at the Central Market so we had to take taxi back from chinese market. Do know what to pay, they will want to trick you in paying double or more!!!

Level Up You Bargain Skill Before Going.title: Level Up You Bargain Skill Before Going Here
Level Up You Bargain Skill Before Going.body: A great place for sightseeing but if you want to buy stuffs from here, be really careful. You should know the rough price of all items you wanna buy since they will sell it in really high price at first. Bargain is the main point here. Try to bargain at least 30% of the first price they offer, and try to walk away if they won't lower the price. Usually they will call you back and give the price you asked. So, good luck!

Bustling & Crowded!.title: Bustling & Crowded!
Bustling & Crowded!.body: Visited this market and found it very interesting with its numerous stalls! The sellers were quite friendly and encouraged people to stop at their stalls. If you want cheap "designer" bags, souvenirs, watches, clothes etc this is the "go to" place. All of the sellers tried their hardest in convincing buyers that they had the best products and prices in the market! Remember to haggle though and don't be scared to go much lower than they propose, you will be surprised how quickly they would agree a sale once you turn to walk away!! Every tourist must visit this market and they open till late.

Alluring but Disappointing.title: Alluring but Disappointing
Alluring but Disappointing.body: The place is full of cheap items but quality is always doubtful. You have to do lots of bargaining to get the best price and check the items before you purchase. Afterwards the shopkeepers may not recognize you even if you produce the voucher, though hardly anyone gives the voucher.

Same Same.title: Same Same
Same Same.body: We loved it and went a few times to shop and eat. Very busy with people, a bit full on at times, but thats ok for some but not everyone would be happy with that. Found some good food there, looked dodgy but very good.Very hot and congested.

normal.title: normal
normal.body: This is the normal market, many  cities have places similar this. Only have two rules> bargain and all is fake. But not only fake , usually is really bad quality.Only bargain market.Not good if you like buy good things.

Normal.title: Normal
Normal.body: This is the normal market at night, similar around the world. Take care with the values. About the products are all fakes. Take care at night.

fake place.title: fake place
fake place.body: This is a traditional chinatown place. Two rules: all fake and you need bargain and bargain. Many times the fake products are with very bad quality ( almost ever )Good place to by malasya shirts or similars. Not more.Take care at night.

Test your bargain skills.title: Test your bargain skills
Test your bargain skills.body: If you know to how to bargain, then you can have lots of stuff at reasonably low price. For a Gucci ladies hand bag, price quoted was 150 RM, finally my friend brought it at 35 RM. Most of the products are replica.

You have to come here!!.title: You have to come here!!
You have to come here!!.body: I really enjoyed my visit to the market in China Town. There were so many stores selling great holiday gifts and souvenirs and the store owners were great to haggle with.... i certainly got some bargains. It's quite nice that the market is indoors aswell as outside as you can escape into the aircon when it gets a bit hot to be walking around.We hoped there would be more choice of places to eat unless we were not looking in the right places. We found somewhere in the end and had a quick sandwich and also managed to slip in visited to the nearby Chinese and Hindu temples.As a tourist this is a got to visit attraction!!

Busy but brilliant!.title: Busy but brilliant!
Busy but brilliant!.body: We were staying right next to the Chinatown markets so we spent some time there. It was great fun trying to barter with the sales people. You can also pick up great colourful clothes for next to nothing. The people are pushy though so it's important to keep on moving !

A wonderful experience - foods and shopp.title: A wonderful experience - foods and shopping
A wonderful experience - foods and shopp.body: A busy day and night street market - a place to buy almost anything. But just a word of caution; you will need to bargain for the price of good sold by the vendors. I had not seen so much fake stuff on public display and on offer to the buyers. Tried the noodle with fish ball soup shop. But prices are steep and more to cut throat the tourist. So be warned and be conscious of this.

Fun to walk through but be cautious.title: Fun to walk through but be cautious
Fun to walk through but be cautious.body: The stalls are packed together making walking as a group difficult and very hot. The sellers can be quite forward and if you stop and look at anything they will persist with you, make sure you haggle and go very low with your offer.  And remember it is all fake goods here, but fun souvenirs.

Insults, scams, scandals and swearing.title: Insults, scams, scandals and swearing
Insults, scams, scandals and swearing.body: Do not visit this place. It is full of fake brands of everything you can think about. The fake brands is not the problem as yes some people like to buy them, the problem is the people selling the fake products along with other normal traditional products.They are rude, they insult and swear you when you do not buy their things and they make the price of the items expensive when they know you are a tourist. I have even seen myself while having a coffee next to a fake brand store that two Malaysian ladies asked the price of an item and the shop keeper while bargaining with them said that this is the cheapest as you know in this market we charge different prices for tourists and different prices for locals. So beware. When they see your face they charge you 10x more and even after bargaining they have still overcharged you. They also have a habit of luring you into their shop and forcing you to buy from them and when u dont they abuse you. They make you feel trapped in their shop. They insult you and swear when you leave their shop so all the other shop keepers can hear, to make those shop keepers think you are a bad customer. It is not a crime to look and not buy, so you do not deserve this.Do not get involved in this cheap market. Its not worth the trauma. You can walk past to get the experience but do not engage with the cheap quality shop keepers who have no respect whatsoever. In one shop I had asked the price of an item and because I didnt buy it when I left he started screaming 'cheap' and 'rubbish' down the road at me. After speaking to many other foreigners in the food court we all shared the same experience about how bad the market is and how we will never come back. Upon leaving the market I had also witnessed an Australian woman and her husband fighting with a shop keeper who mucked them about. At this point it was not shocking as it became a normal scene in this market.

Do Bargain !.title: Do Bargain !
Do Bargain !.body: China Town in Kuala Lumpur is the best option for cheap shopping - items like T Shirts, Key chains, Watches, Belts, Purses etc. U can buy the same models/ look likes of Branded goods at cheap prices. But bargaining is adviced.

Worth a look.title: Worth a look
Worth a look.body: I have been to Petaling Street numerous times over the last 10 or so years. There is now a roof which is an improvement if the weather is wet! I had read some reviews that made me second guess my wish to return to Petaling street, but it really is similar to what it always was. The initial price on some items was particularly high, but the sellers came down to something more reasonable without too much carry on. There was a discussion on one thread about the use of walkie talkies to fix prices. We didn't have this experience, and from my experience the walkie talkies are helpful in finding items from other vendors. We visited as part of the hop on hop off bus. Last bus leaves 7pm.

Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia - Chinatown - Gr.title: Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia - Chinatown - Great Bustling Area
Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia - Chinatown - Gr.body: Petaling Street is the focused main street running through Chinatown but the side streets, smells and people are what make this Chinatown so good. There's the usual stalls selling anything and everything you can imagine on the cheap, mainly aimed at the tourists but there's also the wonderful unique stalls and food places which add to the whole atmosphere. The characters, not all Chinese, and the wonderful food add to a bustling area which is busy but not too busy. Spend a few hours wandering round and bartering with the stall holders and grab a bit and a drink at prices way below the majority of the city and you'll love it. We did.

Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia - Petaling Stree.title: Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia - Petaling Street - Decent Main street in Chinatown
Kuala Lumpur - Malaysia - Petaling Stree.body: Petaling Street forms the main street market for the larger Chinatown area in KL and is somewhat cleaner and more modern than some of the side streets off it. here you will find a multitude of cheap souvenir shops offering bargains whilst all around there are food stalls and small eateries including collective hawkers. It has a certain vibrant feel about it though the highly decorated Petaling Street does seem to be a more up market part of Chinatown, if this can be said. I liked it, but preferred the side streets.

Mostly flea market.title: Mostly flea market
Mostly flea market.body: The area was alright, but it was largely a tourist flea market with some decent food along the outsides. If you're looking for a cheaper beer this might be the place as the Chinese restaurants have some pretty good deals.

Scam Market.title: Scam Market
Scam Market.body: Visited this market yesterday. Petaling street leads to this market.The worst market ever being too.Get ready to be abused with vulgar words if you go in their stalls and don't buy.You will be called bad names.Stall holders come onto the Isles and out of their stalls to swear you.Its a highly stressful place to be in. It is definitely not the way to shop. They offer all fake goods .A bag starting  price will 180 ringet. But the last price and real price of the bag is 70 to 80 ringet. .so one needs to firstly chop the price in half and then a further quarter to reach the price that is real and fair. The local Malaysian are sold things at one price and tourists another price. The tourist are very well known to the stallholders.On the day I visited this market I met a lot of the tourists were being sworn only for viewing the goods and not buying. I became very fearful to even touch the stallholders goods and most fearful to enter as well.The stallholders leave their stalls to come onto the Isles and swear you so that no other stallholder will receive you in their stall. No one wants to be abused for their own money.Stay clear from this market. Quality is really poor as well.

Vulgar abusive stallholders.title: Vulgar  abusive stallholders
Vulgar abusive stallholders.body: I visited Petaling Street yesterday. Petaling Street leads into Chinatown. Be ready to be sworn by stallholders with abusive words should you not buy in their stall.They are the rudest stall holders and can quickly turn from friendly to abrupt and can embarrass people.It was highly stressful buying in this market. Petaling Street and Chinatown sells fake branded goods from bags to shoes to clothing.The stallholder starts asking for a bag from 180 ringet but the price is about 60 ringet.Most people settle around 100 ringet for the price.But all asking prices must be chopped in half and then further chopped by a quarter to get the actual real price. Tourists are well known to the stallholders.There is a different price set for the local people of Malaysia and a different price for tourists. A place that I will never go again. The food is unhygienic and health authorities of Malaysia should visit this place. No one wants to be abused for their money. Stay clear from this area

Hot in the city.title: Hot in the city
Hot in the city.body: The heat the sounds the smells words cannot describe the warren of stalls people and food. We as a family decided to head to chinatown on our last night in KL before we headed back to Heathrow and then onto another connecting flight. As I walked down pass the stalls selling everything from fish heads to football jerseys I decided (before I passout from heatstroke) that we needed a drink. We sat outside the "foodhall" deciding where to go for dinner. After a couple of drinks we decided to hell with it !! We would try the local food hall how bad could it be ... The food hall is a tent with all the locals each selling their own food you order (make sure to ask how much it is after you have finished giving your order) as you dont pay till it comes to your table. The food was superb total bill €12.00 for 5 people. We ended up being the very last to leave. Its not the cleanest looking but the food is fresh and we didnt get ill...Result !! and it was a night I will remember for a long time so be adventerous.

NOT TOO CROWDED LIKE I EXPECTED.title: NOT TOO CROWDED LIKE I EXPECTED
NOT TOO CROWDED LIKE I EXPECTED.body: I went here after 5 years and found this place not as crowded as how it was before. I recommend this place if you want to search for cheap souvenir or look for fake product but looks like original. Try your hard to bargain the price twice cheaper than its given, because sellers will give you ridiculous prices at first. If you like to play 'hard to get' this place is is perfect for you. When your bargained price is not acceptable but you still thought it's acceptable, pretend to go, then the seller will give in and give you the price you wanted.In my experience, it's more ridiculous. I captivated by this small red bag, branded one (of course fake). I asked for price and he gave me RM 150. It's ridiculous then I started to babling about how bad the quality is, I asked for 70 but he won't give in. So I left the place then after a bit further, he called me to say it's ok for 70. But, my dignity told me not to come back, so I didn't. Then he then shouted out to lower the price till RM50. In the end I didn't come back tho.

A marked with a lot of souvenirs, like a.title: A marked with a lot of souvenirs, like all this type of markeds.
A marked with a lot of souvenirs, like a.body: The Chinatown was ok, but mostly souvenirs and tourist junk. Beside this its a nice place to walk around and look at all the people and shops.

CHEAP GREAT SOUVENIERS.title: CHEAP GREAT SOUVENIERS
CHEAP GREAT SOUVENIERS.body: There were 8 of us that went here. We arrange a central meeting point so if any of us got lost we could meet up in 1hr hour. Then we slowly took row by row / or street by street as a group always checking where each of us were.Ok so lets be real you will not find original /authentic stuff here its all knock off but really good knock offs.  Dont take the 1st or 2nd price as being the price. If you dont mind haggling you can walk out with a suitcase full of stuff. ( Literally one of the girls with us bought that much that she then haggled for a suitcase to buy to fit it all in to take home ) we had lots of fun here and had lots of laughs with the locals.Micahel Cors hand bags Lui Vuitton etc... sunglasses ray bans/ versace etx on offer.Be nice to them not to aggressive and you can walk out with some amazing deals.Keep your wallets and handbags out of sight so you dont get pick pocketed.Mens and Ladies watches. anything you can think of even dvds of course copies you probably buy 10 dvds and 2 arent good quality but the rest are you can get then for roughly $2 - $3 a movie. You can generally get new release movies.There is a good food court with cheap local food if you are game enough to try it.Take a bottle of water with you as you will build up a sweat in the heat shopping.Always love coming back to KL to come to China Town its a must everytime we come here.

Haggle Haggle Haggle.title: Haggle Haggle Haggle
Haggle Haggle Haggle.body: Start by halving what they ask for!Walk away if you don't like the price they will soon say yes.Lots of hanbags, scarves, electrical etc.

Celebrating Jeremy and Mei-Li's Wedding.title: Celebrating Jeremy and Mei-Li's Wedding
Celebrating Jeremy and Mei-Li's Wedding.body: Meeting Mei-Li's family for traditional Chinese Street Food, excellent food, great ambience fantastic aromas , colours and exceptional prices.

One of the best China towns I've been to.title: One of the best China towns I've been to!
One of the best China towns I've been to.body: If you love fake designer brands and all out hustle and bustle this is the place for you! The haggling is fun and you can get an absolute bargain. The food is yummy around there too! The only downside is everything is the same. There are only the odd few stalls that have different items and you are far less able to haggle with these. I do however love this place!

A good place to buy souvenirs and fruits.title: A good place to buy souvenirs and fruits!
A good place to buy souvenirs and fruits.body: t is a pity that in Chinatown so little Chinese cafe. But we bought Souvenirs at the best price in KL and also a wonderful Chinese tea. Real! A couple of great t-shirts. Don't get fooled by jewelry and watches))

With all the street shopping and gastron.title: With all the street shopping and gastronomy
With all the street shopping and gastron.body: The area is dotted with flea shops. However, you'll come across the same stuff in many shops. Foodies will love this place, but it's not meant for pure vegetarians

Hated it..title: Hated it.
Hated it..body: Hated the noise. Hated the bustle. Hated the forgeries. Hated the lack of manners. Hated the smell. Hated the way it is completely exaggerated to be in any way interesting to people from the West. There are loads of Chinatown's in the world and I've been to at least five of them. This is the worst by some way.

Luv Chinatown.title: Luv Chinatown
Luv Chinatown.body: It's always a pleasure to go to Chinatown for shopping and for dining. So much to choose from. By day or night it's a experience you should not miss out on.

Fantastic experience great meal in basic.title: Fantastic experience great meal in basic surroundings.
Fantastic experience great meal in basic.body: Went for wander around stars in evening a hive activity, great genuine fakes especially handbags. Found a fantastic restaurant  within the market great for people watching, cheap beer and tasty, plentiful food.

Food and cheap stuff - good place to go..title: Food and cheap stuff - good place to go.
Food and cheap stuff - good place to go..body: If you ok with crowds - it's a place for you. You can find a lot of street food and a huge choice of cheap clothes, bags, electronics... Great place to go, my favourite place to eat in Kuala Lumpur. Try peanut pancake from older man! Best in town :)

one of the MUST SEE in KL.title: one of the MUST SEE in KL
one of the MUST SEE in KL.body: Petaling street is the heart of China town in KL. I believe it's a must see once you are coming to KL. Even if tday most of the spots are not operated by Chinese anymore, it's a colourful mix of products, fakes and lots of food. Bargain with the sales people and try the food if you dare. A Chinese temple and an Indian temple are just around the corner and central markest is just across the street.

Good for shopping.title: Good for shopping
Good for shopping.body: This place is great for shopping fake/copy items, local products, souvenirs, clothes, shoes, watched etc.Bargain for better deals.

Cheap Buys.title: Cheap Buys
Cheap Buys.body: Must visit for the shree variety of original fakes on sale. Watches, bags, souvenir, luggage and food. It's all there and depending upon your bargaining tricks you  an land a great deal. Be sure to check the quality before paying up.

China town with no chinese...title: China town with no chinese..
China town with no chinese...body: Well this area change a lot, chinese people is unseen here. Dirty place and the neighbourhood feels unsafe.

Great place If you like Chinese food: th.title: Great place If you like Chinese food: they have planets of small food spots
Great place If you like Chinese food: th.body: This Chinatown was right next door to Central Market. We walked around a bit and had lunch in this small noodles place. Too bad it was so hot outside we couldn't walk around that much.

Running the Gauntlet.title: Running the Gauntlet
Running the Gauntlet.body: Visit first night after Ramadan constant pressure to buy impossible to look at anything withoutItem being forced on to you

Chinatown Walk.title: Chinatown Walk
Chinatown Walk.body: We walked through Chinatown as part of a longer walk - relatively early at mid-late morning to avoid the hustle and bustle around lunchtime, but early enough to still see all the stores open.The shops are the same rubbish knock off bags you can get everywhere, as well as tourist bits which we managed to get a good bargain on - start at 70-80% off and don't budge.Food especially cheap in this area.

What is the fuss about?.title: What is the fuss about?
What is the fuss about?.body: I am not sure what is the fuss about this place. If you have been to Thailand and seen their night markets well then this is just half of that in size and quality of products. We did have some cheap beer and awesome food in the middle of the market. If you are a foodie I would recommend this place for just that :D

Typical Chinatown market.title: Typical Chinatown market
Typical Chinatown market.body: If you have been to chinatown markets before then this one is no different. Rows and rows of shops with lots and lots of eateries. Lot of inexpensive stuff with limited durability. Nice to meander here if you have no work to do. Definitely should not be on a must do list..

Good food poor market.title: Good food poor market
Good food poor market.body: I went on a food tour around Chinatown,the restaurants are plentiful and food was very good,but the outside night market was poor,basic handbags and fake tat! Ok for an hour to have dinner and a drink but that's all!

SHOPPING! SHOPPING! SHOPPING!.title: SHOPPING! SHOPPING! SHOPPING!
SHOPPING! SHOPPING! SHOPPING!.body: Good for all tourist-y shopping, yes it mostly counterfeit but its at counterfeit prices! quality isn't good but still value for money. remember to bargain hard!!

Cool place, similar to most Chinatowns a.title: Cool place, similar to most Chinatowns around the world.
Cool place, similar to most Chinatowns a.body: Good to eat some time, wondering the stalls, don't miss the little pathways behind the front stalls as there are a few shops and eateris worth checking out if you're bored.If i went back to KL i would probably go back here, has a nice atmosphere and if a tropical shower starts it's a good place to hide for 30 mins!

Avoidable.title: Avoidable
Avoidable.body: Interested in fakes .. this is the place to visit.. and one need to haggle to get a discount.. check the quality before buying ..

Good for loads of souvenirs.title: Good for loads of souvenirs
Good for loads of souvenirs.body: Fun to do for an hour, but afterwards you'll be fed up with all people trying to convince you into their shop... Negotiate well on your prices, 30% of what is asked is a very reasonable price.

GOOD PLACE FOR SOUVENIRS.title: GOOD PLACE FOR SOUVENIRS
GOOD PLACE FOR SOUVENIRS.body: It's a good place to buy cheap souvenirs and some fake products. You can find some food stalls as well, and I think that around 19:00 is the best time to go, because you will find a lot of people and all the stalls will be opened.

Such busy, crazy, fun.title: Such busy, crazy, fun
Such busy, crazy, fun.body: Visited Chinatown on Saturday night and it was everything we expected - colourful, busy, bright, fun. All the usual stalls and tiny little crowded paths to squeeze your way through with the smells and sights and sounds. Stall owners friendly and not pushy or rude at all. Such a fun night.

Shopping Shopping.title: Shopping Shopping
Shopping Shopping.body: variety of items for sales,  clothes, bags, souvenir, gadgets, home decor etc. You can bargain and take the best price. the quality is good for clothes and bags.

Changed hugely over the years.title: Changed hugely over the years
Changed hugely over the years.body: This has been part of the KL "must visits" since time immemorial.It has changed greatly over the years - from being largely run by Malaysians to being run by foreigners such as Nepalis, Myanmarese, Bangladeshis, Pakistanis, and the like - much like the adjoining Central Market, just across the road.It's still a magnet for seekers of cheap kitsch. Fake brand sunglasses, belts, t-shirts, bags etc. all abound. But there are areas of KL less notorious and less tourist-trap than this. Ask Malaysian friends to take you to a good pasar malam where you'll find most of these items anyway.TIP FOR TRAVEL: Got Uber? Use it. This area and Central Market are among the favourite hunting grounds of taxis looking to make a swift buck off tourists. Because it's hard to locate a pick-up point, go to the nearby Maybank and tell the driver you'll be waiting there.

Cheap Shoppers delight.title: Cheap Shoppers delight
Cheap Shoppers delight.body: A multitude of stores selling a wide range of goods (especially watches) to cater for the bargain hunter shopper. Haggle with prices of something you are interested in but don't haggle with taxis insist on meter. Great little restaurants for food options too.

Nothing much to explore.title: Nothing much to explore
Nothing much to explore.body: As most of the products here are fake one, from clothes, bags, shoes, anything. I come here at night, after 6:00pm so most of the chinese restaurant around already closed, only the stores inside the market. I think it's better to come here at day time so you can feel the Chinese's atmosphere and also to try some Chinese food.

For experience.title: For experience
For experience.body: To experience the local feel, this is a great place to walk around and try the street food around. Many shopping and meals choice

Its nice, very busy though..title: Its nice, very busy though.
Its nice, very busy though..body: A great Chinatown. Good to experience but at the same time its like many other Chinatowns I've see all around the world. Good to get some souvenirs and to experience it but i wouldn't put it on your 'must-see' or 'must-do' list.

Just another over priced tourist market.title: Just another over priced tourist market
Just another over priced tourist market.body: 4 into a 9 day stay and I can openlynsay this market is no different to any other tourist market in SEA.It's relatively quiet compared to the likes of Jonker Stret and Batu Ferhinggi of Penang... but sells the same stuff.Bags; trainers; clothes etc etc.Vastly over priced market though.I'm after a big bag to help me carry home additional items I've acquired during 2.5 years of travel.Chinese shops on Leboh Pudu area show a "fake" too brand hold all as 69 MYR...... I've been quoted 140myr on the market for the exact same bag... even to haggle I can only get down to 80myr.. and that's even after telling them I can buy it cheaper in a shop.I spent one night wasting the night away asking for prices on certain items and was quoted on average 100% more than the local shops were selling the exact same items.Its okay to walk around; even last night (today is first day of idul fitri) chinatown was very busy with many locals buying from the local shops, but Petaling street market was relatively quiet in comparison  except for the foreign and local tourists walking around.I have the market a 3 marks.... people need to make money and if others are happy spending too much then so be it.I enjoy talking with market sellers and interacting with them... so 3 marks it is.

Central market!.title: Central market!
Central market!.body: Great spot for souvenirs, there is even a DHL located right at the entrance. So many great shops. Most people spoke English making it easy to get around.

Hustle and Haggle!.title: Hustle and Haggle!
Hustle and Haggle!.body: If "designer" handbags and €20 Rolex is your thing then you have found your spot! Prepare to be hassled to stop at every stall you pass and haggle for everything and walk away if they won't agree to sell at the price you are offering as 9 times out of ten they will call you back and tell you how much you are fleecing them but trust me after seeing the quality of most of what's on offer you will be the one fleeced😀It's an interesting way to pass an hour in KL......

Good tourist stop but not great shopping.title: Good tourist stop but not great shopping
Good tourist stop but not great shopping.body: Very busy flea-market style shopping outdoors spread out over 4 streets.  Most of the vendors are selling the same stuff. Very high pressure sales tactics and bartering and generally low quality items. Definitely worth a visit simply for the experience though.

Good place for soveniers and shopping.title: Good place for soveniers and shopping
Good place for soveniers and shopping.body: If you.looking to buy soveniers like fridge magnets, I.love kl t-shirts, twin towers replicas, etc then.this is the best place and probably the cheapest place to buy but be prepared to use your bargaining skills. However I prefer the fixed price shop near the hotel( can't remember the name) where you can buy t-shirts for RM 6 and twin towers starting from RM 4. There is an accessories shop right opposite this sovenier shop which is also a  fixed price shop where you can get nice neck.pieces,sling bags, watches,etc. The market is also good for buying clothes, watches,toys,mobile accessories and bags. Though not a big fan of buying second copies of bags as the leather got ripped off of the bags that I had  bought .but all.in all good for shopping but do use for bargaining skills.

shop street.title: shop street
shop street.body: centre of Chinatown, shopping and eating street, with many options, particuarly at night time when it gets busy

Shopping street.title: Shopping street
Shopping street.body: with many guesthouses location along this street, it gets busy at night with the stalls set up and places to eat

Crowded bustle.title: Crowded bustle
Crowded bustle.body: With shops up to late at night, and places to eat, this seems to be the hub of downtown KL at night.

Only the deco is Chinese.title: Only the deco is Chinese
Only the deco is Chinese.body: It's still called Chinatown and the decor looks it, but most of the businesses here are run by Bangladeshis and Nepalis.It's known for imitation goods so be warned.  The vendors also can be outright rude.

Wasted Trip.title: Wasted Trip
Wasted Trip.body: The stores are similar in what they sell. Mostly are counterfeit shoes wallets I presumed. Walk one round that's it

Wow, Best Market in Malaysia.title: Wow, Best Market in Malaysia
Wow, Best Market in Malaysia.body: A must see if you are in KL.  This bustling shopping area has market stalls, shops, cafes, bars, massage parlours, banks and a host of other attractions to keep you amazed.  Its very hot so take or buy water and keep your bag/purse safe but other than that its a truly unique experience. You can buy almost anything here, fake goods, food, this list is endless.  Lots of locals shop here too and prices are good but do some bargaining, you can always get a cheaper price.

Great Shopping!.title: Great Shopping!
Great Shopping!.body: This is a fabulous place to stroll round and take in the sights and sounds of KL.  There are stalls and shops, food stalls, restuarants, bars and massage parlours but not the seedy kind, you can have aromatherapy, back and neck message, foot massage and is suitable for anyone.  Most of the parlours are a little like beauty salons with chaise longues for the massages and people laying in rows. Men and women perform the massage and after a day in the heat its very relaxing.  The food courts are great although there is no English translations, the locals welcome you and are helpful.  A point and not system works well and the prices are incredibly cheap. Like every where in Asia, there is a fake goods market and you can buy sports goods, handbags, shoes, watches, perfume and clothes and knock down prices.  Lovely lively atmosphere all the time and plenty to see - guard your     bag/purse as pickpockets are rumoured to be around.
